Sense.DEF: the 21st letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第二十一个字母

Sense.DEF: used to describe a film that has been officially approved as suitable for people of any age
Sense.TRAN: U 级〔指经官方审看批准适合各年龄段观众观看的电影〕

Sense.DEF: a mark given to a student’s work to show that it is extremely bad
Sense.TRAN: 非常差〔学生功课的等级符号〕

Sense.DEF: a way of writing ‘you’, used especially in emails and text messages
Sense.TRAN: 你〔you 的一种写法﹐尤用于电子邮件和手机短信中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I love U!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爱你！

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写=university大学
Sense.EXAMPLE: Indiana U
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印第安纳大学

Sense.DEF: a type of plane that has no pilot, used especially for gathering information and taking photographs
Sense.TRAN: 无人驾驶飞机〔尤用于搜集信息和拍照〕

Sense.DEF: better, larger, or greater
Sense.EXAMPLE: uberbabe Pamela Lee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超级宝贝帕梅拉·李
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to do something uber-cool with my webpage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想给我的网页弄点超酷的东西。

Sense.DEF: seeming to be everywhere – sometimes used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 似乎无处不在的〔有时为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Coffee shops are ubiquitous these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今好像到处都是咖啡馆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a French film, starring the ubiquitous Gérard Depardieu
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部法国电影﹐由家喻户晓的热拉尔·德帕迪约主演

Sense.DEF: a German submarine, especially one that was used in the Second World War
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在第二次世界大战中使用的〕(德国)U型潜艇

Sense.DEF: the part of a cow, female goat etc that hangs down between its back legs and that produces milk
a strange object in the sky, that some people believe is a spaceship from another world
the sound that people make when something is extremely unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ugh! That’s disgusting!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 呀！那真恶心！

Sense.DEF: extremely unattractive and unpleasant to look at
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very ugly man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常丑陋的男子
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ugliest building in town
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城里最难看的建筑
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nick’s dog is as ugly as sin very ugly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克的狗难看得要命。

Sense.DEF: used to describe a situation which is very bad or violent, and which makes you feel frightened or threatened
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were ugly scenes as rival gangs started attacking each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敌对帮派之间开始相互攻击﹐出现了很可怕的场面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ugly incident
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怕的事件

Sense.DEF: ugly ideas, feelings, remarks etc are unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 〔观念﹑感情﹑话语等〕令人不愉快的﹐讨厌的﹐丑恶的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jealousy is an ugly emotion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嫉妒是一种丑恶的情感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ugly rumors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难听的传言

Sense.DEF: someone who is less attractive, successful etc than other people, but who becomes beautiful and successful later
Sense.TRAN: 丑小鸭〔指起初不如别人、后来变得出类拔萃之人〕

Exponent.DEF: very pleasant to look at - used about people, objects, and buildings
Exponent.TRAN: 〔人﹑物品及建筑〕丑陋的﹐难看的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She thinks she’s ugly but she’s not.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以为自己丑﹐可她并不丑。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an ugly block of flats
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 难看的公寓楼
Exponent.EXAMPLE: cheap ugly furniture
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 丑陋的廉价家具

Exponent.DEF: not pleasant to look at. Unattractivesounds more formal and less strong than ugly.
Exponent.TRAN: 无吸引力的﹐不漂亮的〔unattractive比ugly正式﹐且语气较弱〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an attractive modern town which was built during the 1960s
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 建于20世纪60年代的难看的现代小镇
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Women found him unattractive.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 女人觉得他毫无魅力。

Exponent.DEF: not pleasant to look at, and spoiling the appearance of something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Unsightly red spots started to appear on her face.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上开始出现一个个难看的红疙瘩。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The windows have been blocked off with unsightly metal bars.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗子用有碍观瞻的金属栅栏封了起来。

Exponent.DEF: extremely ugly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His hideous face twisted into a smile.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那丑陋的面孔上挤出一个笑容。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a hideous concrete shopping center
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幢奇丑无比的混凝土购物中心

Exponent.DEF: extremely ugly, especially in a way that makes you want to look away
Exponent.TRAN: 令人厌恶的﹐令人反感的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His appearance was so repulsive he had to wear a mask.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他相貌太丑﹐不得不戴面具。

Exponent.DEF: extremely ugly in a strange or unnatural way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A grotesque figure appeared out of the darkness.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑暗中出现了一个丑陋的身影。

Exponent.DEF: something that is so ugly that it spoils the appearance of an area
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Local residents regard the new office building as an eyesore.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地居民认为那幢新建的办公楼太碍眼。

Sense.DEF: an American travelling abroad who behaves in a way that people find offensive, especially by showing a lack of understanding of, or lack of interest in, the culture and way of life of other countries
Sense.TRAN: 丑陋的美国人〔指在国外时举止粗鲁﹑不尊重他国文化及生活方式的美国人〕

Sense.DEF: two characters in the fairy tale about Cinderella. They are Cinderella’s sisters, and are ugly and treat her very badly. In the UK, the story is often performed as a pantomimea humorous play for children, and the Ugly Sisters are almost always played by male actors.
Sense.TRAN: 丑姐姐〔童话《灰姑娘》中女主角后母带来的两个姐姐〕

Sense.DEF: a range of radio waves that produces a very good quality of sound
a sound that you make to say ‘yes’, or when you want someone to continue what they are saying
Sense.TRAN: 嗯〔表示肯定的答复﹐或者希望对方继续说下去〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I sit here?’ ‘Uh huh.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我可以坐在这里吗？”“嗯。”

Sense.DEF: a sound that you make when you have made a mistake, or when something bad is going to happen
Sense.TRAN: 哎哟﹐哎呀〔表示做错了事或坏事将要发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Uh-oh, I think I just deleted all my work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀﹐我想我刚刚把干的活儿都删除了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Uh-oh! Here she comes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎哟！她来了。

Sense.DEF: milk that has been heated to a very high temperature to preserve it
a sound that you make to say ‘no’
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Is Paul here yet?’ ‘Uh-uh.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “保罗到了没有？”“啊﹐没有。

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= the United Kingdom 英国

Sense.DEF: a musical instrument with four strings, like a small guitar
Sense.TRAN: 尤克里里琴〔一种类似小吉他的四弦琴〕

Sense.DEF: of or relating to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: glandular fever
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 腺热﹐传染性单核细胞增多症
Sense.EXAMPLE: tubular steel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢管

Sense.DEF: a sore area on your skin or inside your body that may bleed or produce poisonous substances
Sense.EXAMPLE: stomach ulcers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胃溃疡

Sense.DEF: to form an ulcer, or become covered with ulcers
the inner bone of your lower arm, on the side opposite to your thumb
a reason for doing something that you deliberately hide in order to get an advantage for yourself
Sense.TRAN: 别有用心的动机/目的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s just being nice. I don’t think he has any ulterior motives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他就是好心﹐我不认为他别有用心。

Sense.DEF: someone’s ultimate aim is their main and most important aim, that they hope to achieve in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Complete disarmament was the ultimate goal of the conference.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全面裁军是这次会议的最终目标。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our ultimate objective is to have as many female members of parliament as there are male.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的最终目标是要让女性议员人数和男性议员一样多。

Sense.DEF: the ultimate result of a long process is what happens at the end of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ultimate outcome of the experiment cannot be predicted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试验的最后结果无法预测。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ultimate fate of the tribe was even sadder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个部落的最终命运还要悲惨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ultimate failure of the project
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 项目的最终失败

Sense.DEF: if you have ultimate responsibility for something, you are the person who must make the important final decisions about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ultimate responsibility for policy lies with the President.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政策的最终责任由总统担负。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ultimate decision rests with the Public Health Service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后的决定权属于公共卫生部。

Sense.DEF: better, bigger, worse etc than all other things or people of the same kind
Sense.TRAN: 〔同类中〕最出色的﹔最大的﹔最糟糕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Rolling Stones are the ultimate rock and roll band.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滚石乐队是最出色的摇滚乐队。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The female nude is surely the ultimate test of artistic skill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性裸体画无疑是对绘画技能的最大考验。

Sense.DEF: the best or most modern example of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane was the ultimate in air technology in the ’60s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那种飞机是 60 年代航空技术的最杰出代表。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guy’s home is the ultimate in luxury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖伊的家豪华至极。

Sense.DEF: a competition, similar to boxing, in which two people hit or kick each other and in which there are almost no rules
finally, after everything else has been done or considered
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ultimately, the decision rests with the child’s parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最终﹐决定权在这孩子的父母手中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long but ultimately successful campaign
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场历时很久但最终成功的运动

Sense.DEF: a threat saying that if someone does not do what you want by a particular time, you will do something to punish them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The club gave him an ultimatum – either he apologized, or he would be expelled from the team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俱乐部给他下了最后通牒——要么道歉﹐要么等着被开除出队。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The army issued an ultimatum for all weapons in the city to be surrendered on October 26th.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队发出最后通牒﹐必须于 10 月 26 日交出该市的全部武器。

Sense.DEF: extremely
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ultra-modern building
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极现代的建筑
Sense.EXAMPLE: He remained ultra-cautious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一向极其谨慎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ultra-light jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极轻的夹克

Sense.DEF: above and beyond something in a range
Sense.EXAMPLE: ultrasound sound that is too high for humans to hear
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超声(波)

Sense.DEF: a very bright blue colour
ultrasonic sound waves are too high for humans to hear
sound that is too high for humans to hear
a medical process using this type of sound, that produces an image of something inside your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: investigation of the liver by ultrasound
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对肝脏作的超声波检查
Sense.EXAMPLE: An ultrasound scan revealed that the baby was a boy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超声波检查显示胎儿是个男孩。

Sense.DEF: ultraviolet light cannot be seen by people, but is responsible for making your skin darker when you are in the sun

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ultraviolet radiation from the sun
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳发出的紫外线辐射

Sense.DEF: to cry out with a long high sound, especially because you are very sad or in pain
used when you cannot immediately decide what to say next
Sense.EXAMPLE: Um, yeah, I guess so.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗯﹐是的﹐我想是这样。

Sense.DEF: having a strong pleasant taste that is not sweet, sour, salty, or bitter, especially like the tastes found in meat, strong cheeses, tomatoes etc
a brown colour like earth
a long narrow tube of flesh that joins an unborn baby to its mother
a strong feeling of belonging to or a strong feeling of relationship with a particular place, person, organization etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: All modern popular music has an umbilical cord linking back to blues and R and B.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有现代流行音乐都和布鲁斯以及节奏布鲁斯有着密不可分的联系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teenage boys especially feel a need to cut the umbilical cord tying them to their mothers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十几岁的男孩特别觉得要摆脱对母亲的依赖。

Sense.DEF: to be offended by something that someone has done or said, often without good reason
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常没有理由地〕(为某事)生气﹐(因某事)见怪

Sense.DEF: an object that you use to protect yourself against rain or hot sun. It consists of a circular folding frame covered in cloth.
Sense.EXAMPLE: It started to rain, so Tricia stopped to put up her umbrella.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始下雨了﹐所以特里西娅停下来撑起雨伞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent the day on the beach, lying under a beach umbrella, reading.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天我就在海滩上度过﹐躺在海滩遮阳伞下面看书。

Sense.DEF: an organization that includes many smaller groups
Sense.TRAN: 〔有众多附属团体的〕伞状组织/团体/机构等

Sense.DEF: a word whose meaning includes many different types of a particular thing
Sense.TRAN: 〔包括多种含义的〕概括词/总称等
Sense.EXAMPLE: District nurses, health visitors, and school nurses will come under the umbrella term ‘community nursing’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地区护士﹑健康访视员和学校护士都归在“社区护理”这个总称下面。

Sense.LEXUNIT: (come/work etc) under the umbrella of sth
Sense.DEF: to be part of a larger organization or involved in the work done by it
Sense.TRAN: 归属于〔较大组织〕﹔由〔较大组织〕负责实施
Sense.EXAMPLE: The international education program came under the umbrella of the State Department.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际教育计划由美国国务院负责。

Sense.DEF: the protection given by a powerful country, army, a weapons system etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the American nuclear umbrella over western Europe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国向西欧提供的核保护伞

Sense.DEF: a sign (..) written over a German vowel to show how it is pronounced
Sense.TRAN: 〔德语中标在元音上方的〕变音符(..)

Sense.DEF: an umpire
the person who makes sure that the players obey the rules in sports such as tennis, baseball, and cricket
Sense.TRAN: 〔网球﹑棒球﹑板球等运动的〕裁判员

PIC.HEADING: UMPIRE 裁判员
PIC.PICCONTENT: umpire 裁判员；referee 裁判员；judges 评判员

Sense.DEF: to be the umpire in a game or competition
very many – used especially when you are annoyed there are so many
Sense.TRAN: 无数的﹐许许多多的〔尤用于感到恼怒时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There seemed to be umpteen rules and regulations to learn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎有无数的规章制度要学习。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’d called the apartment umpteen times, but never got an answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她往公寓打了无数次电话﹐但一直没人接听。

Sense.DEF: if something happens for the umpteenth time, it happens again after having happened many times before – used when you are annoyed that it has happened so often
Sense.TRAN: 第无数(次)的〔尤用于对此感到恼怒时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘This is crazy,’ she told herself for the umpteenth time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这简直是疯了。”她无数次地对自己说。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 构成形容词﹑副词和名词
Sense.DEF: used to show a negative, a lack, or an opposite
Sense.TRAN: 不〔表示“否定”﹑“缺乏”或“相反”之意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: unfair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不公平的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unhappy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不高兴的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unfortunately
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸地
Sense.EXAMPLE: uncertainty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无把握

Sense.DEF: used to show an opposite of a particular action
Sense.EXAMPLE: to undress to take your clothes off
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脱去衣服
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you unpacked yet taken your things out of your suitcase?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你打开行李了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard Lila unlock the front door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到莉拉在前门开锁的声音。

Sense.DEF: an international organization that tries to find peaceful solutions to world problems
a short form of ‘one’, used to say that someone or something is good, bad etc. Teachers and careful speakers of English do not use this expression.
Sense.TRAN: 一个好的/坏的/小的等人[东西]〔one 的缩略式﹔教师以及说英语讲究的人不用这种说法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a bad ’un.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个坏家伙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I ought to collect the little ’uns young children from school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我该到学校去接小家伙们了。

Sense.DEF: not ashamed or embarrassed, especially when doing something unusual or rude
Sense.TRAN: 不害臊的﹐不怕羞的﹔满不在乎的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stared at him with unabashed curiosity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她好奇地盯着他看﹐一点也不难为情。

Sense.DEF: continuing without becoming any weaker or less violent
Sense.TRAN: 不减弱的[地]﹔不衰退的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The storm continued unabated throughout the night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴风雨持续了一夜﹐丝毫没有减弱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: his unabated ambition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那毫不减退的雄心

Sense.DEF: not able to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lucy was unable to find out what had happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西无法知道发生了什么事。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Unable to sleep, I got up and made myself a drink.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我睡不着﹐于是起来给自己倒了杯酒。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that they can’t/couldn’t do sth rather than are/were unable to do sth.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 can’t/couldn’t do sth﹐而不说 are/were unable to do sth
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She couldn’t find out what had happened.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她无法知道发生了什么事 。

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing, speech etc that is unabridged is in its full form and has not been made shorter
Sense.TRAN: 〔文章﹑演讲等〕未删节的﹐全文的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the complete and unabridged works of Dickens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未删节版狄更斯全集

Sense.DEF: something that is unacceptable is so wrong or bad that you think it should not be allowed
Sense.EXAMPLE: I found her attitude totally unacceptable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得她的态度让人完全不能接受。
Sense.EXAMPLE: unacceptable levels of pollution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无法容忍的污染程度

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The recommendations from this report are unacceptable to many black people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告中提出的建议让很多黑人无法接受。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was socially unacceptable to discuss sex then.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候谈论性的问题不为社会所接受。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is unaccompanied has no one with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unaccompanied children are not allowed on the premises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童无成人陪伴不得入内。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The airport X-rays all unaccompanied baggage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 机场用 X 光检查所有托运行李。

Sense.DEF: without something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many large Third World cities have arisen unaccompanied by national industrial growth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第三世界国家许多大城市的兴起并未伴有全国性的工业增长。

Sense.DEF: an unaccompanied singer or musician sings or plays alone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lizzie sang unaccompanied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉齐是清唱的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: works for unaccompanied violin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无伴奏小提琴作品

Sense.DEF: very surprising and difficult to explain
Sense.TRAN: 莫名其妙的﹔无法解释的﹔不可理解的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the unaccountable shyness she always felt in Louise’s presence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在路易丝面前总是感到的莫名羞涩
Sense.EXAMPLE: For some unaccountable reason, he arrived a day early.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知何故﹐他早到了一天。

Sense.DEF: not having to explain your actions or decisions to anyone else
Sense.TRAN: 〔对自己的行为或决定〕不用解释的﹐无须负责的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Doctors still remain largely unaccountable to the public.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生们依然在很大程度上无须就其医疗行为对民众作说明。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is very surprising and difficult to explain
Sense.TRAN: 莫名其妙地﹔无法解释地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unaccountably, the woman had refused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知为什么﹐那个女子拒绝了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The planned military assault on the city yesterday was unaccountably delayed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原计划昨天对那座城市发动军事袭击﹐不知何故推迟了。

Sense.DEF: something or someone that is unaccounted for cannot be found or their absence cannot be explained
Sense.TRAN: 下落不明的﹐失踪的﹔〔某事物或某人的缺席〕不能解释的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two people are still unaccounted for after the floods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洪水过后仍有两人下落不明。

Sense.DEF: not used to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a country boy, unaccustomed to city ways
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个不习惯城市生活方式的乡下男孩

Sense.DEF: not usual, typical, or familiar
Sense.TRAN: 不寻常的﹔非惯例的﹔不熟悉的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was completely exhausted by the unaccustomed heat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反常的炎热使她浑身乏力。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that they are not used to something rather than unaccustomed to it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们表示不习惯某事物时一般说 not used to﹐而不说 unaccustomed to
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t used to living on her own.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不习惯一个人生活 。

Sense.DEF: ignored or not noticed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unacknowledged anger can often cause problems in later life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被忽视的愤怒往往会给以后的生活带来问题。

Sense.DEF: not receiving the public thanks, praise, or reward that something deserves
Sense.TRAN: 没有得到〔应有的〕感谢[赞扬﹐奖励﹐承认]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women’s work in the home tends to be both unpaid and unacknowledged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性在家中的付出往往既无酬劳又得不到承认。

Sense.DEF: someone who is a leader etc but who has not publicly or officially been given that position
Sense.TRAN: 没有得到正式承认的领导/权威等

Sense.DEF: without unnecessary or special features or decorations
Sense.EXAMPLE: They liked their churches to be unadorned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们希望他们的教堂朴素无华。

Sense.DEF: complete or total
Sense.EXAMPLE: a feeling of pure unadulterated pleasure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 百分之百的愉悦感觉

Sense.DEF: not mixed with other less pure substances
not changed or influenced by something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The north remained largely unaffected by the drought.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 北部基本上没有受到干旱影响。

Sense.DEF: natural in the way you behave – use this to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 〔举止〕不装腔作势的﹐自然的〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: her easy unaffected manner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那从容而自然的举止

Sense.DEF: not frightened
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was exhausted but unafraid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她筋疲力尽﹐但是并不害怕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rats were huge and completely unafraid of human beings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些老鼠个头巨大﹐而且一点都不怕人。

Sense.DEF: confident that you can do something or deal with something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a gifted writer who is unafraid of trying new things
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 勇于尝试新事物的天才作家

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an independent woman unafraid to say what she believes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个敢于说出内心所想的独立女子

Sense.DEF: without help
Sense.EXAMPLE: She can no longer walk unaided.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她再也不能独力行走了。

Sense.DEF: complete, pure, or total
Sense.EXAMPLE: unalloyed joy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯粹的喜悦

Sense.DEF: not possible to change
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unalterable fact
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可改变的事实

Sense.DEF: a statement, instruction etc that is unambiguous is clear and easy to understand because it can only mean one thing
Sense.TRAN: 清楚的﹐明确的﹐不含糊的

Sense.DEF: not loyal to generally accepted American customs and ways of thinking
Sense.TRAN: 〔习俗﹑思维等〕不符合美国方式的﹐非美国的
Sense.EXAMPLE: This kind of censorship is un-American.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种审查不是美国人的方式。

EXAMPLE.GLOSS: political activity believed to be harmful to the US

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非美活动〔被认为不利于美国的政治活动〕

Sense.DEF: a state or situation of complete agreement among a group of people
a unanimous decision, vote, agreement etc is one in which all the people involved agree
Sense.TRAN: 〔决定﹑表决﹑协议等〕一致通过的﹐无异议的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was decided by a unanimous vote that the school should close.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关闭学校是大家一致通过的决定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The decision to appoint Matt was almost unanimous.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 任命马特的决定几乎是一致通过的。

Sense.DEF: agreeing completely about something
Sense.TRAN: 一致同意的﹐意见一致的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The banks were unanimous in welcoming the news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 各银行一致欢迎这个消息。

Sense.DEF: happening without anyone expecting or knowing about it
Sense.TRAN: 出人意料的[地]﹔未经通报的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: We arrived unannounced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到得很突然。

Sense.DEF: an unanswerable question is one that cannot be answered
Sense.TRAN: 〔问题〕无法回答的﹐没有答案的

Sense.DEF: definitely true and therefore impossible to argue against
Sense.EXAMPLE: The casereasons for doing something for better public transport is unanswerable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求改善公共交通的理由是无可争辩的。

Sense.DEF: an unanswered question has not been answered
Sense.TRAN: 〔问题〕未回答的﹔未解答的﹔悬而未决的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many other questions remain unanswered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有许多其他问题没有得到解答。

Sense.DEF: an unanswered letter, telephone call, or request for help has not been replied to
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children’s cries for help went unanswered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们的呼救没有得到回应。

Sense.DEF: an unanticipated event or result is one that you did not expect
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unanticipated increase in inflation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀率意想不到的上升

Sense.DEF: not feeling or saying you are sorry for something you have done, especially when other people would expect you to feel or say sorry

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is entirely unapologetic about the violence in his movies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对自己电影中的暴力镜头丝毫没有歉意。

Sense.DEF: not pleasant or attractive
Sense.TRAN: 令人不快的﹔无吸引力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unappealing shade of grey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种难看的灰色

Sense.DEF: food that is unappetizing has an unattractive appearance that makes you think that it will not taste good
Sense.TRAN: 看上去难吃的﹐引不起食欲的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rather unappetizing egg sandwich
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 倒胃口的鸡蛋三明治

Sense.DEF: seeming unfriendly and therefore difficult to talk to
Sense.TRAN: 不友好的﹐冷淡的﹐难以接近的

Sense.DEF: something that is unarguable is definitely true or correct
Sense.TRAN: 不容置疑的﹔无可争辩的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unarguable proof
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不容置疑的证据

Sense.DEF: not carrying any weapons
Sense.EXAMPLE: the killing of unarmed civilians
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对手无寸铁的平民的屠杀

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 徒手格斗

Sense.DEF: not feeling embarrassed or ashamed about something that people might disapprove of
Sense.TRAN: 不知羞耻的﹐恬不知耻的
Sense.EXAMPLE: his unashamed love of money
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对金钱恬不知耻的贪恋

Sense.DEF: if a question remains unasked, no one asks it, often because they are embarrassed
Sense.TRAN: 〔常因不便过问而〕未被问及的

Sense.DEF: if you do something unasked, you do it without anyone asking or inviting you to
Sense.TRAN: 未被要求的﹔未受邀请的
Sense.EXAMPLE: George sat down unasked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治不请自坐。

Sense.DEF: not asked for, and often not wanted
Sense.TRAN: 未经要求的〔常指不需要的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: unasked-for advice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主动提出的建议

Sense.DEF: not able to be criticized, made weaker, or beaten
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unassailable argument
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无懈可击的论据
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party’s position looked unassailable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个党的地位似乎不可动摇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The result gave the team an unassailable lead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个成绩使该队处于难以撼动的领先地位。

Sense.DEF: showing no desire to be noticed or given special treatment
Sense.TRAN: 不张扬的﹔谦逊的﹐不摆架子的

Sense.DEF: not married or involved in a romantic relationship
Sense.TRAN: 未婚的﹐单身的﹔未恋爱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: According to Jo, Mark was still unattached.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据乔说﹐马克仍然单身。

Sense.DEF: not connected or fastened to anything
Sense.TRAN: 无关系的﹔非附属的﹔独立的

Sense.DEF: impossible to achieve
Sense.EXAMPLE: A military victory is unattainable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可能取得军事胜利。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 无法实现的理想/梦想/目标等

Sense.DEF: left alone without anyone in charge
Sense.TRAN: 无人照看的﹐无人看管的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unattended vehicle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆无人看管的汽车
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children should not be left unattended in the playground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可以把儿童留在游乐场无人照管。

Sense.DEF: not attractive, pretty, or pleasant to look at
Sense.TRAN: 无吸引力的﹔不漂亮的﹔不悦目的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unattractive man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有魅力的男子

Sense.DEF: not good or desirable
Sense.EXAMPLE: the unattractive aspects of nationalism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民族主义丑陋的一面

Sense.DEF: without official approval or permission
Sense.EXAMPLE: the unauthorized use of government funds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对政府资金的擅自动用
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unauthorized personnel are not allowed on the premises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未经允许不得入内。

Sense.DEF: not able to be obtained
Sense.EXAMPLE: Funding for the new school is unavailable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座新学校没有经费。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: materials that were unavailable to researchers in the past
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究人员在过去无法得到的材料

Sense.DEF: not able or willing to meet someone
Sense.TRAN: 不能接待的﹔不愿接待的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Officials were unavailable for commentnot able or willing to talk to reporters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 官员们未能接受访问作出评论。

Sense.DEF: not successful or effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: unavailing efforts to make her happy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想使她快乐的徒劳努力

Sense.DEF: impossible to prevent
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are now fears that war is unavoidable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们现在担心战争不可避免。

Sense.DEF: not noticing or realizing what is happening
Sense.TRAN: 未觉察到的﹔未意识到的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mike seems unaware of the trouble he’s causing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克似乎没意识到他所惹的麻烦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was totally unaware that she was being watched.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她完全没有察觉到自己正在被监视。

Sense.DEF: if something takes you unawares, it happens when you are not expecting it and are not prepared
Sense.EXAMPLE: The question caught me completely unawares.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个问题问得我措手不及。

Sense.DEF: without noticing
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had walked unawares over the border.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们无意中越过了边界。

Sense.DEF: to make a situation, relationship, or work of art not as good as it used to be or could be, especially by adding too much of one thing
Sense.TRAN: 打破〔状况﹑关系或艺术作品〕的平衡
Sense.EXAMPLE: Having children can often unbalance even the closest of relationships.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了孩子﹐即使最亲密的关系也常常会失衡。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something unsteady, so that they are likely to fall down
Sense.EXAMPLE: He banged against the cupboard, unbalancing a pile of books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他砰的一声撞到橱柜上﹐撞翻了一堆书。

Sense.DEF: to make someone slightly crazy
someone who is unbalanced is slightly crazy
a report, argument etc that is unbalanced is unfair because it emphasizes one opinion too much
Sense.TRAN: 〔报告﹑论点等〕有失公允的﹐片面的

Sense.DEF: a relationship that is unbalanced is not equal because one person has more influence, power etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔关系〕不平衡的﹐失衡的﹐不平等的

Sense.DEF: too unpleasant, painful, or annoying to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 难以忍受的﹔承受不住的﹔无法容忍的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pain was almost unbearable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那疼痛几乎难以忍受。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was making life unbearable for his parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把父母的生活弄得不堪忍受。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 热得让人无法忍受的一天

Sense.DEF: something that is unbeatable is the best of its kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: carpets at unbeatable prices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格最优惠的地毯

Sense.DEF: a team, player etc that is unbeatable cannot be defeated
a team, player etc that is unbeaten has not been defeated
Sense.TRAN: 未曾被击败的﹔未曾被超越的

Sense.DEF: clothes that are unbecoming make you look unattractive
Sense.TRAN: 〔衣服〕不相配的﹔不合身的﹔难看的

Sense.DEF: behaviour that is unbecoming is shocking or unsuitable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: conduct unbecoming to a teacher
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有失教师身份的行为

Sense.DEF: without that person knowing about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unbeknown to him, his wife had been trying to phone him all morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他哪里知道﹐妻子一上午都在给他打电话。

Sense.DEF: a lack of religious belief, or a refusal to believe in a religious faith
very good, successful, or impressive
Sense.TRAN: 非常好[成功]的﹔好得令人难以置信的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The opportunities are unbelievable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机会好得令人难以相信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unbelievable talent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人称奇的天才

Sense.DEF: very bad or shocking
Sense.TRAN: 非常坏的﹔坏得令人难以置信的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pain was unbelievable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疼痛实在让人受不了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: acts of unbelievable cruelty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人发指的残酷行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was unbelievable that we were expected to pay twice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让人难以相信的是竟然要我们付两次钱。

Sense.DEF: so extreme that it hardly seems possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s so lazy it’s unbelievable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他懒得让人难以置信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unbelievable speed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难以置信的速度

Sense.DEF: very difficult to believe and therefore probably untrue
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yvonne’s excuse for being late was totally unbelievable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊冯娜迟到的理由根本不可信。

Sense.DEF: someone who does not believe in God or a particular religion
to relax and start behaving in a less formal way
unwilling to change your opinions, decisions etc
unbiased information, opinions, advice etc is fair because the person giving it is not influenced by their own or other people’s opinions
Sense.TRAN: 不偏不倚的﹐无偏见的﹐公正的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We aim to provide a service that is balanced and unbiased.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的目标是提供一种公平公正的服务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unbiased observer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名公正的观察员

Sense.DEF: without being asked for, expected, or invited
Sense.TRAN: 未被要求的[地]﹔意想不到的[地]﹔未受邀请的[地]

Sense.DEF: not spoiled by any mistake or bad behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: a law firm with an unblemished reputation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 声誉良好的律师事务所

Sense.DEF: without marks or damage
Sense.EXAMPLE: her smooth unblemished skin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她光洁无瑕的肌肤

Sense.DEF: if you look at something or someone with unblinking eyes, you look continuously at them without blinkingquickly closing and opening your eyes

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His father’s unblinking gaze was fixed on the fire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父亲目不转睛地凝视着炉火。

Sense.DEF: if you unblock a pipe, you remove something that is blocking it

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 疏通马桶/下水道/烟囱等

Sense.DEF: not yet born
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unborn child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未出世的孩子

Sense.DEF: extreme or without any limit
Sense.EXAMPLE: the child’s unbounded energy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这孩子无穷的精力

Sense.DEF: not willing to give up or accept defeat – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 不屈的﹐不服输的〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the fight, Ali was bloody but unbowed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那场拳赛打完﹐阿里虽尝败绩但并不服输。

Sense.DEF: not able to be broken
Sense.EXAMPLE: unbreakable glass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不碎玻璃

Sense.DEF: unbridgeable differences between two people, groups, or ideas are so big that no one will ever agree about them or be satisfied with them
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个人﹑团体或观念之间的分歧〕无法弥合的﹐无法逾越的

GramExa.PROPFORM: unbridgeable gulf/gap/chasm etc (between sb/sth and sb/sth)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the unbridgeable gulf between the rich and the poor
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 富人和穷人之间无法逾越的鸿沟

Sense.DEF: not controlled and too extreme or violent
Sense.TRAN: 放纵的﹐不受控制的﹔激烈的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unbridled greed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无节制的贪婪

Sense.DEF: continuing without being interrupted or broken
Sense.TRAN: 未中断的﹔未破损的﹐完整的
Sense.EXAMPLE: their unbroken record of success
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不断成功的纪录
Sense.EXAMPLE: a time of unbroken peace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 持续和平的时期

Sense.DEF: to unfasten the buckle on a belt, a shoe etc
to tell someone your problems, secrets etc so that you feel better
to undo the buttons on a piece of clothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took off his sweater and unbut­toned his shirt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脱去毛衣﹐解开衬衫的扣子。

Sense.DEF: behaviour or remarks that are uncalled for are not fair or suitable
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为﹑言辞〕不公正的﹔不合适的

Sense.DEF: very strange and difficult to explain
Sense.EXAMPLE: an uncanny coincidence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可思议的巧合

Sense.DEF: not looked after or not looked after properly
Sense.TRAN: 没人照顾的﹔未得到适当照顾的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dogs looked hungry and uncared for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这几只狗看上去很饿﹐好像没人照顾的样子。

Sense.DEF: never stopping
Sense.EXAMPLE: his unceasing efforts to help the poor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他帮助穷人的不懈努力

Sense.DEF: in a rough or sudden way, without showing any respect or politeness
Sense.EXAMPLE: He grabbed her arms and hauled her unceremoniously to her feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抓住她的手臂﹐粗暴地把她拉起来。

Sense.DEF: feeling doubt about something
Sense.TRAN: 不确定的﹐无把握的﹐拿不准的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was uncertain how much further he could walk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不清楚自己还能走多远。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was uncertain about what to do next.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我拿不定主意接下来要做什么。

Sense.DEF: not clear, definite, or decided
Sense.TRAN: 不清楚的﹔未确定的﹔难预料的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is uncertain how likely this is to occur.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出现这种情况的可能性有多大还不清楚。

Sense.EXAMPLE: My whole future now seemed uncertain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在我的前途似乎是个未知数。

Sense.DEF: if you tell someone something in no uncertain terms, you tell them very clearly without trying to be polite
Sense.TRAN: 直截了当地﹐毫不含糊地
Sense.EXAMPLE: I told Colin in no uncertain terms what I thought of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我直截了当地告诉科林我对他的看法。

Sense.DEF: if someone walks in an uncertain way, they seem as though they might fall
Sense.EXAMPLE: She took a few uncertain steps forward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她摇摇晃晃地向前走了几步。

Sense.DEF: when you feel doubt about what will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Times of great change are also times of uncertainty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生巨大变革的时期也是动荡的时期。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is a great deal of uncertainty about the company’s future.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的前景有很多未知因素。

Sense.DEF: a situation which you are not sure about because you do not know what will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: life’s uncertainties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人生的无常

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the uncertainties of old age
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年生活的不确定性

Sense.DEF: a belief, idea etc that is unchallengeable is definitely true and cannot be questioned or argued with
Sense.TRAN: 不可挑战的﹔不可争辩的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unchallengeable evidence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不容置疑的证据

Sense.DEF: if someone’s power or authority is unchallengeable, it cannot be taken from them
accepted and believed by everyone and not doubted
Sense.TRAN: 未引起争论的﹔无异议的﹐未引起质疑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She couldn’t let a statement like that go unchallenged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不能对那样的话放任不理。

Sense.DEF: someone who goes somewhere unchallenged is not stopped and asked who they are or what they are doing
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕未受到盘查的﹐行程顺利的

Sense.DEF: always staying the same
not typical of someone or something and therefore surprising
Sense.TRAN: 不典型的﹐不代表〔某人或某物的〕特性的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s uncharacteristic of her to be late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迟到可不是她的作风。

Sense.DEF: unkind or unfair in the way you judge people
Sense.TRAN: 苛刻的﹐不宽厚的﹔不公正的﹔挑剔的
Sense.EXAMPLE: uncharitable remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刻薄的言辞

Sense.DEF: a situation or activity that you have never experienced or tried before
Sense.TRAN: 全新的局势﹔全新的领域
Sense.EXAMPLE: This new project will take us into uncharted territory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个新项目将把我们带入未知的领域。

Sense.DEF: not marked on any maps
Sense.EXAMPLE: an uncharted island
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地图上未标明的岛屿

Sense.DEF: if something bad or harmful goes unchecked, it is not controlled or stopped and develops into something worse
Sense.TRAN: 〔坏事〕未受抑制的﹐未受制止的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We cannot allow such behaviour to continue unchecked.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不能允许这样的行为继续下去而不加制止。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This habit, if left unchecked, may cause serious problems later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种习惯如果听之任之﹐以后可能会引发严重问题。

Sense.DEF: behaviour that is uncivilized is rude or socially unacceptable
societies that are uncivilized have a very simple way of life, and have not developed social, legal, economic etc systems
the brother of your mother or father, or the husband of your aunt
Sense.EXAMPLE: I went to stay with my uncle and aunt for a few days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去和叔叔婶婶住了几天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Uncle Philip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲利普叔叔
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was very excited about becoming an uncleyour sister or your brother’s wife has a child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要做舅舅了﹐我很激动。

Sense.DEF: used by children, in front of a first name, to address or refer to a man who is a close friend of their parents
Sense.TRAN: 叔叔﹐伯伯〔儿语﹐用于称呼父母的朋友〕

Sense.DEF: used by children to tell someone to admit they have been defeated
Sense.TRAN: 叫叔叔〔儿语﹐用于要求某人认输〕

Sense.DEF: morally or spiritually bad
Sense.TRAN: 不道德的﹔肮脏的﹔邪恶的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unclean spirit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶灵

Sense.DEF: unclean food, animals etc are those that a particular religion says must not be eaten, touched etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔宗教上指食物﹑动物等〕不洁的

Sense.DEF: dirty
Sense.EXAMPLE: unclean drinking water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不洁净的饮用水

Sense.DEF: difficult to understand or be sure about, so that there is doubt or confusion
Sense.TRAN: 难懂的﹔不肯定的﹔不清楚的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The terms of the contract are very unclear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合同的条款非常含糊。

Sense.DEF: to not understand something clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m rather unclear about what I’m supposed to be doing here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不太明白我在这儿该做些什么。

Sense.DEF: the US, or the US government, sometimes represented by the figure of a man with a white beard and tall hat
Sense.TRAN: 山姆大叔〔指美国或美国政府﹐有时用一个留白须﹑戴大礼帽的男人形象来代表〕

Sense.DEF: a black person who is too respectful to white people – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 汤姆叔叔〔指对白人毕恭毕敬的黑人﹔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: not wearing clothes
if you uncoil something, or if it uncoils, it stretches out straight after being wound around in a circle
Sense.TRAN: 解开〔卷着的东西〕﹔(使)展开
Sense.EXAMPLE: Slowly, the snake uncoiled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛇慢慢地伸展开盘着的身躯。

Sense.DEF: not feeling physically comfortable, or not making you feel comfortable
Sense.TRAN: 不舒服的﹔令人不舒适的
Sense.EXAMPLE: This sofa is so uncomfortable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张沙发太不舒服了。

Sense.DEF: unable to relax because you are embarrassed
Sense.EXAMPLE: She always felt slightly uncomfortable in a hat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她戴帽子总是觉得有点不自在。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an uncomfortable silence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人不安的沉寂

Sense.DEF: not having decided or promised to support a particular group, political belief etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: uncommitted voters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未表明态度的选民
Sense.EXAMPLE: So far, they are uncommitted to his plan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到目前为止﹐他们对他的计划还是不置可否。

Sense.DEF: rare or unusual
Sense.EXAMPLE: Violent crimes against the elderly are fortunately very uncommon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸好针对老年人的暴力犯罪非常罕见。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is not uncommon for sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is not uncommon for students to have bank loans.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生有银行贷款并不少见。

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: an uncommonly cold morning
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 异常寒冷的早晨

Sense.DEF: willing to accept a difficult or unpleasant situation without complaining
Sense.TRAN: 顺从的﹔没有怨言的﹐不诉苦的

Sense.DEF: not understanding what is happening
unwilling to change your opinions or intentions
Sense.TRAN: 不妥协的﹐不让步的﹔坚定的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an uncompromising opponent of democratic reform
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主改革的坚决反对者

Sense.DEF: when you do not care about something that other people worry about

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the government’s apparent unconcern about high inflation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府对高通货膨胀率明显的漠不关心

Sense.DEF: not worried about something because you think it does not affect you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many large companies seem totally unconcerned about the environment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多大公司似乎根本不关心环境。

Sense.DEF: not interested in a particular aim or activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: unconcerned with making a profit
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对赚钱不感兴趣的

Sense.DEF: not limited by or depending on any conditions
Sense.EXAMPLE: the unconditional release of all political prisoners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有政治犯的无条件释放
Sense.EXAMPLE: unconditional surrender
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无条件投降

Sense.DEF: a report etc that has not been proved or supported by official information
Sense.TRAN: 未经证实的报道/说法/传闻等
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve received unconfirmed reports of an explosion in central London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们收到一些未经证实的报道﹐说伦敦市中心发生了爆炸。

Sense.DEF: if two events, facts, or situations are unconnected, they are not related to each other in any way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The murders are probably unconnected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些谋杀案之间很可能没有关联。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wolf’s work is completely unconnected to the current study.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沃尔夫所做的事情和目前的研究毫不相干。

Sense.DEF: much more than is reasonable or acceptable
Sense.TRAN: 不合理的﹔过度的﹔难以接受的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The war caused an unconscionable amount of suffering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争造成了太多的苦难。

Sense.DEF: unable to see, move, feel etc in the normal way because you are not conscious
Sense.TRAN: 不省人事的﹐失去知觉的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was found alive but unconscious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被找到时还活着﹐但已不省人事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Levin was knocked unconscious by the impact.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莱文被那记猛击打昏了。

Sense.DEF: a feeling or thought that is unconscious is one that you have without realizing it
Sense.TRAN: 〔感觉或想法〕无意识的﹐未意识到的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an unconscious need to be loved
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 潜意识中被爱的需求

Sense.DEF: to not realize the effect of something you have said or done
Sense.TRAN: 未意识到某事物﹐未觉察到某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doreen appeared to be unconscious of the amusement she had caused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多琳似乎并未意识到她把大家逗乐了。

Sense.DEF: an action that is unconscious is not deliberate
the part of your mind in which there are thoughts and feelings that you do not realize you have
unconsidered remarks or actions are made without care or thinking about the possible results
Sense.TRAN: 〔评论或行动〕未经思考的﹐轻率的

Sense.DEF: not allowed by the constitutionset of rules or principles by which a country or organization is governed
Sense.EXAMPLE: claims that the President’s action was unconstitutional
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 认为总统行为违宪的说法

Sense.DEF: an uncontested action or statement is one that no one opposes or disagrees with
Sense.EXAMPLE: After an uncontested divorce, Peggy married Charlie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和平离婚之后﹐佩姬嫁给了查利。

Sense.DEF: an uncontested election is one in which only one person wants to be elected
if an emotion, desire, or physical action is uncontrollable, you cannot control it or stop yourself from feeling it or doing it
Sense.TRAN: 〔情感﹑欲望或动作〕控制不住的﹐无法抑制的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt an uncontrollable urge to scream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到一种控制不住想要尖叫的冲动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mother burst into uncontrollable sobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲突然情不自禁地抽噎起来。

Sense.DEF: someone who is uncontrollable behaves badly and will not obey anyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The presence of some uncon­trollable children spoilt the evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个无法无天的孩子的出现破坏了那个晚上的气氛。

Sense.DEF: if a situation is uncontrollable, nothing can be done to control it or stop it getting worse
Sense.EXAMPLE: uncontrollable bleeding
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 止不住的出血
Sense.EXAMPLE: uncontrollable inflation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失控的通货膨胀

Sense.DEF: uncontrolled emotions or behaviour continue because you are not trying to stop them
Sense.TRAN: 不加约束的﹔不加抑制的
Sense.EXAMPLE: uncontrolled weeping
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 痛哭

Sense.DEF: very different from the way people usually behave, think, dress etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: unconventional political views
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与众不同的政治观点

Sense.DEF: not persuaded that something is true or good
Sense.EXAMPLE: I remain unconvinced that the idea will work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还是不相信这个想法可行。

Sense.DEF: failing to make you believe that something is true or real
Sense.TRAN: 不令人信服的﹔难以置信的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unconvincing smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 勉强的笑意
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unconvincing explanation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让人难以信服的解释
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some readers will find the arguments unconvincing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些读者会认为那些论据没有说服力。

Sense.DEF: food that is uncooked has not been cooked
Sense.EXAMPLE: Always wash your hands after handling uncooked meat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碰过生肉后一定要洗手。

Sense.DEF: not fashionable or acceptable – used especially by young people
Sense.TRAN: 不时髦的﹐不潇洒的﹐不酷的〔尤为年轻人使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you seen his shorts? They are just so uncool!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看到他的短裤了吗？ 太土了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was uncool to get on well with teachers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和老师关系好可不酷。

Sense.DEF: not willing to work with or help someone
someone who is uncoordinated is not good at physical activities because they cannot control their movements effectively
a plan or operation that is uncoordinated is not well organized, with the result that the different parts of it do not work together effectively
Sense.TRAN: 〔计划或行动〕安排不周的﹐不协调的

Sense.DEF: to open a bottle by removing its cork
Sense.TRAN: 拔去…的瓶塞﹐打开…的瓶塞

Sense.DEF: an uncorroborated claim or statement is one which is not supported by any proof
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was convicted on the uncorroborated evidence of the alleged victim.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据所谓的受害人提供的没有佐证的证词﹐他被判定有罪。

Sense.DEF: an uncountable noun has no plural form and refers to something which cannot be counted or regarded as either singular or plural, for example ‘money’ or ‘happiness’. In this dictionary uncountable nouns are marked [U].
Sense.TRAN: 〔名词〕不可数的〔如 money, happiness 等﹔在本词典中不可数名词以[U]标示〕

Sense.DEF: to separate one piece of machinery, one part of a train etc from another that it is connected to
Sense.TRAN: 拆开﹐分离﹐分开〔机器﹑火车等的部件〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Evidence suggests that the wagon was deliberately uncoupled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有证据显示车厢是被人为断开的。

Sense.DEF: behaving and speaking in a way that is rude or socially unacceptable
Sense.TRAN: 〔言语和行为〕粗鲁的﹐不文明的

Sense.DEF: to find out about something that has been kept secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: Customs officials uncovered a plot to smuggle weapons into the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海关官员侦破了一个走私武器入境的阴谋。

Sense.DEF: to remove the cover from something
unable or unwilling to see faults in something or someone – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 无鉴别力的﹔不加批评的〔含贬义〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John’s mother is totally uncritical of his behaviour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰的母亲对他的行为完全不加批评。

Sense.DEF: the person who is thought to be the best or most famous in a particular activity
Sense.TRAN: 某活动的无冕之王/女王﹐…最出色者
Sense.EXAMPLE: the uncrowned king of jazz
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爵士乐的无冕之王

Sense.DEF: very determined and not easily persuaded not to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: her uncrushable will to survive
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那坚定的求生意志

Sense.DEF: too friendly and praising people too much in a way that seems very insincere
Sense.TRAN: 甜言蜜语的﹐假殷勤的﹐谄媚的

Sense.DEF: to stretch out straight from a curled position, or to make something do this
a film, book etc that is uncut has not been made shorter, for example by having violent or sexual scenes removed
Sense.EXAMPLE: the uncut version of ‘Lady Chatterley’s Lover’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《查泰莱夫人的情人》的未删节版本

Sense.DEF: an uncut jewel that is still in its natural form has not been cut into a particular shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: uncut diamonds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未经切割的钻石

Sense.DEF: a letter, article, painting etc that is undated does not have a date written on it
not afraid of continuing to try to do something in spite of difficulties or danger
Sense.TRAN: 无畏的﹐勇敢的﹐不泄气的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Undaunted by the enormity of the task, they began rebuilding the village.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不畏任务艰巨﹐开始重建村庄。

Sense.DEF: not having made a decision about something important

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m still undecided about how I’ll vote.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没有决定如何投票。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nadine was undecided whether or not to go to college.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 娜丁尚未决定是否去上大学。

Sense.DEF: a game or competition that is undecided has no definite winner
not officially announced or called something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scandal involving undeclared payments to politicians
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一桩涉及未申报的政治献金的丑闻
Sense.EXAMPLE: an undeclared civil war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不宣而战的内战

Sense.DEF: not showing your feelings of love or friendliness
definitely true or certain
Sense.TRAN: 不可否认的﹐无可争辩的
Sense.EXAMPLE: undeniable proof
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 确证

Sense.DEF: below or at a lower level than something, or covered by something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wendy had hidden the box under her bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温迪把盒子藏在了自己的床底下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sailed under the Golden Gate Bridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在金门大桥下航行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Write your name under your picture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在你的照片下面写上名字。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could see something glittering under the water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到水下有东西在闪闪发光。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was wearing a jacket under his coat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在大衣里面穿了件夹克。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Under her arm, she carried a large portfolio.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她腋下夹了个大公文包。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In summer, we often slept under the stars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天﹐我们经常露宿星空之下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d scare my mom by diving in and staying under staying under the water for as long as I could.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会跳进水里﹐在水下待到憋不住为止﹐以此来吓唬我妈妈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bench collapsed under the weight ofunable to support the weight of so many people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长椅承受不住这么多人的重量塌了。

Sense.DEF: less than a particular number, amount, age, or price
Sense.TRAN: 〔数字﹑数量﹑年龄或价格〕低于﹐少于﹐在…以下
Sense.EXAMPLE: These toys are not suitable for children under five.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些玩具不适合五岁以下的儿童玩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the events listed cost under £60.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所列活动项目的花费大多低于 60 英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spend just under four hours a day seeing customers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一天接待客户所花的时间将近四小时。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Children aged 12 or under must be accompanied by an adult.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 12 岁及 12 岁以下儿童必须由成人陪同。

GramExa.GLOSS: be too young to legally drink, have sex etc

Sense.DEF: used to say what is being done to something or how it is being dealt with

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The possibility of employing more staff is still under discussionbeing discussed, considered etc.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于是否可以招聘更多员工的问题仍在讨论之。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: All categories of expenditure are under review.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 各项开支正在审查中。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Four new power stations are currently under construction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有四座新的发电站目前正在建设中。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The port was coming under attack from enemy warships.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个港口正遭到敌舰的攻击。

Sense.DEF: affected by a particular condition, influence, or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been under a lot of pressure at work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她工作压力很大。

GramExa.PROPFORM: under the influence of alcohol/drink/drugs etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was accused of driving while under the influence of alcohol.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被控酒后驾车。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The operation was carried out while she was under general anaesthetic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手术在她全身麻醉的状态下进行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m glad to see that you have everything under control.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很高兴看到一切都在你的控制之中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two of our national parks are currently under threat from road schemes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前筑路计划可能使我们的两个国家公园遭到破坏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor injected something into my arm and I immediately felt myself going underbecoming unconscious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生往我手臂里注射了一种东西﹐我便立即失去了知觉。

Sense.DEF: if something happens under particular conditions, it happens when those conditions exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish I’d met him under different circumstances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真希望不是在这种情况下遇见他的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The system operates well under normal conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正常情况下这个系统运转良好。

Sense.DEF: according to a particular agreement, law etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the question of whether the trade is illegal under international law
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据国际法那笔生意是否违法的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: Under the terms of the agreement, the debt will be repaid over a 20-year period.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据这项协议的条款﹐这笔债务将在 20 年内还清。

Sense.DEF: if something happens under a particular leader, government etc, it happens when they are in power
Sense.EXAMPLE: a program initiated under President Clinton and continued under President Bush
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在克林顿总统时期启动﹑布什总统时期继续实施的一个计划
Sense.EXAMPLE: Under her leadership, the magazine’s circulation doubled in less than a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在她的领导下﹐这份杂志的发行量不到一年就翻了一倍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would it have been different under a Labour government?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果是工党执政﹐会有改变吗？

Sense.DEF: if you work under someone, they have a higher position in the company, organization etc than you, and they help to direct your work
Sense.TRAN: 在…手下工作﹐在…的管辖下
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had a total staff of ten working under her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一共有十名员工在她手下工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: From 1847 to 1851 he served under Captain John Randolph Stokes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1847年至1851年﹐他在约翰·伦道夫·斯托克斯上校手下服役。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At Cambridge he studied under was a student of F. R. Leavis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在剑桥大学期间师从 F. R. 利维斯。

Sense.DEF: used to say in which part of a book, list, or system particular information can be found
Sense.TRAN: 在…下面〔表示某个信息可以在书﹑清单或系统中的某个地方找到〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The baby’s records are filed under the mother’s last name.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝的记录归档在母亲的姓氏下。

Sense.DEF: if you write or do something under a particular name, you do it using that name instead of your real name
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made a few records under the name of Joe Ritchie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用乔·里奇的名字录制了几张唱片。

Exponent.DEF: something that is under something else has that thing directly above it or covering it
Exponent.TRAN: 在…下面﹐在…底下〔两者之间没有其他物体〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The pen was under the desk.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢笔在书桌下面。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She had a T-shirt on under her sweater.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在毛衣里面穿了件T恤衫。

Exponent.DEF: in a lower position than something else, though not always directly under it
Exponent.TRAN: 〔位置〕低于﹐在…之下〔不一定是正下方〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: From the cliffs we could barely see the people on the beach below us.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在峭壁上几乎看不到下面海滩上的人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His apartment is below ours on the left.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的公寓在我们的左下方。

Exponent.DEF: under - used especially to emphasize that something covers, touches, or hides something
Exponent.TRAN: 在…下面﹐在…底下〔尤用于强调某物覆盖﹑接触或掩盖另一物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The girls wear shorts underneath their cheerleading skirts.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩们在啦啦队短裙下面穿了短裤。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I found the book underneath the sofa.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在沙发底下找到了那本书。

Exponent.DEF: under or at a lower level
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They strolled hand in hand beneath the summer moon.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们手拉手在夏夜的月光下散步。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The water lies just beneath the surface of the earth.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 水就在地表之下。

Sense.DEF: less of an action or quality than is correct, needed, or desired
Sense.EXAMPLE: underdevelopment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欠发达
Sense.EXAMPLE: undercooked cabbage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没煮熟的卷心菜

Sense.DEF: going under something
Sense.EXAMPLE: an underpassa road or path that goes under another road
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地下通道

Sense.DEF: inside or beneath other things
Sense.EXAMPLE: undergarments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内衣

Sense.DEF: less important or lower in rank
Sense.EXAMPLE: a head gardener and three under-gardeners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名主管花匠和三名辅助花匠

Sense.DEF: someone who does not do as well at school or at work as they could do if they worked harder
Sense.TRAN: 〔学习或工作上〕未充分发挥潜力者

Sense.DEF: too young to legally buy alcohol, drive a car, vote etc
Sense.TRAN: 未成年的﹐未及法定年龄的
Sense.EXAMPLE: underage drinking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未成年饮酒

Sense.DEF: if you throw a ball underarm, you throw it without moving your arm above your shoulder
relating to or used on your armpits
Sense.EXAMPLE: underarm hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 腋毛
Sense.EXAMPLE: underarm deodorants
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 腋下除臭剂

Sense.DEF: an underarm throw is one where you throw a ball without moving your arm above your shoulder
Sense.EXAMPLE: underarm bowling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低手投球

Sense.DEF: the hollow area under your arm, where it joins your body
the unpleasant parts of a place or society that are normally hidden

GramExa.EXAMPLE: photographs that capture the underbelly of the United States – its poverty, its injustice, and its alienated underclass
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 捕捉美国社会中贫穷﹑不公正以及被孤立的底层阶级等阴暗面的照片

Sense.DEF: the weakest part of an organization or a person’s character, that is most easily attacked or criticized
Sense.TRAN: 〔机构或某人性格中的〕脆弱点﹐最薄弱部分

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They needed to find the soft underbelly of their opponents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们需要找出对手的软肋。

Sense.DEF: the lower part of an animal’s body, including the stomach
bushes, small trees etc growing under and around larger trees in a forest
Sense.TRAN: 〔长在森林中大树下的〕下层灌木丛﹐下木

Sense.DEF: if a business is under­capitalized, it has not been given enough money to operate effectively
the wheels of an aircraft, train etc and the structure that holds them
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机的〕起落架﹔〔火车等的〕底盘

Sense.DEF: to charge too little or less than the correct amount of money for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city is grossly undercharging charging far too little companies to use the land.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座城市对公司用地收取很少的费用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They undercharged me by about $2.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们少要了我大约2美元。

Sense.DEF: the lowest social class, consisting of people who are very poor and who are not likely to be able to improve their situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: an urban underclass, who have limited access to health care
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能充分享受医疗服务的城市贫困阶层

Sense.DEF: a student in the first two years of school or college
Sense.TRAN: 低年级学生〔指中学或大学的一二年级学生〕

Sense.DEF: clothes that you wear next to your body under your other clothes
a layer of paint that you put onto a surface before you put the final layer on
undercover work is done secretly by the police in order to catch criminals or find out information
Sense.TRAN: 〔警方行动〕暗中进行的﹔秘密干的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an undercover investigation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 秘密调查

GramExa.EXAMPLE: undercover detectives
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 密探

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a cop who goes undercover to catch drug dealers
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 暗中行动抓捕毒贩的一名警察
RunOn.EXAMPLE: He worked undercover in Germany and Northern Ireland.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在德国和北爱尔兰做地下工作。

Sense.DEF: a feeling, especially of anger or dissatisfaction, that people do not express openly
Sense.TRAN: 暗流﹐潜伏的情绪〔尤指愤怒或不满〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He sensed an undercurrent of resentment among the crowd.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉察出人群中有一股潜在的不满情绪。

Sense.DEF: a hidden and often dangerous current of water that flows under the surface of the sea or a river
to sell goods or a service at a lower price than another company
Sense.TRAN: 以低于〔他人〕的价格出售
Sense.EXAMPLE: Online bookstores can undercut retailers by up to 30%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 网上书店最多能以低于零售店 30% 的价格销售。

Sense.DEF: to make something weaker or less effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is a lack of self-confidence undercutting your performance at work?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是不是缺乏自信影响了你的工作表现？

Sense.DEF: a country, area etc that is poor and where there is not much modern industry
not having grown or developed as much as is usual or necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: a baby born with underdeveloped kidneys
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肾脏先天发育不全的婴儿

Sense.DEF: a person, team etc that is weaker than the others, is always expected to be unsuccessful, and that is often treated badly
Sense.TRAN: 处于劣势的人[队]﹔弱者﹐弱方
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crowds often feel sympathy for the underdog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众经常会同情弱者。

Sense.DEF: not completely cooked
wearing clothes that are too informal for a particular occasion
working in a job where you cannot use all your skills or where there is not enough work for you to do
Sense.TRAN: 大材小用的﹐未能人尽其才的﹔就业不足的

Sense.DEF: to think or guess that something is smaller, cheaper, easier etc than it really is

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We underestimated how long it would take to get there.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们低估了到那里所需的时间。

GramExa.PROPFORM: underestimate the importance/extent/effect/power etc of sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Never underestimate the power of the press.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝不要低估新闻界的力量。

Sense.DEF: to think that someone is not as good, clever, or skilful, as they really are
a guessed amount or number that is too low
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fourteen percent may be an underestimate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 14%可能是低估的。

Sense.DEF: to not let enough light reach the film when you are taking a photograph
not given enough food to eat
soft material that you put between a carpet and the floor
Sense.TRAN: 〔置于地板与地毯之间的〕地毯垫毡

Sense.DEF: a heating system that is designed to go under the floor in a building
under your feet where you are walking

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wet wood is very slippery underfoot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 脚下的湿木头很滑。

Subsense.DEF: to crush someone or something on the ground by stepping heavily on them
to completely destroy someone or something

Sense.DEF: a project, organization etc that is underfunded has not been given enough money to be effective

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our education system is seriously underfunded.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的教育系统资金严重不足。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: underfunding in the National Health Service
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 国民医疗服务体系的资金不足

Sense.DEF: a piece of underwear
if you undergo a change, an unpleasant experience etc, it happens to you or is done to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country has undergone massive changes recently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家最近经历了巨大的变化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has been released from prison to undergo medical treatment in the United States.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获释出狱去美国接受治疗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has been undergoing tests since Monday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从星期一开始一直在接受各种检查。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers should be expected to undergo mid-career training and development.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师应该参加中期职业培训和发展活动。

Sense.DEF: a student at college or university, who is working for their first degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: second-year undergraduates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学二年级学生

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 大学本科学生/课程/学位等

Sense.DEF: below the surface of the earth
Sense.EXAMPLE: an underground passage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地下通道
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car park is underground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 停车场在地下。

Sense.DEF: an underground group, organization etc is secret and illegal
Sense.TRAN: 〔团体﹑组织等〕地下的﹐秘密的﹐不合法的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an underground terrorist organization
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地下恐怖主义组织

Sense.DEF: underground literature, newspapers etc are read by a small number of people, and would seem slightly strange or shocking to most people
Sense.TRAN: 〔文学作品﹑报纸等〕小众的﹐非主流的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the underground press
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小众报刊

Sense.DEF: under the earth’s surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: This animal spends most of its life underground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种动物一生中的大部分时间都待在地下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: nuclear waste buried deep underground
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 深埋在地下的核废物

Sense.DEF: to start doing something secretly, or hide in a secret place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ANC was forced to go underground when its leaders were arrested.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 领导人被捕之后﹐非洲国民大会被迫转入地下。

Subsense.DEF: a railway system under the ground
an illegal group working in secret against the rulers of a country
Subsense.TRAN: 〔反政府的〕地下组织﹐秘密团体

Sense.DEF: bushes, small trees, and other plants growing around and under bigger trees
Sense.TRAN: 〔长在大树下或周边的〕下木层﹐下层灌木丛

Sense.DEF: dishonest and done secretly
Sense.EXAMPLE: They did it all in such an underhand way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一切他们都进行得如此隐秘。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been involved in some underhand dealings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他参与了一些秘密交易。

Sense.DEF: if you throw a ball underhand, you throw it without moving your arm above your shoulder
thick material that is put between a carpet and the floor
Sense.TRAN: 〔地毯和地板之间的〕厚垫料﹐垫层

Sense.DEF: to be the cause of something, or be the basic thing from which something develops
Sense.TRAN: 作为…的原因﹔构成…的基础
Sense.EXAMPLE: the one basic principle that underlies all of the party’s policies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贯穿该党各项政策的那一条基本原则

Sense.DEF: to draw a line under a word to show that it is important
to show that something is important
Sense.EXAMPLE: This tragic incident underlines the need for immediate action.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一悲剧事件突显了立即采取行动的必要性。

Sense.DEF: an insulting word for someone who has a low rank – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 下属﹐部下﹔走卒〔侮辱性用词﹔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: the cause, idea etc that is the most important, although it is not easily noticed
Sense.TRAN: 根本的原因/原则/问题等
Sense.EXAMPLE: the underlying causes of her depression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抑郁的根本原因
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is an underlying assumption that younger workers are easier to train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一种潜在的假设﹐认为年轻一些的雇员容易培训。

Sense.DEF: a ship, office etc that is undermanned does not have enough workers to operate effectively
Sense.TRAN: 人员不足的﹐人手不够的

Sense.DEF: to gradually make someone or something less strong or effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: economic policies that threaten to undermine the health care system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能会损害医疗保健制度的经济政策

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The constant criticism was beginning to undermine her confidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不断的批评开始削弱她的信心了。

Sense.DEF: directly under another object or covered by it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got out of the car and looked underneath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他下车往底下看了看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s near where the railway goes underneath the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它靠近铁路从公路下方穿过的地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was wearing a smart jacket with a T-shirt underneath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿了件时髦的夹克﹐里面是一件 T 恤衫。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her blonde hair was hidden underneath a baseball cap.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一顶棒球帽裹住了她的满头金发。

Sense.DEF: on the lower surface of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car was rusty underneath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车的底部生锈了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A number had been painted underneath the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桌子底下涂有一个数字。

Sense.DEF: used to say what someone’s character is really like when their behaviour shows a different character
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seems confident, but she’s really quite shy underneath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看起来自信﹐其实相当腼腆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think he’s a genuinely nice guy underneath it all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为他本质上是个非常好的人。

Sense.DEF: the bottom surface of something, or the part of something that is below or under something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to paint the underneath with a rust preventer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要用防锈漆把底部刷一下。

Sense.DEF: unhealthy and weak because you have not had enough food or the right type of food
earning less money than you deserve for your work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teachers are overworked and underpaid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师工作量太大﹐报酬太低。

Sense.DEF: a short piece of underwear worn by men under their trousers
a short piece of underwear worn under trousers by men or women
a road or path that goes under another road or a railway
Sense.TRAN: 地下通道﹔下穿交叉道﹔下层通道

Sense.DEF: to pay someone too little for their work
if a business underperforms, it does not make as much profit as it expected to make
to give strength or support to something and to help it succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: the theories that underpin his teaching method
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 支持他的教学方法的理论
Sense.EXAMPLE: America’s wealth is underpinned by a global system which exploits the world’s poor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的财富是靠一个剥削全世界穷人的全球体系来支撑的。

Sense.DEF: to put a solid piece of metal under a wall or house in order to make it stronger
Sense.TRAN: 加固〔墙体或房屋〕的地基

Sense.DEF: to make something seem less important or less serious than it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: She underplays her achievements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对自己的成就表现得很低调。

Sense.DEF: very poor, with worse living conditions, educational opportunities etc than most people in society
Sense.TRAN: 贫困的﹔社会地位低下的﹔下层社会的
Sense.EXAMPLE: underprivileged children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫困儿童

Sense.DEF: better than people think or say
Sense.EXAMPLE: a much underrated novel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部被大大低估的小说

Sense.DEF: not provided with enough money, equipment etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔资金﹑设备等〕供应不足的﹐资源不足的

Sense.DEF: to emphasize the fact that something is important or true
to draw a line under a word or phrase to show that it is important
Sense.TRAN: 在〔单词或短语〕底下画线〔以示强调〕

Sense.DEF: happening or existing below the surface of the sea
Sense.TRAN: 海底的﹔海面下的﹔在海面下进行的
Sense.EXAMPLE: undersea exploration
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海底探险

Sense.DEF: a very important official in a US government department who is one position in rank below the secretary
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国政府部门的〕副部长﹔副国务卿

Sense.DEF: a minister in a British government department, who is one position in rank below the minister who is in charge of that department
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国政府部门的〕副大臣﹐次长

Sense.DEF: a government official who is in charge of the daily work of a British government department
to sell goods at a lower price than someone else
Sense.TRAN: 以低于〔他人〕的价格出售

Sense.DEF: to make other people think that someone or something is less good, effective, skilful etc than they really are
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think he undersold himself at the interview.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为他在面试时过于自谦了。

Sense.DEF: not getting enough care and help from the government
Sense.TRAN: 没有得到政府充分关照的﹐政府扶持力度不够的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The area is under-served for medical care.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区的医疗服务不周到。

Sense.DEF: having less desire to have sex than is normal
a piece of underwear with or without arms, worn under a shirt
underpants for men or boys
the bottom side or surface of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The leaves are green on top and silvery on the underside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些叶子正面是绿色的﹐反面是银色的。

Sense.DEF: the person or people who have signed a document
Sense.TRAN: 〔文件的〕签字人﹐签署人﹐具名人

Sense.DEF: too small
not having enough workers, or fewer workers than usual
Sense.TRAN: 人员不足的﹐人手不够的

Sense.DEF: to know the meaning of what someone is telling you, or the language that they speak
Sense.EXAMPLE: She doesn’t understand English.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不懂英语。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, I don’t understand. Can yon explain that again?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我不明白。你能再解释一遍吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The woman had a strong accent, and I couldn’t understand what she was saying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那女人口音很重﹐我听不懂她在说些什么。

GramExa.GLOSS: make what you say clear to other people, especially when speaking a foreign language
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔尤指在说外语时〕清楚表达自己的意思
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m not very good at German, but I can make myself understood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我德语不是太好﹐不过我能说清楚自己的意思。

Sense.DEF: to know or realize how a fact, process, situation etc works, especially through learning or experience
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过学习或经历〕了解﹐知道
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t really understand the political situation in Northern Ireland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我并不十分了解北爱尔兰的政治形势。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You don’t need to understand how computers work to be able to use them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要使用计算机不需要非得搞懂它的工作原理。

Sense.EXAMPLE: How the drug works isn’t fully understood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药的作用机制尚未完全为人所知。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I understand that this treatment may not work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道这种治疗方法可能不管用。

Sense.DEF: to realize how someone feels and why they behave the way they do, and to be sympathetic
Sense.EXAMPLE: My parents just don’t understand me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母就是不理解我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just tell him how you feel – I’m sure he’ll understand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就告诉他你的感受——我相信他会理解的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I understand how you feel, but I think you’re overreacting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我理解你的感受﹐但我认为你的反应过激了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can understand her wanting to live alone and be independent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能理解她想一个人独立生活。

Sense.DEF: to believe or think that something is true because you have heard it or read it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘I understand that he was 62 when he died,’ McLeish said.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “据我所知他是 62 岁时去世的。”麦克利什说。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is understood that the Queen approves of her nephew’s romance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说女王赞同侄子的恋爱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dillons is understood to be reorganising the company’s management structure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说狄龙斯正在重组公司的管理架构。

Sense.DEF: to make someone believe that something is true, going to happen etc, without telling them this directly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was given to understand that the property was in good condition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我的感觉是房子维护得挺好。

Sense.DEF: if something is understood, everyone knows it, or has agreed to it, and there is no need to discuss it
Sense.EXAMPLE: From childhood it was understood that your parents would choose your husband.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从小你就知道父母会为你挑选丈夫。

Sense.DEF: to accept something as having a particular meaning
Sense.EXAMPLE: In this document, ‘children’ is understood to mean people under 14.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在本文件中﹐“儿童”是指 14 岁以下的人。

Sense.DEF: used when you are telling someone what they should or should not do, especially when you are angry with them
Sense.TRAN: 明白了吗？〔用于告诫某人应该或不应该做什么﹐尤在对其感到生气时使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Never speak to me like that again! Do you understand?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再那样子对我说话！懂了吗？

Tail.TailContent: This graph shows how common the different grammar patterns of the verb understand are. 本图表所示为动词understand构成的不同语法模式的使用频率。

Exponent.DEF: to know the meaning of something, or the reasons for something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I understand what you’re saying.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明白你的话。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Doctors are beginning to understand what causes the disease.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生开始明白这种疾病的发病原因。

Exponent.DEF: to understand something, especially the truth about a situation or the reasons for something
Exponent.TRAN: 明白﹐理解〔某情况的真相或某事的原因〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I can see why you don’t like him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明白你为什么不喜欢他。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you see what I mean?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你懂我的意思吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Oh! I see!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐我懂了！

Exponent.DEF: to understand a joke, what someone says, the reasons why something is true etc
Exponent.TRAN: 理解﹐听懂〔笑话﹑某人的话﹑某事属实的原因等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She didn’t seem to get the joke.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她似乎没听懂那个笑话。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you get me?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你懂我的话吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He explained the math homework twice, but I still don’t get it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把数学作业解释了两遍﹐可我还是没懂。

Exponent.DEF: to understand something, or understand why something is important
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The dream was easy to describe, but difficult to comprehend.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个梦容易描述﹐但难以理解。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They had failed to comprehend the significance of the problem.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没能理解这个问题的重要性。

Exponent.DEF: to understand what sb is telling you, or what a situation is like, especially because you have some experience or knowledge about this
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因具有相关经历或知识〕理解某人的意思﹐了解情况
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘It can be really hard to give up smoking.’ ‘I know exactly what you mean.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “戒烟可真难啊。” “我完全理解。”

Exponent.DEF: to understand something such as an explanation or story as you hear it, read it etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The plot is hard to follow.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 情节很难理解。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His instructions were easy to follow.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的指示很容易理解。

Section.SECHEADING: TO UNDERSTAND SOMETHING DIFFICULT 理解有难度的事物

Exponent.DEF: to completely understand an idea or a fact, especially a complicated one
Exponent.TRAN: 理解﹐领会〔尤指复杂的观点或事实〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some of his theories can be rather difficult for the ordinary reader to grasp.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的一些理论对普通读者来说很难理解。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I don’t think Stuart really grasped the point I was making.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看斯图尔特实际上没有理解我表达的那个观点。

Exponent.DEF: to understand what something means or the reasons for something, after thinking carefully about it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She looked at him, puzzled, trying to fathom the reasons for his actions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不解地看着他﹐试图弄明白他为什么会有这些行为。

Exponent.DEF: to understand something that is not easy to understand, especially by thinking about it
Exponent.TRAN: 理解﹐想明白〔难以理解的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People are still trying to make sense of the news.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们仍试图理解这一消息的含意。

Sense.DEF: understandable behaviour, reactions etc seem normal and reasonable because of the situation you are in
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为﹑反应等〕可以理解的﹐合情理的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is understandable that parents are angry, and looking for someone to blame.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母生气了想找个人出气﹐这是可以理解的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He just can’t face anyone at the moment, which is perfectly understandable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在就是无法面对任何人﹐这完全可以理解。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an understandable mistake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情有可原的失误

Sense.DEF: able to be understood
knowledge about something, based on learning or experience

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How does this add to our understanding of the problem?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对我们理解这个问题有何益处？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you know the neighbourhood, you have an understanding of what the children are like.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 假如你熟悉这个街区﹐你就会知道这里的孩子是什么样子的了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Linguists currently have little understanding of the exact cause of language change.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前﹐语言学家对语言变化的真正原因知之甚少。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: How can we gain an understanding of other cultures?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们怎样才能了解其他文化呢？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Over time, you will get a far better understanding of the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过一段时间以后﹐你对这个工作的了解会多得多。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Success depends on a clear understanding of the problem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 认清问题才能成功解决问题。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a basic understanding of AIDS prevention
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对艾滋病预防的基本了解

Sense.DEF: an unofficial or informal agreement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My father was furious at first, but eventually we came to an understanding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 起初爸爸很生气﹐不过我们最后取得了一致意见。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We had an understanding that Jean-Claude should never be mentioned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有一个共识﹐永远不提让－克洛德。

Sense.DEF: the ability to understand people’s behaviour and to forgive them when they do something wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: The principal listened to the boy’s story with sympathy and understanding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长满怀同情和理解地倾听那个男孩的讲述。

Sense.DEF: the way in which someone judges the meaning of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: According to my understanding of the letter, it means something quite different.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据我对这封信的理解﹐它的意思完全是另外一回事。

Sense.DEF: if you agree to something on the understanding that something else will be done, you agree to it, believing that it will be done
Sense.TRAN: 以…为条件﹐在认为…的情况下
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack lent Sarah the money on the understanding that she would pay it back next month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克把钱借给了萨拉﹐相信她会在下月归还。

Sense.DEF: sympathetic and kind about other people’s problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luckily, I have a very under­standing boss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸运的是﹐我有一个非常通情达理的上司。

Sense.DEF: to describe something in a way that makes it seem less important or serious than it really is
Sense.TRAN: 轻描淡写地叙述﹔淡化〔某事的重要性或严重性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The press have tended to understate the extent of the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体想淡化问题的严重程度。

Sense.DEF: an understated style is one that is attractive because it is simple and does not have too many decorations
Sense.EXAMPLE: the understated elegance of the Hotel Traiano
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特拉亚诺酒店低调的优雅

Sense.DEF: a statement that is not strong enough to express how good, bad, impressive etc something really is
Sense.TRAN: 不充分的陈述﹐轻描淡写的陈述
Sense.EXAMPLE: To say the movie was bad is an understatement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说这部电影不好还算是客气的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It wasn’t very easy to find the house.’ ‘That’s got to be the understatement of the year!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这房子不是很好找。” “那可是说得太轻了！”

Sense.DEF: the practice of making something seem to have less of a particular quality than it really has
