GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘We have not done quite well enough,’ Macmillan said, with characteristic understatement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们做得还不够好。”麦克米伦以他特有的低调态度说道。

Sense.DEF: the past tense and past participle of understand
Sense.TRAN: understand 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: an actor who learns a part in a play so that they can act the part if the usual actor is ill
to be an understudy for a particular actor in a play
Sense.TRAN: 当…的替角﹐做…的候补演员

Sense.DEF: an activity, sale, service etc that is undersubscribed is not bought or used by enough people
Sense.TRAN: 〔活动等〕参与人数不够的﹔〔商品﹑服务等〕客户太少的

Sense.DEF: to accept that you are responsible for a piece of work, and start to do it

GramExa.PROPFORM: undertake a task/a project/research/a study etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dr Johnson undertook the task of writing a comprehensive English dictionary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊博士担负起编写一本综合性英语词典的工作。

Sense.DEF: to promise or agree to do something
Sense.TRAN: 承诺做某事﹐答应做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: He undertook to pay the money back in six months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他保证在六个月之内还钱。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to arrange funerals
an important job, piece of work, or activity that you are responsible for
Sense.EXAMPLE: Starting a new business can be a risky undertaking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 创办新企业有时是一件有风险的事情。

Sense.DEF: a promise to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both organizations gave an undertaking to curb violence among their members.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个组织都作出承诺要约束其成员的暴力行为。

Sense.DEF: the business of an undertaker
under-the-counter goods are bought or sold secretly, especially because they are illegal
Sense.TRAN: 〔商品〕暗中[私下]成交的﹔违法交易的

Sense.DEF: a feeling or quality that is not directly expressed but can still be recognized

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was an undertone of sadness in her letter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的信中流露出忧伤的情绪。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Opponents claim the policy has racist undertones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对者声称那项政策有种族歧视意味。

Sense.DEF: if you speak in an undertone, you speak quietly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Don’t be too upset if he doesn’t come,’ said Drew in an undertone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “如果他不来你也不要太难过。”德鲁小声说道。

Sense.DEF: the water current under the surface of the sea, that pulls away from the land when a wave comes onto the shore
Sense.TRAN: 〔海浪冲上岸后退回去时形成的〕回流﹐退浪
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dangerous undertow means that swimming is not allowed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 危险的逆流意味着不允许游泳。

Sense.DEF: a tendency or feeling that seems weak, but in fact has a strong effect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The humour of the novel cannot hide an undertow of sadness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小说的幽默掩盖不住暗藏的悲伤。

Sense.DEF: something that is underused is not used as much as it could be
to think that someone or something is less important or valuable than they really are
Sense.EXAMPLE: Society undervalues staying at home and looking after children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会低估了待在家里照看孩子的意义。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Analysts claim that the firm’s assets were undervalued by £300 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分析员称公司资产被低估了三亿英镑。

Sense.DEF: below the surface of an area of water, or able to be used there
Sense.EXAMPLE: an underwater camera
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水下摄影机

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He dived underwater and swam away.

Sense.DEF: happening now
Sense.EXAMPLE: The project is already well underway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 项目已经顺利启动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your peace will be shattered when the tourist season gets underwaystarts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一到旅游旺季﹐你的宁静生活就被打乱了。

Sense.DEF: something such as a boat or train that is underway is moving
clothes that you wear next to your body under your other clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: You just need to take a change of underwear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你只需带一套换洗的内衣。

PIC.HEADING: UNDERWEAR 内衣
PIC.PICCONTENT: boxer shorts〔男用〕平脚短裤；knickers BrE【英】/panties AmE【美】女用内裤；underpants 男用内裤；bra 胸罩；camisole 贴身胸衣；body BrE【英】/body suit AmE【美】连身内衣；vest BrE【英】/undershirt AmE【美】背心；socks 袜子

Sense.DEF: weighing less than is expected or usual
Sense.TRAN: 重量不足的﹔标准重量以下的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women who smoke risk giving birth to underweight babies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抽烟的女性有可能会生下体重不足的婴儿。

Sense.DEF: the past tense of undergo
if you are underwhelmed by something, you do not think it is impressive – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 未给…留下深刻印象〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were underwhelmed by the latest version of the software.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们觉得最新版的软件不怎么样。

Sense.DEF: the criminals in a particular place and the criminal activities they are involved in
Sense.TRAN: 〔某地的〕黑道﹐黑社会﹔犯罪活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: New York’s criminal underworld
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约的黑社会

Sense.DEF: the place where the spirits of the dead are believed to live, for example in ancient Greek stories
Sense.TRAN: 〔古希腊神话等中的〕地府﹐阴间

Sense.DEF: to support an activity, business plan etc with money, and to take financial responsibility if it fails
Sense.TRAN: (同意)负担〔活动﹑商业计划等〕的费用﹐以金钱支持
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has agreed to underwrite the project with a grant of £5 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府同意拨款 500 万英镑资助该项目。

Sense.DEF: if an insurance company underwrites an insurance contract, it agrees to pay for any damage or loss that happens
Sense.TRAN: 〔保险公司〕同意承担…的保险责任﹐承保

Sense.DEF: to arrange to sell shares to investors, and to agree to buy any which are not bought by them
Sense.TRAN: 包销﹐承销〔未获认购的股份〕

Sense.DEF: someone who makes insurance contracts
Sense.TRAN: 保险商﹔保险业务受理人

Sense.DEF: undeserved criticism, praise etc is unfair because you do not deserve it
Sense.TRAN: 不该受的﹔冤枉的﹔不应得的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had an undeserved reputation for rudeness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她枉担了个粗鲁的坏名声。

Sense.DEF: something or someone that is undesirable is not welcome or wanted because they may affect a situation or person in a bad way
Sense.TRAN: 不受欢迎的﹔不合意的﹔讨厌的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The drug may have other undesirable effects.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药可能会有其他负作用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: punishment of undesirable behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不良行为的惩罚

Sense.DEF: someone who is considered to be immoral, criminal, or socially unacceptable
Sense.TRAN: 不良分子﹔不受欢迎的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: security measures to keep out undesirables
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阻止不良分子进入的保安措施

Sense.DEF: if something, especially something bad, goes undetected, no one notices it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Doctors can make mistakes and diseases can remain undetected.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生有时会出错﹐查不出病症。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The thieves escaped undetected through a basement window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些盗贼从地下室的窗户神不知鬼不觉地逃走了。

Sense.DEF: if you are undeterred by something, you do not allow it to stop you doing what you want
Sense.TRAN: 未被吓住的﹐不灰心丧气的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Undeterred by his early failures, he decided to keep writing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有被一开始的失败吓倒﹐决定坚持写作。

Sense.DEF: used in order to describe land which has not yet been used for building, farming etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: an undeveloped stretch of coastline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一段未开发的海岸线

Sense.DEF: used in order to describe a country or area that does not have modern industry, and usually has a low standard of living
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家或地区〕不发达的﹐落后的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the undeveloped regions of the world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上的落后地区

Sense.DEF: not fully grown
Sense.TRAN: 未充分发育的﹐发育不良的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a child’s undeveloped mind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩未成熟的心智

Sense.DEF: the past tense of undo
underwear
something which is undifferentiated is not split into parts, or has different parts but you cannot tell the difference between them
Sense.TRAN: 分不开的﹔一体的﹔无法区分的
Sense.EXAMPLE: shows aimed at large undifferentiated groups of people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对不加以细分的大众的节目
Sense.EXAMPLE: Colonial officials tended to see Indian society as an undifferentiated whole.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 殖民地官员往往把印度社会看成一个统一整体。

Sense.DEF: behaving in a way that is embarrassing or makes you look silly
Sense.TRAN: 不庄重的﹔有损尊严的﹔不像样子的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was an undignified scramble for the free drinks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出现了争抢免费饮料的丢人场面。

Sense.DEF: an undiluted feeling is very strong and not mixed with any other feelings
Sense.TRAN: 〔感情〕未淡化的﹔浓烈的﹔纯粹的
Sense.EXAMPLE: undiluted joy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浓浓的喜悦

Sense.DEF: an undiluted liquid has not been made weaker by adding water
Sense.EXAMPLE: undiluted fruit juice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯果汁

Sense.DEF: not weaker or less important than before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neil continued with undiminished enthusiasm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼尔兴致不减地继续做着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Forty years on, the book’s power to shock is undiminished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 40年过去了﹐这本书的震撼力丝毫未减。

Sense.DEF: an undischarged debt is one that has not been paid
someone who still owes money and is not legally allowed to stop repaying their debt
Sense.TRAN: 未被解除清偿义务的破产人﹐债务未偿清的破产者

Sense.DEF: used to describe information which is not given to the public
Sense.TRAN: 未公开的﹐保密的﹐未披露的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Developers have agreed to buy the site for an undisclosed sum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开发商同意购买那块地﹐具体金额不详。

Sense.DEF: not having the ability to see a difference between two people or things, and therefore unable to make judgments about them
Sense.TRAN: 无鉴别力的﹐区别不了的

Sense.DEF: an undisguised feeling is clearly shown and not hidden
Sense.TRAN: 公开的﹔坦率的﹔不加掩饰的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was undisguised contempt in his voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的语气中带着不加掩饰的轻蔑。

Sense.DEF: not worried or frightened by something unpleasant or unexpected
known to be definitely true
Sense.TRAN: 无可争辩的﹐毫无疑问的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors found undisputed evidence of nerve damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生发现了神经受损的确凿证据。

Sense.DEF: accepted by everyone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the undisputed world heavyweight champion
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公认的世界重量级拳击冠军

Sense.DEF: not interrupted or moved
Sense.TRAN: 未受到干扰的﹔未被动过的
Sense.EXAMPLE: At last I was able to work undisturbed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我终于可以安安静静地工作了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The land is to be left undisturbed as a nature reserve.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块土地将作为自然保护区原封不动地保留下来。

Sense.DEF: not upset or worried by something
Sense.TRAN: 镇定地面对某事﹐泰然自若地面对某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark seemed undisturbed by her threats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克似乎对她的威胁无动于衷。

Sense.DEF: complete
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll give the matter my undivided attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会全力关注此事。

Sense.DEF: not separated into smaller parts
Sense.TRAN: 未分开的﹔未划分的﹔完整的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an undivided country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完整的国家

Sense.DEF: to open something that is tied, fastened or wrapped
Sense.EXAMPLE: The screws can be undone by hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些螺丝可以用手拧开。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I undid the package carefully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我小心地打开包裹。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 解开你的夹克/衬衫/胸罩等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He undid his coat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他解开外套。

Sense.DEF: to try to remove the bad effects of something you have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: We cannot undo the damage of a lifetime in only 30 days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不能在短短的 30 天内消除影响一生的伤害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If a medicine is taken again too soon, it may undo all the good that has been done.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果服用一种药物时间间隔过短﹐可能会抵消所有已产生的药效。

Sense.DEF: to remove the effect of your previous action on a computer
Sense.TRAN: 撤销〔先前的计算机指令〕

PIC.HEADING: UNDO 解开
PIC.PICCONTENT: unzip 拉开拉链；loosen 松开〔领带〕；unbutton 解开纽扣；untie 解开〔鞋带〕

Sense.DEF: to cause someone’s shame, failure etc
Sense.TRAN: 是某人蒙羞[失败]的原因[祸根]
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the end, drink was his undoing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后﹐喝酒害了他。

Sense.DEF: not fastened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your zip’s undone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的拉链没有拉上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of these buttons has come undone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中的一粒纽扣松开了。

Sense.DEF: not finished
Sense.EXAMPLE: The washing-up had been left undone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 餐具放着没洗。

Sense.DEF: destroyed and without hope
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the end, Othello is undone by his jealousy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后﹐奥赛罗被自己的嫉妒心毁了。

Sense.DEF: definitely true or known to exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: her undoubted talent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那毋庸置疑的天赋
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film was an undoubted success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无疑问﹐那部电影很成功。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Undoubtedly, public interest in folk music has declined.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 无疑﹐大众对民间音乐的兴趣减退了。

Sense.DEF: much more or much better than you thought was possible
Sense.TRAN: 梦想不到的﹐想象不到的
Sense.EXAMPLE: undreamt-of success
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意外的成功
Sense.EXAMPLE: Men were becoming interested in fashion on a scale undreamed-of in the 1960s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男性对时尚表现出极大的兴趣﹐这在20世纪 60 年代是想象不到的。

Sense.DEF: to take your clothes off, or take someone else’s clothes off
Sense.EXAMPLE: Matt undressed and got into bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马特脱掉衣服上了床。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe still needs an adult to undress him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔仍需要大人给他脱衣服。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say get undressed rather than undress.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 get undressed﹐而不说 undress
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: You can get undressed in here.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以在这里脱衣服。

Sense.DEF: when you are wearing few or no clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cindy was wandering about her room in a state of undress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辛迪光着身子在房间里走来走去。

Sense.DEF: not wearing any clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: He started to get undressedto take his clothes off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始脱光衣服。

Sense.DEF: an undressed wound has not been covered to protect it
more than is reasonable, suitable, or necessary
Sense.TRAN: 不适当的﹔过度的﹐过分的
Sense.EXAMPLE: De Gaulle felt that America had undue influence in Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴高乐感到美国在欧洲影响力过大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Exercise gently and avoid putting yourself under undue strain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 做些和缓的运动﹐不要让身体负荷过多。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The kick should be taken without undue delay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应立即开球﹐不得无故拖延。

Sense.DEF: to move or be shaped like waves that are rising and falling
Sense.EXAMPLE: undulating hills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绵延起伏的山峦

Sense.DEF: more than is normal or reasonable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She doesn’t seem unduly concerned about her exams.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她似乎对考试并未过分担忧。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It didn’t trouble me unduly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事并没有让我太烦恼。

Sense.DEF: continuing for ever

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They declared their undying love for each other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们宣称永远相爱。

Sense.DEF: money that you receive but did not earn by working
to find something after searching for it, especially something that has been buried in the ground or lost for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 发掘﹐掘出﹐找到〔尤指埋藏于地下或遗失很久的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Farmers still sometimes unearth human bones here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农民们有时仍然能在这里挖到人骨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In one shop, I unearthed a wonderful collection of 1920s toys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一家商店﹐我发现了一套非常好玩的 20 世纪 20 年代的玩具。

Sense.DEF: to find information or the truth about something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The inquiry unearthed some disturbing evidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次调查发现了一些令人不安的证据。

Sense.DEF: very strange and unnatural, and probably frightening
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes shone with an unearthly light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他眼睛里闪着奇异的光。

Sense.DEF: very early or very late and therefore extremely inconvenient
Sense.TRAN: 早[晚]得不合理的时间等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He suggested a meeting at some unearthly hour of the morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他建议一大清早就开会。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of worry or slight fear about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As she neared the door, Amy felt a growing sense of unease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米走向门口时感到越来越不安。

Sense.EXAMPLE: public unease about defence policy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民众对国防政策的忧虑

Sense.DEF: worried or slightly afraid because you think that something bad might happen
Sense.TRAN: 心神不安的﹐不自在的﹔忧虑的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ninety percent of those questioned felt uneasy about nuclear power.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 受访者中有90%的人对核能感到忧虑。

Sense.DEF: used to describe a period of time when people have agreed to stop fighting or arguing, but which is not really calm

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The treaty restored an uneasy peace to the country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个条约让该国恢复了暂时的和平。

Sense.DEF: not comfortable, peaceful, or relaxed
Sense.TRAN: 不舒服的﹔不踏实的﹔不安的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She eventually fell into an uneasy sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她终于睡着了﹐但睡得并不踏实。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Bill shifted uneasily in his chair.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔在椅子上不安地动来动去。
RunOn.EXAMPLE: Charles’ concern for the environment sits uneasily with does not fit well with his collection of powerful cars.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯拥有很多动力强劲的汽车﹐这与他对环境的关注格格不入。

Sense.DEF: a word meaning unpleas­ant or unsuitable to eat, that some people think is incorrect
Sense.TRAN: 不可食的﹔不适合食用的〔有些人认为该词不正确〕

Sense.DEF: not eaten
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had to throw away the uneaten food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只能把没吃的食物扔掉。

Sense.DEF: not making enough money or profit
Sense.TRAN: 赚钱不多的﹐利润不大的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the closure of uneconomic industries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 效益不好的企业的关闭

Sense.DEF: uneconomical
using too much effort, money, or materials to make a profit
Sense.EXAMPLE: Old vehicles are often uneconomical.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧车往往很费钱。

Sense.DEF: unpleasant and embarrassing
Sense.TRAN: 令人厌恶的﹔使人难堪的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the unedifying spectacle of players attacking the referee
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动员攻击裁判的丢人场面

Sense.DEF: not educated to the usual level, or showing that someone is not well educated
Sense.TRAN: 没受过教育的﹔未受过良好教育的﹔没有教养的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a largely uneducated workforce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分人都没受过教育的劳动力

Sense.DEF: someone who is unelected has a position of power although they were not elected – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔有权位者〕未经选举的〔常含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: not showing your feelings
Sense.TRAN: 不流露感情的﹔不动声色的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice was unemotional.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他语气平淡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Zoe is normally an unemotional person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佐耶通常是个不轻易流露感情的人。

Sense.DEF: not having the skills or qualities needed to get a job
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于缺乏必要技能或素质〕不能被雇用的

Sense.DEF: without a job
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unemployed actor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没戏演的演员
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve only been unemployed for a few weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只失业了几个星期。

Exponent.DEF: someone who is unemployed does not have a job
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Fifty per cent of the men in this town are unemployed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个镇上50﹪ 的男人失业。

Exponent.DEF: unemployed, especially for a long period of time, when you had a job before
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve been out of work for two years.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经失业两年了。

Exponent.DEF: if someone is redundant, they have been told that they no longer have a job
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was made redundant earlier this year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年年初他被裁员了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: redundant miners
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 被裁的矿工

Exponent.DEF: to be receiving money from the government because you do not have a job
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want to go back on the dole.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想再去领失业救济金。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many people on welfare don’t have anyone to take care of the kids while they train for a job.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多领失业救济金的人参加工作培训时没有人帮他们照顾孩子。

Exponent.DEF: if someone is looking for work, they do not have a job and are trying to find one
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How long have you been looking for work?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你待业多久了？

Exponent.DEF: people who are jobless do not have jobs – used especially in news reports
Exponent.TRAN: 失业的﹐无工作的〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The jobless totals have risen by 6% in the last year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年失业者总数上升了6﹪。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: jobless youths
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业青年

Sense.DEF: people who have no job

GramExa.GLOSS: people who have not had a job for a long time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a retraining scheme for the long-term unemployed
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 长期失业者再培训计划

Sense.DEF: the number of people in a particular country or area who cannot get a job
Sense.EXAMPLE: a town where there is high unemployment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高失业率城镇

Sense.DEF: when someone does not have a job
Sense.EXAMPLE: Closure of the plant means 80 workers are facing unemployment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家工厂的关闭意味着 80 个工人面临失业。

Sense.DEF: money paid regularly by the government to people who have no job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s been on unemployment for two months.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经领了两个月的失业救济金。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They live in an area where unemployment is high.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们居住在高失业率地区。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The area has the lowest unemployment in Europe.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区失业率全欧洲最低。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Rising unemployment led to more crime.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业率上升导致犯罪活动增多。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when very large numbers of people are unemployed
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪 30 年代的大规模失业

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when people are unemployed for a long period of time

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government is spending more on projects to cut unemployment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府对降低失业率的项目增加投入。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: People blamed immigrants for causing unemployment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们指责移民造成了失业。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: increases quickly to a high level

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The crisis meant a sharp rise in unemployment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 危机意味着失业率陡增。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The level of unemployment among young people is rising.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人的失业水平正在上升。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an area where there is higher unemployment than in other places

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say不要说 ‘big unemployment’. Say而要说 high unemployment.

Sense.DEF: money paid regularly by the government to people who have no job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: people on unemployment benefit
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 领取失业救济金的人

Sense.DEF: something, especially something bad, that is unending seems as if it will continue for ever
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不好的事情〕无休止的﹐不停的﹐不断的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unending stream of people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 源源不断的人流

Sense.DEF: too unpleasant, painful etc to bear
Sense.TRAN: 不可容忍的﹐难以忍受的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pain was unendurable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疼痛无法忍受。

Sense.DEF: difficult and unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 艰难的﹔令人不快的﹔讨厌的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the unenviable task of informing the victim’s relations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通知受害人亲属的为难差事

Sense.EXAMPLE: Edward III was in a delicate and unenviable position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱德华三世处境微妙而尴尬。

Sense.DEF: used to describe a situation or a social system which is unfair because some groups or people have more power than others
Sense.TRAN: 不平等的﹔不公正的﹔不均衡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unequal contest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不公平的竞赛
Sense.EXAMPLE: the unequal distribution of wealth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不公平的财富分配

Sense.DEF: not equal in number, amount, or level
Sense.TRAN: 〔数目﹑数量或水平〕不相等的﹐不相同的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: two rooms of unequal size
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大小不同的两个房间

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pieces were unequal in length.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那几件东西长度不一。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be unequal to the task/job etc
Sense.DEF: to not have enough strength, ability etc to do something
better than any other
Sense.TRAN: 无可比拟的﹐无与伦比的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel has a range of facilities unequalled in the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店拥有本市最好的各种设施。

Sense.DEF: completely clear and without any possibility of doubt
Sense.EXAMPLE: His answer was an unequivocal ‘No.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的回答是毫不含糊的“不”。

Sense.DEF: always right
Sense.TRAN: 一贯准确的﹐毫无偏差的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He passes the ball with unerring accuracy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他传球一向精准无误。

Sense.DEF: morally unacceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: unethical medical practices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不道德的医疗行为

Sense.DEF: not smooth, flat, or level
Sense.EXAMPLE: She walked back carefully over the uneven ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她小心翼翼地从凹凸不平的地面上走回来。

Sense.DEF: not regular
Sense.EXAMPLE: His breathing had become uneven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的呼吸变得不均匀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: uneven rates of development
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不一致的发展速度

Sense.DEF: not equal or equally balanced
Sense.EXAMPLE: an uneven distribution of resources
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不均匀的资源分布

Sense.DEF: good in some parts and bad in others
Sense.EXAMPLE: an uneven performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场时好时坏的演出

Sense.DEF: with nothing exciting or unusual happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Annie led a quiet uneventful life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮过着安静平淡的生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The journey was uneventful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅途平平淡淡。

Sense.DEF: ordinary and slightly boring
Sense.EXAMPLE: After Tokyo, Okinawa seemed unexciting at first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去过东京以后再到冲绳﹐一开始让人觉得有些乏味无聊。

Sense.DEF: used to describe something that is surprising because you were not expecting it
Sense.TRAN: 想不到的﹐意外的﹐突然的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The experiment produced some unexpected results.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次试验产生了一些意想不到的结果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her death was totally unexpected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的死完全出人意料。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hague’s announcement was not entirely unexpected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑格的声明并非完全出乎意料。

Sense.DEF: something that is unexplained is something you cannot understand because you do not know the reason for it
Sense.TRAN: 无法解释的﹔莫名其妙的﹔原因不明的
Sense.EXAMPLE: patients with unexplained symptoms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出现不明症状的病人
Sense.EXAMPLE: For some unexplained reason, he wants to move to Ipswich.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知何故﹐他想搬到伊普斯威奇去。

Sense.DEF: used to describe something such as a bomb which has not yet exploded
an unexplored place has not been examined or put on a map
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方〕未曾探索的﹐未经勘察的﹔未画进地图的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unexplored planets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未经探索的行星

Sense.DEF: an unexplored idea has not been thought about or discussed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The study looks at a relatively unexplored area of human relationships.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项研究考察人类关系中较少探讨的领域。

Sense.DEF: an unexpurgated book, play etc is complete and has not had parts that might offend people removed
always there, even in times of difficulty or trouble
Sense.TRAN: 经久不衰的﹔永恒的﹔始终不变的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like to thank you all for your unfailing support.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想感谢大家一贯的支持。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She battled against cancer with unfailing good humour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她始终乐观地与癌症抗争。

Sense.DEF: not right or fair, especially because not everyone has an equal opportunity
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unfair advantage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不公平的优势
Sense.EXAMPLE: laws aimed at preventing unfair competition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在防止不公平竞争的法令
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many employers have recognized that age discrimination is unfair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多雇主已经认识到年龄歧视是不公平的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She won £20,000 for unfair dismissalbeing illegally made to leave your job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因被不公平解雇而得到两万英镑的赔偿。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Mrs Taylor believes her son has been unfairly treated.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰勒太太认为她儿子受到了不公正待遇。
RunOn.EXAMPLE: The tribunal decided that Mr Matthews had been unfairly dismissed.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 特别法庭裁定马修斯先生是被不公平解雇的。

Sense.DEF: someone who is unfaithful has sex with someone who is not their wife, husband, or usual partner

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Geoff had been unfaithful to her on many occasions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰夫多次对她不忠。

Sense.DEF: strong, determined, and not becoming weaker
Sense.EXAMPLE: unfaltering confidence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坚定的信心

Sense.DEF: not known to you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She stood on deck to gaze at the unfamiliar surroundings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站在甲板上凝视着四下陌生的一切。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a crowd of unfamiliar faces
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群陌生的面孔

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of the technical vocabulary may be unfamiliar to you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些专业词汇你可能不熟悉。

Sense.DEF: to not have any experience of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were unfamiliar with the neighbourhood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不熟悉这个社区。

Sense.DEF: not popular or fashionable at the present time
Sense.TRAN: 不流行的﹔不时髦的﹐过时的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unfashionable clothes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过时的衣服

Sense.DEF: to undo something such as a button, belt, rope etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He unfastened the top button of his shirt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他解开衬衫最上面的那颗扣子。

Sense.DEF: too strange or mysterious to be understood
Sense.TRAN: 莫测高深的﹐难以理解的

Sense.DEF: unfavourable conditions, situations etc are not good
Sense.EXAMPLE: unfavourable circumstances
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不利的情况

Sense.DEF: if someone’s reaction or attitude to something is unfavourable, they do not like it
Sense.TRAN: 不喜欢的﹔反对的﹐不同意的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unfavourable reviews
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 否定的评论
负面宣传
Sense.EXAMPLE: Careless spelling mistakes in a letter can create an unfavourable impression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信中粗心的拼写错误会给人留下不好的印象。

Sense.DEF: not confused or shocked by a difficult situation or by something bad that has happened
Sense.TRAN: 处变不惊的﹐泰然自若的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister appeared to be totally unfazed by the protesters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相面对抗议者时显得镇定自若。

Sense.DEF: not sympathetic towards other people’s feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave had been quite wrong to call Michelle cold and unfeeling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一直以来﹐戴夫说米歇尔冷漠无情是大错特错了。

Sense.DEF: not restricted by laws or rules
Sense.TRAN: 不受〔法规〕约束的﹐自由的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unfettered economic activity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自由的经济活动

Sense.DEF: an unfilled job, position etc is available but no one has been found for it yet
Sense.EXAMPLE: unfilled vacancies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 空缺的职位

Sense.DEF: a request by a customer for a product that has not been sent
not completed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rachael left her meal unfinished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷切尔的饭剩下了。

Sense.DEF: something that you have not yet dealt with
not in a good physical condition
Sense.TRAN: 〔身体〕不健康的﹔健康状况不佳的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She never gets any exercise – she must be really unfit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从不锻炼——身体一定很不好。

Sense.DEF: not good enough to do something or to be used for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 不合适的﹐不适宜的﹔不胜任的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jenkins is unfit for public office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹金斯不适合担任公职。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The meat was declared unfit for human consumptionnot suitable to eat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种肉被宣布不宜食用。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house was unfit for human habitationnot good enough to live in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子不宜住人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hubbard was declared mentally unfit to stand trial.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈伯德被宣布精神状态不宜接受审判。

Sense.DEF: continuing strongly and never becoming tired or weak
Sense.TRAN: 持久的﹔不倦的﹔(经久)不衰的
Sense.EXAMPLE: his unflagging energy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他旺盛不衰的精力

Sense.DEF: having the ability to stay calm and not become upset, even in difficult situations
Sense.TRAN: 临危不乱的﹐镇定自若的

Sense.DEF: making someone look or seem bad or unattractive
Sense.TRAN: 使…显得难看的﹐有损形象的﹐不敢恭维的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unflattering portrait
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难看的画像

Sense.DEF: not changing or becoming weaker, even in a very difficult or dangerous situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: unflinching courage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无畏的勇气

Sense.DEF: not dealing with or paying attention to the most important ideas, causes etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The discussion was becom­ing unfocused.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讨论的焦点越来越分散。

Sense.DEF: eyes that are unfocused are open, but are not looking at anything specific
Sense.TRAN: 目光分散的﹔目光茫然的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave her an unfocused look.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他茫然地看了她一眼。

Sense.DEF: if a story unfolds, or if someone unfolds it, it is told
Sense.EXAMPLE: As the story unfolds, we learn more about Max’s childhood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着故事的展开﹐我们对马克斯的童年有了更多的了解。

Sense.DEF: if a series of events unfold, they happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had watched the drama unfold from a nearby ship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从附近的一艘船上目睹了这一戏剧性事件的发生。

Sense.DEF: if you unfold something that was folded, or if it unfolds, it opens out
Sense.TRAN: 〔卷着的东西〕展开﹔打开﹐摊开〔卷着的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He unfolded the map.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他展开地图。

Sense.DEF: an unforeseeable event, situation etc could not have been expected
Sense.TRAN: 不可预见的﹐预料不到的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unforeseeable danger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预料不到的危险

Sense.DEF: an unforeseen situation is one that you did not expect to happen
Sense.TRAN: 预料不到的﹐意料之外的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Due to unforeseen circumstances, the play has been cancelled.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于突发情况﹐比赛被取消。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: unforeseen delays in supplying the equipment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 设备供应的意外延误

Sense.DEF: an unforgettable experience, sight etc affects you so strongly that you will never forget it, especially because it is particularly good or beautiful

RunOn.EXAMPLE: A visit to Morocco is a truly unforgettable experience.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 摩洛哥之行绝对是令人难忘的经历。

Sense.DEF: an unforgivable action is so bad or cruel that you cannot forgive the person who did it
Sense.TRAN: 不可原谅的﹐不可饶恕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Patrick had deceived her, and that was unforgivable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特里克欺骗了她﹐那是不可原谅的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the unforgivable sin of informing on your friends
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出卖朋友这种不可饶恕的恶行

Sense.DEF: someone who is unforgiving does not forgive people easily
an unforgiving place is very difficult to live in, for example because it is extremely hot or cold
Sense.TRAN: 非常不适宜居住的〔如因为酷热或严寒〕

Sense.DEF: not yet developed
Sense.TRAN: 未成形的﹔未充分发展的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the unformed mind of a child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童未发育完善的大脑

Sense.DEF: someone who is unfortunate has something bad happen to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: When we entered the room, the teacher was yelling at some unfortunate student.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们进教室的时候﹐老师正在对着一个倒霉的学生吼叫。

Sense.DEF: an unfortunate situation, condition, quality etc is one that you wish was different
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unfortunate turn of events
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人遗憾的事态变化
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has an unfortunate habit of repeating himself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有一个讨厌的习惯﹐总是重复自己说过的话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s unfortunate that so few people seem willing to help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很遗憾﹐愿意帮助的人寥寥无几。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s most unfortunatevery unfortunate that your father can’t come to the wedding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你父亲不能来参加婚礼﹐真是太遗憾了。

Sense.DEF: happening because of bad luck
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unfortunate accident
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸的事故

Sense.DEF: unfortunate behaviour, remarks etc make people feel embarrassed or offended
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为﹑话语等〕不得体的﹔粗野的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unfortunate choice of words
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不恰当的措辞

Sense.DEF: someone who has no money, home, job etc
used when you are mentioning a fact that you wish was not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unfortunately, you were out when we called.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很遗憾﹐我们来的时候你出去了。

Sense.DEF: unfounded statements, feelings, opinions etc are wrong because they are not based on facts
Sense.TRAN: 没有事实根据的﹔无稽的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Unfounded rumours began circulating that Ian and Susan were having an affair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 无端的谣言开始流传开来﹐说伊恩和苏珊有暧昧关系。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sadly, my optimism proved unfounded.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸的是﹐最后证明我是盲目乐观。

Sense.DEF: not often visited by many people
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unfrequented spot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人迹罕至的地方

Sense.DEF: not kind or friendly
Sense.TRAN: 不友好的﹐不友善的﹔冷漠的﹔有敌意的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old man looked cross and unfriendly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老人看上去生气了﹐很不友好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lonely unfriendly place
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偏僻冷漠的地方

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The villagers were really quite unfriendly towards us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 村民们对我们真的很不友好。

Sense.DEF: not helping or wanting a type of person or thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have created cities that are unfriendly to pedestrians.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们建造了不适合步行的城市。

Sense.DEF: an unfriendly government or nation is one that opposes yours

Exponent.DEF: behaving towards someone in a way that shows you are not interested in them or are not ready to talk to them or help them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hotel staff were unfriendly and unhelpful.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店员工态度很不客气﹐不愿意帮忙。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an unfriendly tone of voice
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不友好的语调

Exponent.DEF: very unfriendly, and ready to argue or fight
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was openly hostile towards me when I arrived.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到的时候﹐他毫不掩饰对我的敌意。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A hostile crowd gathered outside the US embassy
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 满怀敌意的人群聚集在美国大使馆外面。

Exponent.DEF: behaving towards other people as if you do not like them or care about them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He gave her a cold stare.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他冷冷地瞪了她一眼。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a cold voice
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 冷冰冰的声音

Exponent.DEF: unfriendly, especially because you are angry with someone
Exponent.TRAN: 不友好的〔尤指对某人生气〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When she spoke, her tone was frosty.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说话时语气很冷漠。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He got a frosty reception from his wife when he finally returned home she was not very friendly towards him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他终于回到了家里﹐然而妻子对他却是冷冰冰的。

Exponent.DEF: not wanting to talk to other people or spend time with them, especially because you think you are better than them
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因自以为高人一等〕冷漠的﹐疏远的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some politicians are criticized for being too aloof.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些政治家被批评太孤傲。

Exponent.DEF: unfriendly and always trying to start arguments with someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Why are Kate and John so antagonistic towards each other?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么凯特和约翰这样敌对？

Exponent.DEF: not interested in meeting other people or forming friendly relationships with them
Exponent.TRAN: 不喜欢社交的﹐不合群的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sorry if I’m being antisocial, but I need to get my work done.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 抱歉﹐我可能显得不合群了﹐但我必须把工作做完。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was an antisocial loner with no friends.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个不爱与人交往的独行侠﹐没有朋友。

Exponent.DEF: making you feel as though you are not wanted
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The report found that the Church can seem unfriendly to outsiders.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告称教会在外人看来有时显得冷冰冰的。

Exponent.DEF: unfriendly - used especially about the physical characteristics or appearance of something
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指某物的特征或外表〕不友好的﹐不欢迎的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The entrance to the factory is cold, bare, and unwelcoming.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂大门冷冰冰﹑光秃秃﹐看上去毫无亲切感。

Exponent.DEF: lacking the normal friendly relations between people who work or do business together
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I had no desire to work for a large impersonal organization.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想在一个毫无人情味的大型机构里工作。

Exponent.DEF: unfriendly, uncomfortable, and a little frightening, so that you do not want to go there
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The school was a rather forbidding building surrounded by a high steel fence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校是一幢令人生畏的大楼﹐四周围着高高的铁栅栏。

Sense.DEF: to remove someone from their position as a priest as a punishment for behaviour or beliefs that the Church does not approve of
Sense.TRAN: 免去〔牧师或神父〕的圣职

Sense.DEF: an unfulfilled hope, desire, dream etc has not been achieved
Sense.TRAN: 〔愿望﹑梦想等〕未实现的﹐未达到的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His dream of competing in the Olympics remained unfulfilled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他登上奥运会赛场的梦想一直没有实现。

Sense.DEF: someone who is unfulfilled feels they could be achieving more in their job, relationship etc
Sense.TRAN: 壮志未酬的﹐宏图未展的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her job left her feeling unfulfilled and unappreciated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的工作让她有一种壮志难酬﹑怀才不遇的感觉。

Sense.DEF: an unfunny joke or action is not amusing, although it is intended to be – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 不滑稽的﹐不逗人发笑的﹐不幽默的〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: if a flag, sail etc unfurls, or if someone unfurls it, it unrolls and opens
an unfurnished room, house etc has no furniture in it
moving in a way that does not look graceful
Sense.TRAN: 〔动作〕笨拙的﹐难看的﹐不优雅的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tall ungainly teenager
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个动作笨拙的高个子少年

Subsense.DEF: if a plan, situation etc comes unglued, it stops working well
Subsense.EXAMPLE: When his parents got divorced, his whole world came unglued.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母离婚让他的整个世界都乱了。

Subsense.DEF: to become extremely upset or angry about something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If someone talked to me like that, I would just come unglued.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果有人跟我那么说话﹐我会很生气的。

Sense.DEF: no longer glued together
Sense.TRAN: 不再粘在一起的﹐分离的

Sense.DEF: unreasonable and annoying
Sense.TRAN: 不合情理的﹐不适当的﹔恼人的

GramExa.GLOSS: very early in the morning or very late at night
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 一大早﹔深夜 Why did you wake me up at such an ungodly hour? 这么一大早把我叫醒干吗？

Sense.DEF: showing a lack of respect for God
a country or area that is ungovernable is one in which the people cannot be controlled by the government, the police etc
feelings or types of behaviour that are ungovernable are impossible to control
Sense.EXAMPLE: ungovernable rage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难以遏制的怒火

Sense.DEF: not polite or friendly
Sense.EXAMPLE: After Anna’s kindness to me, I don’t want to seem ungracious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 既然安娜已经向我示好﹐我也不想显得无礼。

Sense.DEF: not expressing thanks for something that someone has given to you or done for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be so ungrateful!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要如此忘恩负义！

Sense.DEF: a time when you are not paying attention to what you are doing or saying
Sense.EXAMPLE: In an unguarded moment, he admitted that he wanted to quit his job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一不小心就承认了他想辞职。

Sense.DEF: an unguarded remark, statement etc is one that you make carelessly without thinking of the possible effects
Sense.TRAN: 〔话语﹑声明等〕粗心大意的﹐不慎重的﹐轻率的

Sense.DEF: not guarded or protected by anyone
an oily substance used on your skin
in a way that shows you are not happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m not sure what to do,’ Seb admitted unhappily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不知道该怎么办。”赛博不高兴地承认道。

Sense.DEF: used when you are mentioning a fact that you wish were not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unhappily, she was not able to complete the course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可惜的是﹐她未能完成这门课程。

Sense.DEF: not happy
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re so unhappy, why don’t you change jobs?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是那么不开心﹐为什么不换个工作呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leslie had an unhappy childhood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莱斯利的童年很不幸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unhappy marriage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸的婚姻
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was desperately unhappy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常不快乐。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say they feel down or fed up rather than unhappy.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 feel down 或 feel fed up﹐而不说 unhappy
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The situation at home was making her feel very down.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 家里的状况让她情绪很低落。

Sense.DEF: feeling worried or annoyed because you do not like what is happening in a particular situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dennis is unhappy about having to work on a Saturday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼斯很不高兴星期六还要上班。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were all unhappy with the quality of the service.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都对服务质量不满意。

Sense.DEF: an unhappy remark, situation etc is not suitable, lucky, or desirable
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unhappy coincidence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸的巧合

Sense.DEF: not hurt or harmed
Sense.TRAN: 未受伤(害)的﹔无恙的﹐平安的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hostages were released unharmed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人质平安获释。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The girl managed to escape unharmed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个女孩得以平安脱险。

Sense.DEF: likely to make you ill
Sense.TRAN: 对健康有害的﹔会致病的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unhealthy living conditions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不利于健康的生活环境

Sense.DEF: not normal or natural and likely to be harmful
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unhealthy relationship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不正常的关系

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gareth had an unhealthy interest in death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加雷思对于死亡有种病态的兴趣。

Sense.DEF: not physically healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unhealthy baby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体弱的婴儿

Sense.DEF: unhealthy skin, hair etc shows that you are ill or not healthy
Sense.TRAN: 〔皮肤﹑头发等〕显出病态的﹐显得不健康的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unhealthy pale complexion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苍白的病容

Sense.DEF: not heard or listened to
Sense.TRAN: 没被听到的﹔没人倾听的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her cries for help went unheard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的呼救声没有人听到。

Sense.DEF: something that is unheard of is so unusual that it has not happened or been known before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Travel for pleasure was almost unheard of until the 19th century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游在 19 世纪以前几乎闻所未闻。

Sense.DEF: noticed but not listened to, accepted, or believed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her warnings went unheeded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的警告无人理会。

Sense.DEF: not helping in a situation and sometimes making it worse
Sense.TRAN: 不予帮助的﹔没有帮助的﹐无用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The authorities are being particularly unhelpful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当局特别不合作。

Sense.DEF: if an event is unheralded, there is no warning that it is going to happen
Sense.TRAN: 没事先宣布的﹐未预告的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unheralded visit from his aunt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他姨妈的突然到访

Sense.DEF: not known about or recognized as good
Sense.EXAMPLE: the unheralded members of the team
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 默默无闻的队员

Sense.DEF: to make someone become very upset or mentally ill
Sense.TRAN: 使精神失常﹔使心烦意乱
Sense.EXAMPLE: The terrible experience seemed to have unhinged him slightly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一可怕的经历似乎使他有点精神失常了。

Sense.DEF: unfashionable
to unfasten something that is joined to something else
an agreement between two people or organizations who would not normally work together, usually for a bad purpose
bad and extreme
Sense.TRAN: 可怕的﹔极端的﹔令人无法容忍的
Sense.EXAMPLE: An unholy row broke out between two of the men drinking in the bar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒吧里有两名喝酒的男子大吵了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unholy mess
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一团糟

Sense.DEF: not holy, or not respecting what is holy
Sense.TRAN: 不神圣的﹔不虔敬的﹔亵渎神灵的

Sense.DEF: pleasure etc that you get from someone else’s suffering
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was taking an unholy delight in humiliating Sarah.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正在幸灾乐祸地羞辱着萨拉。

Sense.DEF: to unfasten or remove some­thing from a hook
much better than had been expected
Sense.TRAN: 没有料到的﹐出乎意料的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unhoped-for success
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意外的成功

Sense.DEF: slow and calm
Sense.TRAN: 不慌不忙的﹐从容不迫的﹔悠闲的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the unhurried pace of a small town
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小镇悠闲的生活节奏

Sense.DEF: not hurt
Sense.EXAMPLE: The driver escaped unhurt from the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 司机安然无恙地逃过了这场车祸。

Sense.DEF: dirty and likely to make people ill
Sense.TRAN: 不清洁的﹐不卫生的﹐会致病的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unhygienic conditions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不卫生的环境

Sense.DEF: university
one
Sense.EXAMPLE: unidirectional going in only one direction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单向的

Sense.DEF: consisting of only one cell
Sense.EXAMPLE: unicellular organisms such as amoebas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 变形虫之类的单细胞微生物

Sense.DEF: an imaginary animal like a white horse with a long straight horn growing on its head
a vehicle that is like a bicycle but has only one wheel
an unidentified person or thing is one that you do not know the name of
Sense.TRAN: 未被识别的﹐身份不明的
Sense.EXAMPLE: An unidentified man was spotted near the scene of the crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人在犯罪现场附近看到一名身份不明的男子。

Sense.DEF: the act of combining two or more groups, countries etc to make a single group or country

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the unification of Germany
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 德国的统一

Sense.DEF: created from more than one part, group etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a unified approach
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 统一的方法
Sense.EXAMPLE: a unified market
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 统一的市场

Sense.DEF: a particular type of clothing worn by all the members of a group or organization such as the police, the army etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was still wearing his school uniform.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仍然穿着校服。

Subsense.DEF: wearing a uniform
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was on duty and in uniform.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿着制服在值班。

Subsense.DEF: in the Army, Navy etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: my 33 years in uniform
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从军的 33 年

Sense.DEF: being the same in all its parts or among all its members
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grade A eggs must be of uniform size.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: A 级鸡蛋必须大小相同。

Sense.DEF: wearing a uniform
Sense.EXAMPLE: uniformed police officers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿制服的警察

Sense.DEF: the quality of being or looking the same as all other members of a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: There seems to be no uniformity among the various systems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各系统之间似乎没有统一性。

Sense.DEF: if you unify two or more parts or things, or if they unify, they are combined to make a single unit
Sense.EXAMPLE: Strong support for the war has unified the nation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对战争的坚决支持使这个国家团结了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His music unifies traditional and modern themes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的音乐结合了传统和现代的主题。

Sense.DEF: a unilateral action or decision is done by only one of the groups involved in a situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔行动或决定〕一方的﹐单边的﹐单方面的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a unilateral declaration of independence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单方面宣布独立

GramExa.GLOSS: when one country gets rid of its own nuclear weapons without waiting for other countries to do the same

Sense.DEF: not possible to imagine
Sense.TRAN: 不能想象的﹐想象不到的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unimaginable wealth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难以想象的财富

Sense.DEF: lacking the ability to think of new or unusual ideas
ordinary and boring, and not using any new ideas
Sense.TRAN: 平淡的﹐无趣的﹐无新意的﹐无创见的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unimaginative architecture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏创意的建筑
Sense.EXAMPLE: unimaginative housing policies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无新意的住房政策

Sense.DEF: so good, large, great etc that it is hard to imagine
Sense.TRAN: 〔好﹑大等得〕无法想象的﹐想象不到的

Sense.DEF: not damaged or made weak
so good or definite that criticism or doubt is impossible
Sense.TRAN: 无可指摘的﹐无懈可击的﹔不容置疑的﹔可靠的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unimpeachable morals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无可指摘的品行

Sense.DEF: happening or moving without being stopped or having difficulty
Sense.EXAMPLE: unimpeded progress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顺利的进展

Sense.DEF: not important
Sense.EXAMPLE: unimportant details
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无关紧要的细枝末节

Exponent.DEF: not important
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The exact details are unimportant.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 具体细节并不重要。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Girls’ education was seen as unimportant.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩的教育不被重视。

Exponent.DEF: not important, or not very important. These phrases sound a little more formal than unimportant.
Exponent.TRAN: 不/不太重要〔该短语比unimportant稍显正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If you’re capable of doing the job, your age is of no importance.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要能胜任这个工作﹐年龄无关紧要。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s of little importance whether or not this story is true.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该说法是否属实并不重要。

Exponent.DEF: small and not very likely to have an important effect - used especially about changes, problems, injuries, damage, or differences
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指变化﹑问题﹑伤害﹑损失或区别〕小的﹐无关紧要的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve made a few minor changes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我进行了一些小修改。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The driver suffered minor injuries.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 司机受了轻伤。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: These are just minor problems.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些只是小问题。

Exponent.DEF: very unimportant and not worth worrying about or spending time on
Exponent.TRAN: 微不足道的﹐没有价值的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They had a disagreement about some trivial matter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在某个枝节问题上有分歧。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She tends to get upset about trivial things.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她往往会因为一点小事就不高兴。

Exponent.DEF: very small and unimportant, especially when compared to other things
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指与其他事物相比〕无足轻重的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her own problems seemed insignificant.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她自己的问题好像并不重要。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The amount of carbon they produce is relatively insignificant.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 相对而言﹐他们的碳排放量就无足轻重了。

Exponent.DEF: extremely small and not important - used especially about effects, amounts, differences, or risks
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指效果﹑数量﹑区别或风险〕微不足道的﹐可以忽略的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: So far, the program has had a negligible effect.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 到目前为止﹐这个计划收效甚微。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The difference in price is negligible.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格差别可忽略不计。

Exponent.DEF: not as important as something else
Exponent.EXAMPLE: These issues are of secondary importance.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题是次要的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: For many women, a career is secondary to being mother.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对许多女人来说﹐事业不如生儿育女重要。

Sense.DEF: not thinking that someone or something is good, interesting etc
Sense.TRAN: 没有印象的﹔不感兴趣的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Board members were unimpressed with the plan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 董事会成员对这个计划没有兴趣。

Sense.DEF: not as good, large etc as expected or necessary
Sense.TRAN: 给人印象不深的﹔不惹人注意的﹐平淡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unimpressive test results
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平平的测试结果

Sense.DEF: not having enough knowledge or information
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents were left anxious, uninformed, and isolated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长们忧心忡忡﹐不知道情况到底如何﹐感到孤立无援。
Sense.EXAMPLE: uninformed criticism from uninformed journalists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自不了解情况的新闻记者的毫无根据的批评

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many immigrants are uninformed about US tax laws.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多移民对美国税法知之甚少。

Sense.DEF: if a place is uninhabitable, it is impossible to live in
Sense.TRAN: 不适宜居住的﹐无法居住的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Much of the country is uninhabitable because it is desert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于地处沙漠﹐这个国家的许多地区不适宜居住。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many houses were so badly damaged in the war that they were made permanently uninhabitable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多房屋在战争中严重受损﹐再也不能居住了。

Sense.DEF: an uninhabited place does not have anyone living there
Sense.TRAN: 无人居住的﹔杳无人迹的﹐没有人烟的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an uninhabited island
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杳无人迹的荒岛

Sense.DEF: confident or relaxed enough to do or say what you want to
Sense.TRAN: 不受约束的﹐无拘无束的﹐随意的
Sense.EXAMPLE: uninhibited laughter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开怀大笑

Sense.DEF: people who do not have special knowledge or experience of something
Sense.TRAN: 无某种专业知识[经验]者﹐外行﹐门外汉
Sense.EXAMPLE: To the uninitiated, this will make little sense.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对外行来说﹐这并没有什么意义。

Sense.DEF: not showing any imagination
Sense.TRAN: 缺乏创见的﹐没有想象力的﹔平凡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an uninspired performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乏味的演出

Sense.DEF: not at all interesting or exciting
Sense.TRAN: 引不起兴趣的﹔不令人振奋的
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one deserved to win this uninspiring game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁也不该赢这场乏味的比赛。

Sense.DEF: to completely remove a program from a computer
impossible to understand
Sense.TRAN: 难以理解的﹔晦涩难懂的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eva muttered something unintelligible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊娃咕哝了些无人能懂的话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: technical jargon that is unintelligible to outsiders
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 外行听不懂的专业术语

Sense.DEF: not done deliberately
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know she upset you, but I’m sure it was unintentional.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道她让你生气了﹐不过我肯定她不是故意的。

Sense.DEF: not interested

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was uninterested in politics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对政治不感兴趣。

Sense.DEF: continuous
Sense.EXAMPLE: uninterrupted sleep
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不间断的睡眠

Sense.DEF: if you have an uninterrupted view of something, there is nothing between you and that thing to stop you from seeing it clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: an uninterrupted view of the mountains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一览无遗的山景

Sense.DEF: not invited and expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: uninvited guests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不速之客
Sense.EXAMPLE: Helen turned up uninvited.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦不请自到。

Sense.DEF: an uninviting place seems unattractive or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方〕无吸引力的﹔令人讨厌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building was cold, dark, and uninviting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幢大楼又冷又黑﹐让人不敢进去。

Sense.DEF: something unpleasant that you will have to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: He faced the uninviting prospect of a two-hour wait for the next train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼下他得花两个小时等待下一班火车。

Sense.DEF: an organization formed by workers to protect their rights

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the National Union of Teachers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全国教师工会

Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you planning to join the union?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你打算加入工会吗？
工会会员

Sense.DEF: used in the names of some clubs or organizations
Sense.TRAN: 协会﹔联合会﹔俱乐部﹔会社〔用于组织的名称中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the British Golf Union
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国高尔夫球协会

Sense.DEF: the act of joining two or more things together, or the state of being joined together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The artist’s work shows the perfect union of craftsmanship and imagination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位艺术家的作品体现了工艺和想象力的完美结合。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some militants favour inde­pendence for Kashmir or union with Pakistan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些激进分子主张克什米尔独立或并入巴基斯坦。

Sense.DEF: a group of countries or states with the same central government
Sense.EXAMPLE: the former Soviet Union
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前苏联

Sense.DEF: used in the past to talk about the United States, especially the northern states during the Civil War
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指内战时期北部诸州的〕美利坚合众国﹐联邦

Sense.DEF: marriage
the activity of having sex, or an occasion when this happens
belief in the principles of trade unions
a member of a political party that wants Northern Ireland to remain part of the United Kingdom
Sense.TRAN: 〔主张北爱尔兰留在英国的〕统一党党员

Sense.DEF: if workers unionize or are unionized, they become members of a trade union
the national flag of the United Kingdom
Sense.TRAN: 联合王国国旗﹐英国国旗

Sense.DEF: a piece of underwear that covers the whole body, with long legs and long sleeves
unusually good and special
Sense.TRAN: 极好的﹔难得的﹐不同寻常的﹔特别的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a unique opportunity to study these rare creatures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究这些珍稀动物的难得机会

Sense.DEF: being the only one of its kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each person’s fingerprints are unique.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人的指纹都是独一无二的。

Sense.DEF: existing only in a particular place or in relation to a particular person or people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The issues being discussed here are not unique to the US.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在此讨论的问题并非美国独有。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: an actor uniquely suited to the part
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 特别适合这个角色的演员

Sense.DEF: intended for both men and women
Sense.TRAN: 不分男女的﹐男女皆适用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a unisex hairdressing salon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男女美发店

Subsense.DEF: if people speak or do something in unison, they say the same words at the same time or do the same thing at the same time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Good morning!’ the kids replied in unison.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “早上好！”孩子们齐声应答。

Subsense.DEF: if two groups, governments etc do something in unison, they do it together because they agree with each other
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Management and workers must act in unison to compete with foreign business.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管理层和员工必须联合起来与外国企业竞争。

Sense.DEF: a group of people working together as part of a larger group
Sense.EXAMPLE: The man is in the hospital’s intensive care unit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那名男子在医院的重症监护室。

Sense.DEF: an amount of something used as a standard of measurement

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The watt is a unit of electrical power.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓦是电功率单位。

Sense.DEF: a thing, person, or group that is regarded as one single whole part of something larger
Sense.TRAN: 单位﹐单元〔指构成更大整体的物﹑人﹑群体〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Russian army unit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俄罗斯陆军分队

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The family is the basic social unit of modern society.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭是现代社会的基本单位。

Sense.DEF: one of the numbered parts into which a textbooka book used in schools is divided
a single complete product made by a company
Sense.TRAN: 一件〔公司生产的完整产品〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The factory’s output is now up to 150,000 units each month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家工厂的产量现已达到每月 15 万件。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment which is part of a larger machine
a piece of furniture, especially one that can be attached to others of the same type
Sense.TRAN: 〔家具的〕组合件﹐一套中的一件
Sense.EXAMPLE: fitted kitchen units
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整体厨房组件
储物家具组合件

Sense.DEF: a single apartment in a larger building
an amount of work that a student needs to do in order to complete a particular course
any whole number less than ten
Sense.EXAMPLE: hundreds, tens, and units
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 百位数﹑十位数和个位数

Sense.DEF: a member of a Christian group that does not believe in the Trinity
Sense.TRAN: 一位论派信徒〔属于不信仰三位一体的基督教派别〕

Sense.DEF: relating to or existing as a single unit
Sense.EXAMPLE: a single unitary authority for the whole region
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个地区的统一管理机构

Sense.DEF: if different people or organizations unite, or if something unites them, they join together in order to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our goal is to unite the opposition parties and defeat the President.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的目标是联合各反对党挫败总统。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Party members united behind their leader.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 党员们联合起来支持他们的领袖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In 1960, the regions united to form the Somali Republic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1960年﹐各地区合并﹐成立了索马里共和国。

Sense.DEF: the largest trade union in the United Kingdom, with over two million members in the public and private sectors. It was formed in 2007 by the mergerjoining together of two trade unions (Amicus and the Transport and General Workers’ Union).
Sense.TRAN: 联合工会〔英国最大的工会﹐在公营和私营部门中拥有约两百多万名成员﹐于 2007 年由两大工会(制造业技术工人联合会和运输及普通工人工会)合并而成〕

Sense.DEF: joined or closely connected by feelings, aims etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a united Europe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 统一的欧洲
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two countries were united against a common enemy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个国家联合起来对付共同的敌人。

Sense.DEF: involving or done by everyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: a united effort to clean up the environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清洁环境的共同努力

Sense.DEF: used in the names of some football teams and companies
Sense.EXAMPLE: Manchester United
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼彻斯特联队
Sense.EXAMPLE: United Airlines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合航空公司

Sense.DEF: an international organization that tries to find peaceful solutions to world problems
the price that is charged for each single thing or quantity that is sold
a company through which you can buy shares in many different businesses
when a group of people or countries agree or are joined together
Sense.EXAMPLE: economic unity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济统一
Sense.EXAMPLE: European unity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲的一体化

Sense.DEF: the quality of having matching parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: His essays often lack unity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的文章往往缺乏整体感。

Sense.DEF: one of the three related principles that say a play should be about a single set of related events which happen in one place on one day
Sense.TRAN: 〔戏剧中情节﹑时间和地点的〕一致性﹔三一律
a written abbreviation of 书面缩写=university 大学

Sense.DEF: involving everyone in the world or in a particular group
Sense.TRAN: 全世界的﹔全体的﹔共同的
Sense.EXAMPLE: free universal healthcare
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 免费的全民保健制度
Sense.EXAMPLE: These stories have universal appeal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些故事人人都喜欢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a topic of universal interest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们普遍感兴趣的一个话题
Sense.EXAMPLE: a democracy based on universal suffrage when every adult has the right to vote
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建立在普选权上的民主

Sense.DEF: true or suitable in every situation
Sense.TRAN: 普遍正确的﹔广泛适用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a universal truth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 普遍的真理

Sense.DEF: a part in a machine, at the point where two other parts join together, that can turn in all directions
a bar code
Sense.TRAN: 通用产品代码﹐通用商品条码

Sense.DEF: all space, including all the stars and planets

GramExa.EXAMPLE: everything in the universe
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 宇宙万物

Sense.DEF: a world or an area of space that is different from the one we are in

Sense.LEXUNIT: be the centre of sb’s universe
Sense.DEF: to be the most important person or thing to someone
a person’s life, including all of the people, places, and ideas which affect them
an educational institution at the highest level, where you study for a degree

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s at Cambridge University.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在剑桥大学念书。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the University of Texas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 得克萨斯大学

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her daughter was about to go to university.
She studied law at Edinburgh University.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在爱丁堡大学读法律。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He studied history at school and was now planning to take a university course.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在中学里学了历史﹐现在打算读一个大学课程。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Thirty years ago 33% of university students were female.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 三十年前﹐33% 的大学生是女生。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone who has completed a university course
the area of land containing the main buildings of a university

Sense.DEF: not fair or reasonable
Sense.TRAN: 不公平的﹐不公正的﹔不合理的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unjust laws
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不公正的法律

Sense.DEF: completely wrong and unacceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poisoning the earth’s atmosphere is ecologically and morally unjustifiable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 污染地球的大气在生态上和道德上都是不能接受的。

Sense.DEF: done without an acceptable reason
Sense.EXAMPLE: unjustified price increases
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无端的涨价

Sense.DEF: unkempt hair or plants have not been cut and kept neat
nasty, unpleasant, or cruel
Sense.TRAN: 不仁慈的﹔不和善的﹔刻薄的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of unkind things were said.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说了很多刻薄话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her husband is very unkind to her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丈夫对她非常刻薄。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say mean, nasty, or horrible rather than unkind
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 mean, nasty 或 horrible﹐而不说 unkind
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The other kids were really mean to me.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他孩子对我非常不好。

Exponent.DEF: treating people in a way that makes them unhappy or upset. Unkind sounds rather formal. In everyday English, people usually say mean or nasty.
Exponent.TRAN: 不仁慈的﹔不和善的﹔刻薄的〔unkind较为正式﹔在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 mean 或 nasty〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Children can be very unkind to each other.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童有时互相之间会很不友善。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a rather unkind remark
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常刻薄的言论

Exponent.DEF: unkind
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t be mean to your sister!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别对你妹妹这么刻薄！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a mean thing to do.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么做太损了。

Exponent.DEF: deliberately unkind, and seeming to enjoy making people unhappy
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He said some really nasty things before he left.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走之前说了几句极难听的话。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a nasty man
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个讨厌的人

Exponent.DEF: unkind - used about remarks and actions
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Joe couldn’t forget the hurtful things she had said.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔忘不了她说的那些伤人的话。

Exponent.DEF: deliberately unkind to someone because you are jealous of them or angry with them
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因嫉妒或愤怒而〕恶毒的﹐刻薄的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The other women were spiteful to her, and gave her the hardest work to do.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他女人对她很恶毒﹐把最累的活给她做。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She watched them with spiteful glee pleasure.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她幸灾乐祸地看着他们。

Exponent.DEF: deliberately behaving in a way that is likely to upset, hurt, or cause problems for someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Someone had been spreading malicious rumours about him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人一直在散播有关他的恶毒谣言。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a malicious smile on her face.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上带着一种恶意的微笑。

Exponent.DEF: not seeming to care about someone’s problems, and not trying to help them or make them feel better
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her parents were very unsympathetic, and told her that she deserved to fail her exam.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父母一点也不同情她﹐说她考试不及格是活该。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an unsympathetic boss
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无同情心的老板

Exponent.DEF: very unsympathetic and not caring at all about other people’s feelings
Exponent.TRAN: 硬心肠的﹔没有同情心的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Was he hard-hearted enough to leave his son in jail overnight?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有这么硬的心肠﹐会把儿子留在囚室里过夜吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a hard-hearted businessman
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个铁石心肠的生意人

Section.SECHEADING: VERY UNKIND 非常不仁慈的

Exponent.DEF: very unkind
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Why is Jack always so horrible to me?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么杰克总是对我这么凶？

Exponent.DEF: very unkind and deliberately making people feel unhappy or making them suffer physically
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her father was very cruel to her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父亲对她非常残忍。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a selfish, cruel woman
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个自私﹑残忍的女人

Exponent.DEF: extremely unkind and behaving in a very immoral way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a wicked thing to do
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件邪恶的事
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the wicked stepmother in Cinderella
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 《灰姑娘》里的恶毒继母

Exponent.DEF: extremely unkind and enjoying making other people suffer
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Their father was a sadistic bully who beat them regularly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的父亲是个施虐狂﹐经常打他们。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He took a certain sadistic pleasure in his job.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在工作中获得某种施虐狂般的快感。

Section.SECHEADING: UNINTENTIONALLY UNKIND 非有意不仁慈的

Exponent.DEF: not thinking about the effects of your actions on other people
Exponent.TRAN: 欠考虑的﹔不为他人着想的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was inconsiderate of him not to say that he would be late.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没提前说要迟到﹐这一点是有欠考虑。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a thoughtless disregard for other people’s feelings
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他人情感的漠视

Exponent.DEF: someone who is tactless carelessly says or does things that are likely to upset someone, whithour realizing what they are doing
Exponent.TRAN: 言行不得体的﹔不圆通的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How could you be so tactless?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么这么不会说话？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a tactless question
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不得当的问题

Exponent.DEF: behaving in a way that is likely to upset someone, or not seeming to care about someone’s feelings - rather a formal word
Exponent.TRAN: 漠不关心的﹐麻木不仁的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The article is insensitive to the family and friends of the victim.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章毫不顾及受害者亲友的感情。

Sense.DEF: not realizing what you are doing or what is happening

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She became ill after unknowingly taking an illegal drug.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在不知情的情况下服用了一种违禁药品﹐身体感到不适。

Sense.DEF: not known about
Sense.EXAMPLE: The murderer’s identity remains unknown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杀人凶手身份仍然不明。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For some unknown reason, Mark quit his job and moved to Greece.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知何故﹐马克辞掉工作移居希腊了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a voyage through unknown territory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿越未知海域的航行
Sense.EXAMPLE: An unknown number of people were killed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丧生人数不详。

Sense.DEF: not famous
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unknown artist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位名不见经传的艺术家

Sense.DEF: without someone knowing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unknown to his wife, Ron had been having an affair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗恩有了外遇﹐可他妻子并不知情。

Sense.DEF: if someone or something is an unknown quantity, you do not know what their abilities are or how they are likely to behave
someone who is not famous
Sense.EXAMPLE: At that point in her career she was still an unknown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在她事业的那个阶段﹐她还是个无名小卒。

Sense.DEF: something that is not known
Sense.TRAN: 不明的情况﹔未知的因素
Sense.EXAMPLE: The long-term effects of the drug are still an unknown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药品的长期作用还是个未知数。

Subsense.DEF: a place that is not known about or that has not been visited by humans
Subsense.TRAN: 不为人知 [人类尚未到达]的地方
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The astronauts began their journey into the unknown.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宇航员开始了对未知世界的探索之旅。

Subsense.DEF: things that you do not know or understand
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a fear of the unknown
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对未知事物的恐惧

Sense.DEF: not legal
Sense.TRAN: 不合法的﹐非法的﹐违法的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jury returned a verdict of unlawful killing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团作出了非法杀害的裁决。

Sense.DEF: unleaded petrol does not contain any lead

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 本的汽车只用无铅汽油。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately forget something you have learned, in order to change the way you do something
Sense.TRAN: 设法忘记﹐抛弃〔已学会的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to unlearn bad driving habits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难改掉不好的驾驶习惯。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly let a strong force, feeling etc have its full effect
Sense.TRAN: 突然释放﹐发泄〔力量﹑感情等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lefèvre’s comments unleashed a wave of protest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 勒菲弗的评论引发了一波抗议的浪潮。

Sense.DEF: to let a dog run free after it has been held on a leash
unleavened bread is flat because it is not made with yeast
used to say that something will happen or be true if something else does not happen or is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unless some extra money is found, the theatre will close.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是不能找到更多资金﹐剧院将要关闭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think you should complain – unless, of course, you are happy with the way things are.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得你应该发发牢骚——当然﹐除非你对现状很满意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He won’t go to sleep unless you tell him a story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你不给他讲故事他就不睡觉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t leave her unless I know she’s all right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除非我知道她没事﹐否则我不能离开她。

Sense.DEF: only if
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Will you go with her?’ ‘Not unless she wants me to.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你和她一起去吗？” “她想让我去我才会去。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法:unless, if ... not, in case, or (else)
F2NBox.EXPL: Use unless to say that something will happen or be true if something else does not happen or is not true. Do not use ‘will’ or ‘shall’ after unless. Use the present tense or present perfect.
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示某事将会在另一事不发生或不属实的情况下发生或属实﹐用 unless。unless 后不用 will 或 shall﹐而要用现在时或现在完成时
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Businesses will not survive unless they satisfy (NOT 不说 will satisfy) their customers.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 企业只有满足客户需求才能生存下去。
F2NBox.EXPL: If you want to mention something that did in fact happen or is in fact true, use if ... not.
F2NBox.TRAN: 如要表示某事的确发生过或的确是事实﹐用 if ... not
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: If he had not tripped, he would have won but he did trip.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 要不是他被绊倒了﹐他就赢了。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I would go out if it wasn’t raining but it is raining.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 要不是下雨﹐我就出去了。
F2NBox.EXPL: Use in case when talking about something that is or should be done because something might happen.
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示因为某事有可能发生而做或应该做另一件事﹐用 in case
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Take a sweater in case you get cold (NOT 不说 unless you get cold).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 带一件毛衣﹐以防你觉得冷。
F2NBox.EXPL: Use or or or else to say what bad thing will definitely happen if something else does not happen.
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示如果不做另一件事﹐某件不好的事肯定会发生﹐用 or 或 or else
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: You’d better go, or else you’ll miss the train (NOT 不说 unless you miss the train).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你该走了﹐否则会赶不上火车的。

Sense.DEF: unable to read, or uneducated
without a licenceofficial document that gives you permission to do or have something
Sense.TRAN: 没有执照的﹔未得到许可证的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unlicensed guns
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无证枪支

Sense.DEF: completely different from a particular person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tammy was unlike any other woman I have ever known.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塔米和我认识的其他女人都不一样。

Sense.DEF: not typical of someone at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s unlike Greg to be late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迟到可不是格雷格的作风。

Sense.DEF: used when saying how one person or thing is differ­ent from another
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unlike most people in the office, I don’t come to work by car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和办公室大多数同事不同﹐我不是开车上班的。

Sense.DEF: similar to
Sense.EXAMPLE: In appearance John is not unlike his brother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰和他兄弟长得有些像。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The landscape is not unlike that of Scotland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这景色和苏格兰相似。

Sense.DEF: not alike
not likely to happen
Sense.TRAN: 未必会发生的﹐不大可能的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Donna might be able to come tomorrow, but it’s very unlikely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐娜明天也许能来﹐不过这可能性很小。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The weather is unlikely to improve over the next few days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来的几天天气不大可能好转。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s unlikely that the thieves will be caught.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这伙窃贼被抓住的可能性不大。

GramExa.PROPFORM: in the unlikely event of sth
GramExa.GLOSS: if something which is unlikely happens
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the unlikely event of a fire, passengers should move to the top deck.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 万一发生火警﹐乘客应转移到顶层甲板上。

Sense.DEF: an unlikely place, person, or thing is strange and not what you would expect
Sense.EXAMPLE: The birds had nested in some unlikely places.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种鸟在让人意想不到的地方筑了巢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The quiet village of Brockhampton was an unlikely setting for such a crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难相信宁静的布罗克汉普顿村会发生这样的犯罪。

Sense.DEF: not likely to be true
Sense.TRAN: 不大可能是真的﹐靠不住的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unlikely story
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不大可信的说法

Sense.DEF: without any limit
Sense.EXAMPLE: The system can support an unlimited number of users.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该系统可以支持无限多的用户。
Sense.EXAMPLE: unlimited access to information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无限制查阅资料
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ticket offers unlimited travel on the London underground for seven days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凭本票可在七日内无限次乘坐伦敦地铁。

Sense.DEF: very large in amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unlimited variety of cookies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多种多样的甜饼干

Sense.DEF: not shown on an official stock exchange list
not in the list of numbers in the telephone directory
dark because there are no lights
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unlit stairway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未亮灯的楼梯

Subsense.DEF: to remove a load from a vehicle, ship etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The driver unloaded some boxes from the back of the truck.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 司机从卡车后部卸下了一些箱子。

Subsense.DEF: if a ship unloads, the goods that it carries are removed from it

Sense.DEF: informal

Subsense.DEF: to get rid of some­thing illegal or not very good by selling it quickly
Subsense.TRAN: 把〔非法或不是很好的东西〕脱手﹐抛售﹔倾销
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Investors continued to unload technology stocks on Thursday.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期四投资者继续抛售科技股。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of cheap videos were unloaded on the British market.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 数百种廉价录像带在英国市场上倾销。

Subsense.DEF: to get rid of work or responsibility by giving it to someone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t let him unload his problems onto you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别让他把他的问题都推到你身上。

Sense.DEF: to express strong feelings, especially anger, to someone when you are extremely upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: Koch unloaded his concerns over dinner one night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一天晚上吃饭时﹐科克诉说了自己的担忧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When he got back to the office, Green unloaded on his staff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格林回到办公室后﹐把气撒在了员工身上。

Sense.DEF: to remove the film from a camera
to remove the bullets from a gun
to unfasten the lock on a door, box etc
to discover important facts about something
not expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: unlooked-for success
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意外的成功

Sense.DEF: to untie or unfasten something
not loved by anyone
Sense.TRAN: 无人喜爱的﹐没有人爱的

Sense.DEF: ugly
having bad luck
Sense.TRAN: 不幸的﹔不走运的﹔倒霉的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Inter Milan were unlucky to lose the match.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际米兰队真不走运﹐输掉了比赛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were unlucky with the weather this weekend. It rained constantly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们真不走运﹐这个周末天一直在下雨。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Thierry Henry was desperately unlucky not to score when his shot hit the post.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂埃里·亨利太不走运了﹐射门没进﹐球打中了门柱。

Sense.DEF: causing bad luck
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some people think black cats are unlucky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人认为黑猫不吉利。

Sense.DEF: happening as a result of bad luck
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unlucky accident
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 倒霉的事故
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was unlucky for Stephen that the boss happened to walk in just at that moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬真倒霉﹐碰巧那一刻老板走了进来。

Sense.DEF: an unmade bed has not been made tidy after someone has slept in it
an unmade road is one whose surface has not been covered with a special hard material
difficult to control or deal with
Sense.TRAN: 难控制的﹔难处理的﹔难办的

Sense.DEF: not thought to be suitable for or typical of a man
Sense.TRAN: 不适于男子的﹔无男子气概的﹔柔弱的

Sense.DEF: an unmanned spacecraft does not have a person inside it
if a place is unmanned, nobody is working there
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unmanned railway crossing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无人看管的铁路道口

Sense.DEF: something that is unmarked has no words or signs on it to show where or what it is
Sense.TRAN: 未做标记的﹔没有标志的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unmarked grave
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无名冢
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unmarked police car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无标志的警车

Sense.DEF: not married
Sense.EXAMPLE: unmarried mothers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未婚母亲

Sense.DEF: to make known the hidden truth about someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was one of the most high-ranking spies ever unmasked by the CIA.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是中央情报局所揭露的最高级别的间谍之一。

Sense.DEF: better than any other
Sense.TRAN: 无可比拟的﹐无与伦比的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a woman of unmatched beauty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美貌绝伦的女子

Sense.DEF: too shocking or embarrassing to talk about
Sense.TRAN: 〔因太震惊或尴尬而〕说不出口的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unmentionable scandals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难以启齿的丑闻

Sense.DEF: underwear – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 内衣﹐贴身衣服〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: unmet needs, demands etc have not been dealt with
easy to recognize
Sense.TRAN: 不会弄错的﹐清楚明白的﹐显然的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the unmistakable sound of gunfire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清清楚楚的枪炮声

Sense.DEF: something that is completely bad or good
Sense.TRAN: 十足的灾难/失败/快乐等

Sense.DEF: feeling no pity, sympathy, or sadness

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Richard seemed unmoved by the tragedy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 理查德对这场灾难似乎无动于衷。

Sense.DEF: an unnamed person, place, or thing has been mentioned but not referred to by name
different from what you would normally expect
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was very cold, which seemed unnatural for late spring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天很冷﹐对于晚春来说似乎不正常。

Sense.DEF: seeming false, or not real or natural
Sense.TRAN: 看似虚假的﹔不真实的﹔不自然的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Julia’s laugh seemed forced and unnatural.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉娅的笑容看上去勉强而不自然。

Sense.DEF: different from normal human behaviour in a way that seems morally wrong
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为〕违反常理的﹐违背人道的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unnatural sexual practices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 变态的性行为

Sense.DEF: different from anything produced by nature
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her hair was an unnatural orange.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发是非天然的橘黄色。

Sense.DEF: not needed, or more than is needed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an unnecessary expense
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不必要的支出

Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no point in taking unnecessary risks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冒不必要的风险没什么意义。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can’t afford any unnecessary delays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们经不起无谓的耽搁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Williams was found guilty of causing unnecessary suffering to animals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉斯因无故虐待动物被判有罪。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to worry you unnecessarily.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想给你增添不必要的烦恼。

Sense.DEF: to upset or frighten someone so that they lose their confidence or their ability to think clearly
