Sense.EXAMPLE: He was unnerved by the way Sylvia kept staring at him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西尔维娅一直盯着他看﹐让他觉得心里发慌。

Sense.DEF: without being noticed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elsa stood unnoticed at the edge of the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃尔莎悄悄地站在人群边上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His remark went unnoticed by everyone except me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话除了我别人都没注意到。

Sense.DEF: not having a number
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unnumbered Swiss bank account
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有编号的瑞士银行账户

Sense.DEF: too many to be counted
not noticed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Frank slipped out of the meeting unobserved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克悄悄地溜出了会场。

Sense.DEF: not blocked by anything
Sense.TRAN: 不被阻塞的﹐没有障碍的﹐畅通无阻的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unobstructed view of the lake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一览无遗的湖景

Sense.DEF: impossible to get
Sense.TRAN: 不能得到的﹐无法获得的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fresh fruit was unobtainable in the winter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新鲜水果在冬季是买不到的。

Sense.DEF: not easily noticed
Sense.TRAN: 不引人注目的﹐不显眼的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The staff are trained to be unobtrusive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工们受过训练要保持低调。

Sense.DEF: a seat, house, room etc that is unoccupied has no one in it
Sense.TRAN: 〔座位﹑房屋﹑房间等〕未被占用的﹐空着的

Sense.DEF: an unoccupied country or area is not controlled by the enemy during a war
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家﹑地区在战争中〕未被(敌人)占领的﹐未沦陷的

Sense.DEF: done or produced without formal approval or permission
Sense.TRAN: 非官方的﹔非正式批准的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hodges wrote an unofficial biography of the artist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍奇斯写了一部这位艺术家的非正式传记。

Sense.DEF: not done as part of your job
Sense.TRAN: 非公事的﹐私事的﹐私人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President made an unofficial visit to the Senator’s house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统到那位参议员的家作了一次私人访问。

Sense.DEF: an unopened package, letter etc has not been opened yet
Sense.EXAMPLE: The letter was returned to us unopened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那封信原封不动地退给了我们。

Sense.DEF: without any opponent or opposition, especially in an election
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指选举中〕没有对手的﹔无人反对的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roberts was elected unopposed as president.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伯茨没有受到任何阻挠﹐顺利当选总裁。

Sense.TRAN: 杂乱无章的﹔组织不善的﹔计划不周的

Sense.DEF: people who are unorganized do not have an organization, union, group etc to help or support them
Sense.TRAN: 没有加入组织的﹐没有组织支持的

Sense.DEF: unorthodox opinions or methods are different from what is usual or accepted by most people
Sense.TRAN: 〔信念或方法〕非传统的﹐非正统的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her unorthodox views tend to attract controversy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她离经叛道的观点往往会招来争议。

Sense.DEF: to take everything out of a box, bag, suitcase etc
Sense.TRAN: 打开〔盒子﹑包﹑手提箱等〕取出〔物品〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t had a chance to unpack yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没来得及打开行李。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She unpacked her suitcase and headed for the beach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她取出手提箱里的东西﹐往海滩那边去了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maggie carefully unpacked the gifts she had bought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛吉小心翼翼地打开她买的礼物。

Sense.DEF: to make an idea or problem easier to understand by considering all the parts of it separately
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the issues surrounding mental illness have been unpacked in Chapter 3.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些有关精神疾病的问题已在第 3 章作了分析。

Sense.DEF: an unpaid bill or debt has not been paid
done without receiving payment
Sense.EXAMPLE: unpaid work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无报酬的工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: unpaid leave
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无薪休假

Sense.DEF: an unpalatable fact or idea is very unpleasant and difficult to accept
Sense.TRAN: 〔事实或想法〕使人不快的﹔令人讨厌的﹔难以接受的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The unpalatable truth is that the team isn’t getting any better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让人难以接受的事实是这个队没有任何进步。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an idea that’s unpalatable to most people
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让大多数人都难以接受的想法

Sense.DEF: unpalatable food tastes unpleasant
bigger, better, or worse than anything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: an achievement unparalleled in sporting history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育史上空前的成就

Sense.DEF: unpardonable behaviour is completely unacceptable
Sense.TRAN: 不可宽恕的﹐不可原谅的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unpardonable offence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可饶恕的罪行

Sense.DEF: not supporting your country
Sense.TRAN: 不爱国的﹐没有爱国心的

Sense.DEF: an unpaved road does not have a smooth hard surface
unpeeled fruit or vegetables still have their skin on them
not worried or annoyed by something that has happened
Sense.TRAN: 不受扰乱的﹐镇定的﹐平静的
Sense.EXAMPLE: John seemed unperturbed by the news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰听到这个消息似乎并不惊慌。

Sense.DEF: to take out stitches from a piece of cloth or knitting
Sense.TRAN: 拆去〔衣料或编织物上〕的针脚[缝线]

Sense.DEF: to examine the different parts of a subject, deal etc, especially in order to find faults
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want to unpick the past.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想翻旧账。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are fears that the president might unpick the treaty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人担心总统会挑那个协议的毛病。

Sense.DEF: not one of the first three to finish in a race or competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔在比赛中〕未获前三名的﹐无名次的﹐落选的

Sense.DEF: not planned or expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unplanned pregnancy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意外怀孕

Sense.DEF: in sport, a ball that is unplayable is difficult to hit because of its position or speed
a sports field that is unplayable is in too bad a condition to play on
not pleasant or enjoyable
Sense.TRAN: 使人不愉快的﹔不合意的﹔讨厌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unpleasant experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不愉快的经历
Sense.EXAMPLE: an extremely unpleasant smell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极其难闻的味道
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unpleasant surprise
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人不快的意外

Sense.DEF: not kind or friendly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He said some very unpleasant things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说了一些很不客气的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thoroughly unpleasant man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个极不友善的男人

Sense.DEF: trouble or arguments between people
to disconnect a piece of electrical equipment by pulling its plug out of a socket
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unplug the TV before you go to bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 睡前拔下电视机的插头。

Sense.DEF: if a group of musicians perform unplugged, they perform without electric instruments
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐人演出〕不用电子乐器的[地]﹐不插电的[地]

Sense.DEF: not liked by most people
Sense.TRAN: 不受欢迎的﹐不得人心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unpopular choice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不得人心的选择
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unpopular teacher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不受欢迎的老师

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a decision that was deeply unpopular with students
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常不受学生欢迎的决定

Sense.DEF: never having happened before, or never having happened so much
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took the unprecedented step of stating that the rumours were false.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他史无前例地声明那些谣言实属子虚乌有。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crime has increased on an unprecedented scale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪率增幅之大前所未有。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an event that is unprecedented in recent history
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 近代历史上没有先例的事件

Sense.DEF: changing a lot so it is impossible to know what will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: unpredictable weather
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难以预测的天气
Sense.EXAMPLE: the unpredictable nature of language
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言的不可预测性

Sense.DEF: someone who is unpredictable tends to change their behaviour or ideas suddenly, so that you never know what they are going to do or think
not ready to deal with something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was totally unprepared for the challenge which faced me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于面前的挑战我毫无准备。

Sense.DEF: not willing to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were unprepared to accept the conditions of the contract.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不愿意接受合同的条件。

Sense.DEF: not very attractive or noticeable
Sense.TRAN: 不吸引人的﹐不引人注意的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite his unprepossessing appearance, he was very popular with women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他虽然其貌不扬﹐但很有女人缘。

Sense.DEF: not trying to seem better, more important etc than you really are – use this to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 不炫耀的﹐不招摇的﹔不装模作样的〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unpretentious hotel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简朴的酒店
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unpretentious woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行事低调的女子

Sense.DEF: not caring whether what you do is morally right
Sense.TRAN: 无原则的﹐不讲道德的﹐不择手段的

Sense.DEF: words or remarks that are unprintable are so rude or shocking that you do not want to say what they are
Sense.TRAN: 〔词语或言语因粗鲁或人听闻而〕不宜发表的﹐不能刊印的

Sense.DEF: not achieving very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unproductive meeting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有成果的会议

Sense.DEF: behaving in a way that is not acceptable in a particular profession
Sense.EXAMPLE: Johnson was fired for unprofessional conduct.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊因为有违反职业道德的行为而被开除了。

Sense.DEF: making no profit
Sense.EXAMPLE: unprofitable businesses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不赢利的企业

Sense.DEF: producing no advantages
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would be unprofitable to pursue this argument any further.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个争论再继续下去也是徒劳。

Sense.DEF: not likely to be good or successful
Sense.TRAN: 不乐观的﹔不大会成功的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales improved after an unpromising start.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售在经历了一个不容乐观的开端之后出现了好转。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unpromising place for a picnic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不太理想的野餐地点

Sense.DEF: said or done without anyone asking you to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quite unprompted, he offered to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他主动提出帮忙。

Sense.DEF: an unpronounceable word or name is very difficult to say
not protected against possible harm or damage
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thieves often target unprotected vehicles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窃贼常常瞄准未采取防护措施的车辆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Part-time workers are unprotected by this law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兼职职员不受这条法规保护。

Sense.DEF: unprotected machines are not covered and could injure someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Machinery was often unprotected and accidents were frequent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机器经常裸露着﹐因此事故频繁发生。

Sense.DEF: sex without using a condom
not proved or tested
Sense.TRAN: 未经证实的﹔未经检验的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unproven allegations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未经证实的指控
Sense.EXAMPLE: unproven medical treatments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未经试验的治疗方法

Sense.DEF: unprovoked anger, attacks etc are directed at someone who has not done anything to deserve them
Sense.TRAN: 〔愤怒﹑攻击等〕无端的﹐无缘无故的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a totally unprovoked attack on an innocent man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那完全是对一名无辜男子的无端袭击。

Sense.DEF: unpublished writing, information etc has never been published
if someone or something bad they have done goes unpunished, they are not punished
Sense.EXAMPLE: An attack like that cannot go unpunished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像那样的袭击行为不能让它逃脱惩罚。

Sense.DEF: an unputdownable book is very interesting and exciting
not having the right knowledge, experience, or education to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: unqualified staff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不合格的员工

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was unqualified for the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不能胜任这份工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I feel unqualified to advise you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得自己没有资格向你提建议。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse with disqualifiedofficially not allowed to do something. 不要和disqualified (被取消资格的)混淆: She was disqualified from driving. 她被取消了驾驶资格。

Sense.DEF: used for emphasizing that a quality is complete and total
Sense.EXAMPLE: The experiment had not been an unqualified success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次试验并非百分之百成功。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave her his unqualified support.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他全力支持她。

Sense.DEF: an unquenchable desire is one that is impossible to satisfy
Sense.EXAMPLE: the seemingly unquenchable thirstdesire for Western art
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对西方美术似乎永无止境的渴求

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is certainly true
Sense.TRAN: 毫无疑问地﹐无可置疑地﹐肯定地
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Eiffel Tower is unquestionably one of Paris’s most familiar landmarks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃菲尔铁塔无疑是巴黎最为人熟知的地标之一。

Sense.DEF: something that is unquestioned is accepted or believed by everyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole approach is based on unquestioned assumptions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个方法是以公认的假设为基础。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unquestioned right
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公认的权利

Sense.DEF: an unquestioning faith, attitude etc is very certain and without doubts
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unquestioning belief in God
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对上帝的信不移

Sense.DEF: making you feel anxious
to understand or explain something that is mysterious or complicated
Sense.EXAMPLE: Detectives are still trying to unravel the mystery surrounding his death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侦探们仍在试图解开他的死亡之谜。

Sense.DEF: if you unravel threads, string etc, or if they unravel, they stop being twisted together
Sense.TRAN: 解开﹐拆散〔缠在一起的线﹑绳等〕﹔(使)松开

Sense.DEF: if a system, plan, organization etc unravels, it starts to fail
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company started to unravel when two of the directors were arrested.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名董事被捕以后﹐公司开始分崩离析。

Sense.DEF: unread books, papers etc have not been read
if someone’s expression or face is unreadable, you cannot tell what they are thinking
Sense.TRAN: 〔表情〕难以捉摸的﹐无法理解的

Sense.DEF: an unreadable book or piece of writing is difficult to read because it is boring or complicated
Sense.TRAN: 〔因无趣或复杂而〕读不下去的﹔可读性差的

Sense.DEF: unreadable writing is so untidy that you cannot read it
Sense.TRAN: 字迹潦草的﹐难以辨认的

Sense.DEF: an experience, situation etc that is unreal seems so strange that you think you must be imagining it
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seemed unreal to be sitting and talking to someone so famous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和这么一位大名鼎鼎的人坐在一起谈话似乎很不真实。

Sense.DEF: not related to real things that happen
Sense.TRAN: 脱离现实的﹐不切实际的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people go into marriage with unreal expectations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人都是怀着不切实际的憧憬步入婚姻的。

Sense.DEF: very exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our trip to Disneyland was unreal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的迪士尼乐园之旅棒极了。

Sense.DEF: unrealistic ideas or hopes are not reasonable or sensible

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is unrealistic to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is unrealistic to expect these changes to happen overnight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 期待这些改变一夜之间就能发生是不切实际的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Some parents have totally unrealistic expectations of teachers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些家长对老师抱着完全不切实际的期望。

Sense.DEF: not achieved
Sense.EXAMPLE: unrealized potential
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未发挥的潜力

Sense.DEF: unrealized profits, losses etc have not been changed into a form that can be used as money
not fair or sensible
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think he’s being unreasonable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为他是在无理取闹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t let your boss make unreasonable demands on you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别让你的老板对你提无理的要求。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is unreasonable to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s unreasonable to expect you to work seven days a week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要你一星期上七天班也太不讲理了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s not unreasonable to ask him to help you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 叫他帮助你并无不妥。

Sense.DEF: unreasonable prices, costs etc are too high
an unreasoning feeling is not based on facts or good reasons
Sense.TRAN: 〔情感〕无端的﹐没有根据的﹔缺乏理智的

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is unrecognizable has changed or been damaged so much that you do not recognize them
Sense.TRAN: 〔变得〕不能识别的﹐认不出来的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hadn’t been to the city for 20 years and it was almost unrecognizable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经 20 年没有到过这座城市﹐几乎认不出来了。

Sense.DEF: not having received praise or respect for something good you have achieved
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the great unrecognized jazzmen of the 1930s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪 30 年代没有得到承认的杰出爵士乐演奏者之一

Sense.DEF: not noticed or not thought to be important
Sense.TRAN: 不被注意的﹔被忽略的﹐不受重视的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an illness that can go unrecognized for years
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能会被忽视多年的一种疾病

Sense.DEF: an unrecognized group, meeting, agreement etc is not considered to be legal or acceptable by someone in authority
Sense.TRAN: 〔组织﹑会议﹑协议等〕非法的﹐得不到承认的

Sense.DEF: doing something without people recognizing who you are
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was able to walk down the street totally unrecognized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走在大街上完全没被人认出来。

Sense.DEF: not changing your ideas even though many people think they are old-fashioned
Sense.TRAN: 思想僵化的﹐顽固守旧的﹐坚持过时观点的

Sense.DEF: not written down or recorded
Sense.TRAN: 未写下来的﹔未记录的﹔未登记的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the complaints have gone unrecorded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多投诉都未作记录。

Sense.DEF: an unrefined sub­stance is in its natural form
Sense.EXAMPLE: unrefined sugar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗糖

Sense.DEF: not polite or educated
Sense.TRAN: 不礼貌的﹐粗俗的﹔无教养的

Sense.DEF: not included on an official list
Sense.EXAMPLE: unregistered land
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未注册的土地

Sense.DEF: not controlled by a government or law
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unregulated banking system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无监管的银行系统

Sense.DEF: two things that are unrelated are not connected to each other in any way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police think that the two incidents are unrelated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方认为这两个事件互不相关。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His illness is unrelated to the accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的病和那次事故无关。

Sense.DEF: people who are unrelated are not from the same family
Sense.TRAN: 无亲戚关系的﹔非亲属的

Sense.DEF: an unpleasant situation that is unrelenting continues for a long time without stopping
Sense.TRAN: 〔不愉快的情况〕持续的﹐不断的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the unrelenting pressures of the job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 持续的工作压力

Sense.DEF: continuing to do something in a determined way without thinking about anyone else’s feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unrelenting opponent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不顾一切的对手

Sense.DEF: unable to be trusted or depended on
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car’s becoming very unreliable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车的性能变得非常不稳定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unreliable witness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可靠的证人

Sense.DEF: an unpleasant situation that is unrelieved continues for a long time because nothing happens to change it
Sense.TRAN: 〔讨厌的情况〕未减轻的﹐未解除的﹐无变化的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unrelieved pain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无缓解的疼痛

Sense.DEF: not very unusual or interesting
Sense.TRAN: 不引人注意的﹐不显著的﹔平凡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He led a busy but otherwise unremarkable life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他过着忙忙碌碌却又平平淡淡的生活。

Sense.DEF: continuing for a long time and not likely to stop
Sense.EXAMPLE: unremitting poverty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长期的贫困

Sense.DEF: too rude or offensive to repeat
Sense.TRAN: 〔因太粗俗或冒犯人而〕不宜重复的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He said something unrepeatable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说了些不堪入耳的话。

Sense.DEF: unable to be done again
not ashamed of your behaviour or beliefs, even though other people disapprove
Sense.TRAN: 不悔改的﹐不悔悟的﹔顽固的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He remains unrepentant about his comments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对自己的这番话毫无悔意。

Sense.DEF: not told to the public or to someone in authority
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rape is a crime that often goes unreported.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强奸罪案常常没有人报案。

Sense.DEF: not typical of a particular group of things or people
Sense.TRAN: 不典型的﹐不具代表性的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: opinions that are unrepresentative of the population
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不代表全部人的观点

Sense.DEF: unrequited love or other strong feeling is love etc that you feel for someone but that they do not feel for you
Sense.TRAN: 〔爱或其他强烈的情感〕无回报的﹐单方面的﹔单恋的﹐单相思的

Sense.DEF: completed and without any doubts
Sense.EXAMPLE: unreserved support for the Prime Minister
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对首相的全力支持

Sense.DEF: not booked
Sense.EXAMPLE: We found some unreserved seats on the train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在火车上找到几个没被预订的座位。

Sense.DEF: if you express a feeling or opinion unreservedly, you do it completely and without any doubts
Sense.TRAN: 毫无保留地﹐完全地﹔坦率地
Sense.EXAMPLE: He apologized unreservedly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坦诚地道了歉。

Sense.DEF: an unresolved problem or question has not been answered or solved
Sense.EXAMPLE: the unresolved issue of who will pay for the project
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 项目由谁出资这个悬而未决的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unresolved conflict
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有解决的冲突

Sense.DEF: not reacting to something or not affected by it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The disease is totally unresponsive to conventional treatment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 常规疗法对这种病根本不起作用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His warning fell on unresponsive earswas not listened to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的警告无人理会。

Sense.DEF: a political situation in which people protest or behave violently
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is growing unrest throughout the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全国各地日益动荡不安。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The protests were the biggest show of social unrest since the government came to power.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些抗议活动是这届政府上台以来最大的一次社会动荡。

Sense.DEF: not controlled or limited
Sense.TRAN: 无限制的﹔无拘束的﹔自由自在的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unrestrained power
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无限制的权力

Sense.DEF: not limited by anyone or anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: unrestricted accessto information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随意获取信息

Sense.DEF: not achieving what you want to achieve
Sense.EXAMPLE: His efforts have not gone unrewarded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的努力没有白费。

Sense.DEF: unripe fruit, grain etc is not fully developed or ready to be eaten
better than any other
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unrivalled collection of Chinese art
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一批无与伦比的中国艺术收藏品

Sense.DEF: to open something that was in the shape of a ball or tube, and make it flat, or to become open in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He unrolled the carpet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他铺开地毯。

Sense.DEF: calm and not upset by a difficult situation – use this to show approval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emily remained completely unruffled by the chaos.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米莉面对这混乱的局面毫不慌张。

Sense.DEF: violent or difficult to control
Sense.TRAN: 粗暴的﹔难驾驭的﹐难管教的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unruly children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难管教的孩子
Sense.EXAMPLE: unruly behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗暴的行为

Sense.DEF: unruly hair is difficult to keep tidy
to remove the saddleleather seat from a horse
dangerous or likely to cause harm
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building is unsafe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那栋大楼不安全。
Sense.EXAMPLE: water that’s unsafe to drink
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不能安全饮用的水

Sense.DEF: likely to be harmed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people feel unsafe walking alone at night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人觉得一个人走夜路不安全。

Sense.DEF: an unsafe judgment in a court of law is based on facts that may be wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unsafe conviction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 证据不足的定罪

Sense.DEF: sex without using a condom
if something is left unsaid, you do not say it although you might be thinking it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some things are better left unsaidit is better not to mention them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些事不说出来更好。

Sense.DEF: dirty and likely to cause disease
Sense.EXAMPLE: unsanitary conditions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不卫生的环境

Sense.DEF: not good enough or not acceptable
Sense.TRAN: 不够好的﹐不能令人满意的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unsatisfactory situation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让人不满意的状况

Sense.DEF: an unsatisfied demand, request etc has not been dealt with
Sense.TRAN: 〔要求等〕未满足的﹐未得到处理的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unsatisfied demand for graduates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毕业生的供不应求

Sense.DEF: not pleased because you want something to be better
Sense.EXAMPLE: unsatisfied consumers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不满意的消费者

Sense.DEF: unsaturated fats or oils usually come from plants rather than animals and are better for your health
unpleasant or morally unacceptable
Sense.TRAN: 令人不快的﹔〔道德上〕令人厌恶的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The club has an unsavoury reputation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家俱乐部名声很臭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were a lot of unsavoury charactersunpleasant people around the station.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车站周围有许多不三不四的人。

Sense.DEF: not injured or harmed by something
Sense.TRAN: 没有受伤的﹐未遭受伤害的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He escaped unscathed from the accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他安然无恙地逃过了这场事故。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The government was relatively unscathed by the scandal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府基本上没有受到这桩丑闻的影响。

Sense.DEF: not planned or expected
Sense.TRAN: 未事先计划的﹔非计划中的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane made an unscheduled stop in New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机在纽约临时停留。

Sense.DEF: not based on facts or the usual scientific methods of doing something
Sense.TRAN: 不科学的﹐没有科学道理的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unscientific ideas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不科学的想法

Sense.DEF: to change a television signal or a message that has been sent in codea deliberately confusing way so that it can be seen or read
Sense.TRAN: 解读〔电视信号〕﹔译出〔密码〕

Sense.DEF: to make a confusing situation or confusing feelings easier to understand
Sense.TRAN: 整理﹐理清﹐理顺〔混乱的情形或情绪〕

Sense.DEF: to open something by twisting it
to take the screws out of something
an unscripted broadcast, speech etc is not written or planned before it is made
Sense.TRAN: 〔广播﹑演讲等〕不用稿子的﹔不事前准备的

Sense.DEF: behaving in an unfair or dishonest way
Sense.TRAN: 不择手段的﹐不讲道德的﹔无耻的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unscrupulous employers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无耻的雇主

Sense.DEF: used for saying that the weather is warmer, colder etc than usual at a particular time of year
Sense.TRAN: 〔天气〕反常地温暖/寒冷/炎热等

Sense.DEF: to remove someone from a powerful job or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to unseat the party leader
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罢免政党领导的企图

Sense.DEF: if a horse unseats someone, it throws them off its back
an unsecured debt or loan is one that does not make you promise to give the bank something you own if you cannot pay it back
Sense.TRAN: 〔债务或贷款〕无担保的﹐无抵押的

Sense.DEF: not chosen as a seedsomeone with a numbered rank in a competition, especially in a tennis competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指网球比赛中〕未被列为种子选手的

Sense.DEF: not noticing anything even though your eyes are open
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack gazed unseeing out of the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克茫然地望着窗外。

Sense.DEF: unseemly behaviour is not polite or not suitable for a particular occasion
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为〕不体面的﹐不合礼节的﹐不得体的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ann thought it unseemly to kiss her husband in public.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安认为当众亲她丈夫不太得体。

Sense.DEF: not noticed or seen
Sense.TRAN: 未受注意的﹔未被看见的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Raj crept out of the house unseen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉杰悄悄地溜出了房子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: unseen dangers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 潜在的危险

Sense.DEF: a piece of writing that you must translate into your own language in an examination
caring about other people and thinking about their needs and wishes before your own
Sense.TRAN: 不自私的﹐无私的﹐为他人着想的

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel slightly nervous, worried, or upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sudden changes unsettled Judy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突如其来的变化弄得朱迪心神不宁。

Sense.DEF: making people feel uncertain about what will happen
Sense.TRAN: 动荡不定的﹐不安定的﹐不稳定的
Sense.EXAMPLE: difficult and unsettled times
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艰难的动荡时期

Sense.DEF: slightly worried, upset, or nervous
Sense.TRAN: 心烦意乱的﹔惴惴不安的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children often feel unsettled if their parents divorce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母离婚﹐孩子常常会有紧张不安的感觉。

Sense.DEF: still continuing without reaching any agreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dispute remains unsettled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 争议仍然没有解决。

Sense.DEF: changing a lot in a short period of time
unsettled land has never had people living on it
an unsettled debt or bill has not been paid
feeling slightly sick
Sense.EXAMPLE: My stomach’s a bit unsettled after all that rich food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃了那么多油腻食物之后﹐我的胃有点不舒服。

Sense.DEF: making you feel nervous or worried
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unsettling experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人不安的经历

Sense.DEF: an unshakeable faith, belief etc is very strong and cannot be changed or destroyed
Sense.TRAN: 〔信仰﹑信念等〕不可动摇的﹐坚定不移的

Sense.DEF: not having changed your attitude or belief
Sense.TRAN: 〔态度或信念〕坚定的﹐未动摇的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He remained unshaken in his belief that she was wrong.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他依然坚持认为她错了。

Sense.DEF: a man who is unshaven has very short hairs growing on his face because he has not shaved
ugly or unpleasant to look at
Sense.TRAN: 不悦目的﹐难看的﹐不雅观的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unsightly buildings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难看的楼房
Sense.EXAMPLE: unsightly marks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难看的污渍

Sense.DEF: an unsigned letter or document has not been signed with someone’s name
Sense.TRAN: 〔信件或文件〕没有署名[签名]的

Sense.DEF: an unsigned sports player or musician has not yet signed a contract to play for a sports team or record music for a company
Sense.TRAN: 〔运动员或音乐人〕没有签约的

Sense.DEF: an unskilled worker has not been trained for a particular type of job
Sense.TRAN: 〔工人〕无特殊技能的﹐未受专门训练的
Sense.EXAMPLE: companies employing unskilled labourpeople who have no special training
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇用非熟练工的公司

Sense.DEF: unskilled work, jobs etc do not need people with special skills
looking serious and unfriendly
Sense.TRAN: 没有笑意的﹐不苟言笑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unsmiling face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有笑意的脸

Sense.DEF: not wanting to be with people or to go to social events
to work during the night or early in the morning when most people do not have to work
Sense.TRAN: 在非正常时间上班〔即夜班﹑早班等〕

Sense.DEF: not asked for and often not wanted
Sense.EXAMPLE: unsolicited calls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未获邀请的造访
Sense.EXAMPLE: unsolicited advice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主动提出的建议

Sense.DEF: a problem, mystery, or crime that is unsolved has never been solved
Sense.EXAMPLE: The murder still remains unsolved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谋杀案依然没有告破。

Sense.DEF: not having much knowledge or experience of modern and fashionable things
Sense.TRAN: 对现代[时髦]事物了解不多的﹔质朴的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unsophisticated audience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老土的观众

Sense.DEF: unsophisticated tools, methods, or processes are simple and do not have all the features of more modern ones
Sense.TRAN: 〔工具﹑方法﹑过程〕不复杂的﹐简单的

Sense.DEF: not based on facts or good reasons

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a test that’s scientifically unsound
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有科学依据的试验

Sense.DEF: an unsound building or structure is in bad condition
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物或结构〕不安全的﹐不稳固的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The houses are structurally unsound.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些房子结构不稳固。

Sense.DEF: physically or mentally ill
Sense.TRAN: 身体不健康的﹔有精神病的
Sense.EXAMPLE: people of unsound mindpeople who are mentally ill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神失常的人

Sense.DEF: used for emphasizing how bad someone or something is
Sense.TRAN: 坏得无法形容的﹐坏透了的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unspeakable tragedy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无法形容的悲剧

Sense.DEF: unspeakable feelings are so extreme that it is impossible to describe them
Sense.TRAN: 〔感觉〕难以形容的﹐难以言表的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unspeakable joy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难以形容的快乐

Sense.DEF: not known or not stated
Sense.TRAN: 未具体说明的﹔未详述的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting will take place at an unspecified date in the future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议将于日后召开﹐具体日期不确定。

Sense.DEF: an unspoiled place is beautiful because it has not changed for a long time and does not have a lot of new buildings
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方〕未遭破坏的﹐未丧失原有自然美的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unspoiled countryside
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未遭到破坏的乡村

Sense.DEF: someone who is unspoiled has not changed in spite of the good or bad things that have happened to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: She remained unspoilt by her success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她虽然事业有成﹐却依然保持本色。

Sense.DEF: an unspoken agreement, rule etc has not been discussed but is understood by everyone in a group
Sense.TRAN: 〔协议﹑规则等〕没有明说的﹐默契的﹐心照不宣的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unspoken assumption
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隐含的假设

Sense.DEF: not said for other people to hear
Sense.EXAMPLE: unspoken questions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未提出的问题

Sense.DEF: behaving in an unfair way, especially towards an opponent in a game or competition
Sense.TRAN: 不公平的﹐不光明正大的﹔〔尤指〕没有体育精神的

Sense.DEF: likely to change sud­denly and become worse
Sense.TRAN: 不稳定的﹐易变的﹐动荡不定的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The political situation is still very unstable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政局依然非常动荡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unstable relationship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不稳定的关系

Sense.DEF: something that is unstable is likely to move or fall
someone who is unstable changes very suddenly so that you do not know how they will react or behave
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mentally unstable man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名精神状态不稳定的男子

Sense.DEF: an unstable chemical is likely to separate into simpler substances
not expressed in words
Sense.EXAMPLE: unstated assumptions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未说明的假设

Sense.DEF: shaking or moving in a way you cannot control
Sense.EXAMPLE: He poured the coffee with a very unsteady hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用颤抖的手倒咖啡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a baby’s first unsteady steps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴儿最初迈出的蹒跚脚步
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was quite unsteady on her feet she might fall over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站得很不稳当。

Sense.DEF: showing that you are nervous
Sense.TRAN: 颤动的﹐发颤的〔表明情绪紧张〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her voice was unsteady.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她声音颤抖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She took a deep unsteady breath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她紧张地深吸了一口气。

Sense.DEF: an unsteady object is not balanced very well and could fall
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unsteady ladder
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不稳的梯子

Sense.DEF: an unsteady situation, relationship etc could change or end at any time
Sense.TRAN: 〔情形﹑关系等〕易变的﹐不稳定的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There has been an unsteady peace in the region.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区已实现了暂时的和平。

Sense.DEF: unstinting support, help, praise etc is complete and given willingly
Sense.TRAN: 〔支持﹑帮助﹑赞扬等〕慷慨的﹐大方的

Sense.DEF: unable to be stopped
Sense.TRAN: 制止不住的﹐阻止不了的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once Janet gets an idea, she’s unstoppable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮特一旦有了一个想法﹐谁也拦不住她。

Sense.DEF: an unstressed word or part of a word is pronounced with less force than other ones
not organized in a detailed way, and allowing people freedom to do what they want
Sense.EXAMPLE: unstructured interviews
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有条理的访谈

Subsense.DEF: if a person, plan, or system comes unstuck, they fail at what they were trying to achieve
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a dangerous area of rock where many climbers come unstuck
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多攀登者在此止步的危险岩石地带

Subsense.DEF: if something comes unstuck, it becomes separated from the thing that it was stuck to

Sense.DEF: to tell a company to remove your email address from the list of people who are regularly sent information
Sense.TRAN: 取消订阅〔电子邮件消息〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To unsubscribe from our mailing list, follow the instructions below.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如需退订本公司邮件﹐请按以下指示操作。

Sense.DEF: not proved to be true
Sense.TRAN: 未被证明的﹐未经证实的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unsubstantiated allegations of child abuse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未经证实的虐待儿童的指控

Sense.DEF: not having a successful result or not achieving what you wanted to achieve
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unsuccessful attempt to climb Qomolangma
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 攀登珠穆朗玛峰的失败尝试

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have been unsuccessful in finding a new manager.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没能找到一位新的经理。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He tried unsuccessfully to make them change their decision.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图让他们改变决定﹐但是没能成功。

Sense.DEF: not having the right qualities for a particular person, purpose, or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: unsuitable housing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不合适的住房

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book is unsuitable for children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书不适合儿童阅读。

Sense.DEF: not having the right qualities for a particular job or purpose
Sense.TRAN: 不合格的﹔不胜任的﹔不合适的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was unsuited for the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不适合干这份工作。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: old school buildings unsuited to modern education
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不适合现代教育的旧校舍

Sense.DEF: two people who are unsuited are unlikely to have a successful romantic relationship because they have very different characters and interests
Sense.TRAN: 〔异性之间因性格不合﹑兴趣各异而〕不适合的﹐不般配的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I now realize that Tom and I were totally unsuited.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在认识到我和汤姆完全不适合。

Sense.DEF: not spoiled by anything
not praised or famous for something you have done, although you deserve to be
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the unsung heroes of French politics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国政坛的一位无名英雄

Sense.DEF: not certain about something or about what you have to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was unsure of the reaction I would get.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不清楚将会得到何种反应。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you are unsure about anything, just ask.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你有什么地方不明白﹐尽管问。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Peter was unsure what to do next.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得不清楚接下来该怎么办。

Sense.DEF: not having enough confidence
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris seemed nervous and unsure of herself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克丽丝显得紧张﹐没有自信。

Sense.DEF: better or greater than anyone or anything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unsurpassed knowledge of Greek history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对希腊历史的无比了解

Sense.DEF: not making you feel surprised
Sense.TRAN: 不令人惊讶的﹐不足为奇的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s unsurprising that the project failed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目失败了没什么好奇怪的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an enjoyable but unsurprising album
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张好听但无惊喜的专辑

Sense.DEF: not knowing that something bad is happening or going to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: unsuspecting victims
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无提防之心的受害人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fake designer clothes are being sold to an unsuspecting public.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有冒牌的设计师服装正在向毫不知情的大众出售。

Sense.DEF: unable to continue at the same rate or in the same way
Sense.TRAN: 不能继续的﹐无法维持的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unsus­tainable economic growth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难以持续的经济增长

Sense.DEF: unsweetened food or drink has not had sugar added to it
an unswerving belief or attitude is one that is very strong and never changes

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a politician with unswerving loyalty to the President
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对总统忠心耿耿的一名政治家

Sense.DEF: not kind or helpful to someone who is having problems
Sense.TRAN: 无同情心的﹐冷漠的﹐不同情的

Sense.DEF: not willing to support an idea, aim etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a government that’s unsympathetic to public opinion
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不体恤民意的政府

Sense.DEF: an unsympathetic person in a book or play is unpleasant and difficult to like
Sense.TRAN: 〔书或戏剧里的角色〕不惹人喜欢的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unsympathetic character
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不讨人喜欢的人物

Sense.DEF: not affected or influenced by something bad
Sense.TRAN: 不受影响的﹔没有污点的﹐清白无瑕的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a politician untainted by corruption
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 清廉的政治家

Sense.DEF: untamed land is still in its natural state and has not been developed by people
an untamed animal has not been trained to live or work with people
to separate pieces of string, wire etc that are twisted together
to make something less complicated
Sense.EXAMPLE: The research attempts to untangle some of these issues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项研究试图理清其中的一些问题。

Sense.DEF: an untapped supply, market, or talent is available but has not yet been used
Sense.TRAN: 〔资源﹑市场或天赋〕未开发的﹐未利用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Older people are an untapped resource in the employment market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年龄较大的人是就业市场中有待利用的资源。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We believe there is untapped potential.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们相信还有潜力没有挖掘出来。

Sense.DEF: an untenable situation has become so difficult that it is impossible to continue
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scandal put the President in an untenable position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这桩丑闻使总统处境艰难。

Sense.DEF: an untenable argument, suggestion etc is impossible to defend
Sense.TRAN: 〔论点等〕站不住脚的﹐不堪一击的

Sense.DEF: untested ideas, methods, or people have not been used in a particular situation so you do not know what they are like
Sense.TRAN: 〔观点或方法〕未经验证的﹔[人]未经考验的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an argument based on untested assumptions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建立在未经验证的假设上的论点

Sense.DEF: an untested drug, medical treatment etc has not been given any scientific tests to discover if it is safe to use
Sense.TRAN: 〔药物﹑治疗方法等〕未经试验的

Sense.DEF: impossible to accept or imagine
Sense.TRAN: 不能接受的﹔难以置信的﹔难以想象的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is unthinkable that a mistake like this could have happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 竟然发生了这样的错误﹐真是令人难以置信。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it would be unthinkable for sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would be unthinkable for me to stay anywhere but with the family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我来说不和家人在一起是难以想象的。

Sense.DEF: something that is impossible to accept or imagine
Sense.EXAMPLE: Then the unthinkable happened and the boat started to sink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接着﹐意想不到的事情发生了﹐船开始下沉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was the job of the committee to think the unthinkableplan for unexpected events or situations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会的工作就是要想到意想不到的情况。

Sense.DEF: not thinking about the effects of something you say or do
not neat
Sense.EXAMPLE: an untidy desk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乱七八糟的书桌
Sense.EXAMPLE: untidy hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凌乱的头发
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her clothes were in an untidy heap on the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的衣服胡乱堆在地板上。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In American English and in everyday British English, people usually say messy rather than untidy.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在美国英语和日常英国英语中﹐人们一般说 messy﹐而不说 untidy
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: His room is always so messy.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的房间总是乱糟糟的。

Sense.DEF: someone who is untidy does not keep their house, possessions etc neat
to take the knots out of something, or unfasten something that has been tied
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peter untied his shoelaces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得解开鞋带。

Sense.DEF: if something happens until a particular time, it continues and then stops at that time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ticket is valid until March.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张票的有效期一直到 3 月份。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He waited until she had finished speaking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直等到她讲完。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Until recently, Anna worked as a teacher in Japan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直到最近﹐安娜一直在日本当老师。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Up until last year, they didn’t even own a car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一直到去年﹐他们连汽车也没有。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something does not happen before a certain point in time or before something else has happened
Sense.TRAN: 直到〔用于强调某事在某个具体的时刻或者另一件事发生以前没有发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I go out and play now?’ ‘Not until you’ve done your homework.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我现在可以出去玩吗？” “家庭作业做完以后才行。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was not until 1972 that the war finally came to an end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直到 1972 年战争才终于结束。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: In a clause beginning with until that refers to the future, use the present tense or present perfect, not ‘will’.
F2NBox.TRAN: 以 until 引导的从句如指将来﹐要用现在时或现在完成时﹐而不用 will
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I will not buy the tickets until I hear from you.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得到你的消息后才会去买票。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Add the sugar and stir until it has dissolved.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 加入糖﹐搅拌至溶解 。
F2NBox.HEADING: until now, so far
F2NBox.EXPL: Until now is usually used to say that a situation has just ended or changed.
F2NBox.TRAN: until now 通常表示某个情况刚刚结束或发生变化
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Until now I had no one to tell things to I now have someone to tell things to.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 直到现在我才有人可以诉说。
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use until now when the situation has not changed. Use so far.
F2NBox.TRAN: 如情况并未发生变化﹐不要用 until now﹐而要用 so far
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: So far no one has claimed responsibility for the bombs.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前尚无人宣称对这几起爆炸负责。

Sense.DEF: happening too soon or sooner than you expected
Sense.EXAMPLE: the untimely death of a popular local man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名当地红人的过早死亡
Sense.EXAMPLE: The announcement brought the meeting to an untimely end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事的公布使会议早早地就结束了。

Sense.DEF: not suitable for a particular occasion or time
Sense.EXAMPLE: an untimely interruption
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不是时候的打扰

Sense.DEF: working very hard for a long period of time in order to do something – used to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 不倦的﹔坚持不懈的〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: untiring efforts to help the homeless
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮助无家可归者的不懈努力

Sense.DEF: an untitled song, painting etc has not been given a title
Sense.TRAN: 〔歌曲﹑绘画作品等〕无题的﹐没起名字的

Sense.DEF: to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks be unto God.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感谢上帝。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how bad something is
Sense.TRAN: 难以形容的﹔不可计量的〔强调情况糟糕〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rumours will do untold damage to his reputation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些谣言会给他的名声造成无法估计的损害。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The floods have caused untold misery to hundreds of homeowners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洪水给数以百计的房主带来了不可估量的痛苦。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that an amount or quantity is very large

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a game that offers untold wealth to the most talented players
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为最有天赋的运动员带来巨大财富的比赛

Sense.DEF: someone who is untouchable is in such a strong position that they cannot be defeated, affected, or punished
Sense.TRAN: 〔人因地位稳固而〕碰不得的﹐不受影响的﹐不能被击败的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the boss’s husband and therefore untouchable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是老板的丈夫﹐因而碰不得。

Sense.DEF: belonging to the lowest social group, especially in the Hindu caste system
Sense.TRAN: 不可接触者的﹔社会最底层的〔尤指印度种姓制度中〕贱民的

Sense.DEF: not changed, damaged, or affected in any way
Sense.TRAN: 没有变化的﹔未受损害的﹔未受任何影响的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an island that has been untouched by time
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有随时间流逝而改变的一个岛

Sense.DEF: not touched, moved, or eaten
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several papers lay untouched on the desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几份文件原封不动地放在书桌上。

Sense.DEF: unexpected, unusual, or not wanted
Sense.TRAN: 意外的﹔异常的﹔事与愿违的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I walked past but didn’t notice anything untoward.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从旁边走过﹐但没有注意到任何异常情况。

Sense.DEF: not trained to do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔做某事〕未经过训练的﹐未经培训的
Sense.EXAMPLE: untrained staff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未经培训的员工

Sense.DEF: when someone who does not have special knowledge of a subject looks at something or listens to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: To the untrained eye, the two flowers look remarkably similar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在不懂的人看来﹐这两种花看上去非常相似。

Sense.DEF: not limited by anyone or anything
Sense.TRAN: 不受限制的﹐不受妨碍的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an organization untrammelled by legal restraints
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不受法律限制的机构

Sense.DEF: an untreated illness or injury has not had medical treatment
harmful substances that are untreated have not been made safe
Sense.EXAMPLE: untreated sewage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未经处理过的污水

Sense.DEF: untreated wood has not had any substances put on it to preserve it
not having any experience of doing a particular job
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young and untried minister
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻﹑没有经验的部长

Sense.DEF: something that is untried has not been tested to see whether it is successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: untried and untested ways to make money
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未尝试过的赚钱方法

Sense.DEF: not based on facts that are correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: allegations that are totally untrue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完全不能成立的指控
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s untrue to say that the situation has not changed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说情况没有改变﹐这是没有根据的。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say something is not true rather than untrue.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说某事 not true﹐而不说 untrue
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It’s not true to say nothing has changed.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 说毫无变化是不对的。

Sense.DEF: someone who is untrue to their husband, wife etc is not faithful to them
someone who is untrustworthy cannot be trusted
Sense.TRAN: 不能信赖的﹐不值得信任的

Sense.DEF: a lie – used when you want to avoid saying the word ‘lie’
dishonest or not true
not having been taught to do something
Sense.TRAN: 未受过训练的﹐未经正规教育的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To the untutored ear, this music sounds as if it might have been written by Beethoven.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在外行人听来﹐这曲子似乎是贝多芬写的。

Sense.DEF: not having the usual features or qualities that you would expect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a building that is quite untypical of the period in which it was built
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有其建造时期特征的一幢建筑

Sense.EXAMPLE: These problems are not untypicalthey are normal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题没什么不寻常。

Sense.DEF: something that is unusable is in such a bad condition that you cannot use it
not being used, or never used
Sense.TRAN: 不在使用的﹔从未用过的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unused land
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闲置的土地

Sense.DEF: not experienced in dealing with something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sensitive man unused to publicity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不习惯抛头露面的敏感的男人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maggie was unused to being told what to do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛吉不习惯有人对她指手画脚。

Sense.DEF: different from what is usual or normal
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unusual feature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不寻常的特点
Sense.EXAMPLE: unusual circumstances
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 异常状况
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s unusual for Dave to be late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫迟到是很少见的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not unusualit is quite common to feel very angry in a situation like this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遇到这样的情况觉得非常生气是很正常的。

Exponent.DEF: different from what usually happens
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We had snow in May, which is very unusual.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 5月份我们这里下了雪﹐这是非常少见的。

Exponent.DEF: not happening very often, or existing only in small numbers
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Violent crimes are rare.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力犯罪并不常见。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Hatton gathered many rare plants from all over the world.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈顿从世界各地收集了许多奇花异草。

Exponent.DEF: very unusual and happening very rarely
Exponent.EXAMPLE: 90-day visas can be extended only in exceptional circumstances.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 90天的签证只有在特殊情况下才可延期。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The presence of a jury in a civil trial is now quite exceptional.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在陪审团在民事审判中很少出现。

Exponent.DEF: unusual and surprising or special
Exponent.TRAN: 不寻常的﹔出人意料的﹔特别的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a small village where nothing out of the ordinary ever seemed to happen.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样一个小村庄﹐似乎从不会发生什么不寻常的事。

Exponent.DEF: extremely unusual and unexpected - used about an accident, storm etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔事故﹑暴风雨等〕怪异的﹐出乎意料的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A freak wave wrecked most of the seafront.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵反常的海浪损毁了大部分滨海区。

Exponent.DEF: if something is unprecedented, it has never happened before - often used about success and achievements
Exponent.TRAN: 〔常指成功和成就〕空前的﹐前所未有的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: An unprecedented number of students have received top grades.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 获得最高分的学生数量前所未有。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This kind of deal is unprecedented.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一类交易并没有先例。

Exponent.DEF: if something is unheard of, it has never happened or been done before - used especially when something seems very surprising to people at that time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In our small town, this kind of crime was almost unheard of.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我们这个小镇上﹐这种犯罪几乎闻所未闻。

Section.SECHEADING: PEOPLE/BEHAVIOUR/METHODS ETC 人/行为/方法等

Exponent.DEF: behaving in a way that seems rather strange but not frightening
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The house was owned by an eccentric millionaire.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢房子的主人是个古怪的百万富翁。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: eccentric behavior
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 古怪的行为

Exponent.DEF: very different from the way people usually behave, think, dress etc, often in a way that seems interesting
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His parents had a rather unconventional lifestyle, and let their children do whatever they pleased.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的父母生活方式别具一格﹐而且让孩子随心所欲。

Exponent.DEF: unorthodox ideas or methods are different from the usual ones, and therefore seem surprising to many people
Exponent.TRAN: 〔观念或方法〕非传统的﹐非正统的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He is known for his unorthodox political views.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以非传统的政治观点闻名。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: unorthodox teaching method
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 非正统的教学法

Sense.DEF: higher, larger etc than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: unusually high levels of pollution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 异常严重的污染程度

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not what usually happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unusually for me, I fell asleep very quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我难得很快就睡着了。

Sense.DEF: an unutterable feeling is too extreme to be expressed in words
Sense.TRAN: 〔感受过于强烈〕无法言表的﹐难以言喻的

Sense.DEF: simple and without any additional descriptions or details
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unvarnished account of events
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对事件原原本本的叙述

Sense.DEF: not covered with varnisha transparent substance like paint, used to protect the surface of wood
to show or tell people about a new product or plan for the first time
Sense.TRAN: 〔首次〕透露〔新计划〕﹐展示〔新产品〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The club has unveiled plans to build a new stadium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 俱乐部首次披露了要建造一座新体育馆的计划。

Sense.DEF: to remove the cover from something, especially as part of a formal ceremony
Sense.TRAN: 为…揭幕﹔揭去…上的覆盖物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The statue was unveiled by the Queen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这尊雕塑由女王揭幕。

Sense.DEF: not expressed in words
Sense.TRAN: 未用语言表达的﹐没说出来的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unvoiced fears
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未说出来的恐惧

Sense.DEF: unvoiced consonants are produced without moving your vocal cords. /d/ and /ɡ/are voiced consonants, and /t/ and /k/ are unvoiced.
not having a job that you get paid for
Sense.TRAN: 没有工资收入的﹐无工作报酬的

Sense.DEF: not wanted or needed
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unwanted pregnancy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非意愿怀孕

Sense.DEF: done without good reason, and therefore annoying
Sense.EXAMPLE: unwarranted interference
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无理干涉

Sense.DEF: not knowing about possible problems or dangers, and therefore easily harmed or deceived
Sense.EXAMPLE: unwary travellers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无戒备的旅行者

Sense.DEF: people who are unwary
Sense.TRAN: 不警觉的人﹐粗心大意的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: pitfalls that can trap the unwary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗心大意者易上当的圈套

Sense.DEF: dirty and needing to be washed
Sense.EXAMPLE: unwashed cups
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 待洗的杯子

Sense.DEF: people who are poor and have not been educated
an unwavering attitude, belief, expression etc does not change
Sense.TRAN: 〔态度﹑信仰﹑表情等〕坚定的﹐毫不动摇的﹐始终如一的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unwavering stare
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目不转睛的注视
Sense.EXAMPLE: unwavering support
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坚定不移的支持

Sense.DEF: something that is unwelcome is not wanted, especially because it might cause embarrassment or problems
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因可能引起尴尬或问题而〕不希望要的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unwelcome publicity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不必要的宣传
Sense.EXAMPLE: unwelcome news
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不希望听到的消息

Sense.DEF: unwelcome guests, visitors etc are people who you do not want in your home
ill, especially for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指短时间〕不舒服的﹐有病的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had been feeling unwell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得不舒服。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that someone is not well rather than unwell.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 not well﹐而不说 unwell
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He didn’t come to school because he wasn’t well.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不舒服﹐所以没来上学。

Sense.DEF: an unwieldy object is big, heavy, and difficult to carry or use
Sense.TRAN: 〔物体〕庞大而笨重的﹐不灵便的

Sense.DEF: an unwieldy system, argument, or organization is difficult to control or manage because it is too complicated
Sense.TRAN: 〔因太复杂而〕难操纵的﹐难控制的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unwieldy bureaucracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尾大不掉的官僚机构

Sense.DEF: not wanting to do something and refusing to do it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was unwilling or unable to pay the fine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是不愿意付这罚款﹐不然就是付不起。

Sense.DEF: not wanting to do something but doing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unwilling helper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 勉强来帮忙的人

Sense.DEF: to relax and stop feeling anxious
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beautiful country hotel that is the perfect place to unwind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优美的乡村酒店﹐放松身心的绝佳场所

Sense.DEF: to undo something that has been wrapped around something else, or to become undone after being wrapped around something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She started to unwind her scarf.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始解下围巾。

Sense.DEF: not based on good judgment
Sense.TRAN: 不明智的﹐愚蠢的﹐轻率的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s unwise to keep medicines in a place that can be reached by children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把药品放在儿童可及之处是不明智的。

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows you do not know or realize something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Friedmann had unwittingly broken the law.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗里德曼无意中触犯了法律。

Sense.DEF: unusual and not what you expect to happen
Sense.TRAN: 不寻常的﹐异常的﹔没想到的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unwonted freedom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难得的自由

Sense.DEF: an unworkable plan, system, law etc is not likely to be successful
Sense.TRAN: 〔计划﹑制度﹑法律等〕不可行的﹐行不通的

Sense.DEF: not interested in money or possessions
Sense.TRAN: 对钱财不感兴趣的﹔脱俗的

Sense.DEF: not having a lot of experience of life
unusual and having qualities that do not seem to belong to this world
Sense.TRAN: 非尘世的﹐非现世的﹐超凡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unworldly beauty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超凡的美

Sense.DEF: not deserving respect, attention etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an idea that’s unworthy of serious consideration
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不值得认真考虑的想法

Sense.DEF: unworthy behaviour, attitudes etc are not acceptable from someone who is respected or who has an important job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a suggestion that’s unworthy of someone who hopes to become President
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和一个希望成为总统的人身份不相称的建议

Sense.DEF: the past tense and past participle of unwind
Sense.TRAN: unwind 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: to remove the paper, plastic etc that is around something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brigitte was unwrapping her birthday presents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布丽吉特正在拆她的生日礼物。

Sense.DEF: an unwritten rule, law, agreement etc is one that everyone knows about although it is not official
Sense.TRAN: 〔规则﹑法律﹑协议等〕非书面的﹐不成文的
Sense.EXAMPLE: unwritten rules of social behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不成文的社会行为规范

Sense.DEF: not willing to change your ideas or beliefs
Sense.EXAMPLE: an unyielding resistance to change
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 固执己见﹐不愿改变

Sense.DEF: very hard and not changing in shape or form
Sense.EXAMPLE: a harsh unyielding landscape
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 景色粗犷﹑线条硬朗的地貌

Sense.DEF: to unfasten the zip on a bag, piece of clothing etc
to make a computer file its normal size again so that you can use it, after it has been made to use less space
towards a higher place or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: We walked slowly up the hill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们慢慢地爬上山。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She picked her jacket up off the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从地板上捡起外套。
Sense.EXAMPLE: paths leading up into the mountains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通往山里的小径
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tim had climbed up a tree to get a better view.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆爬到了树上﹐以便看得更清楚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put up your hand if you know the answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果知道答案就举手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The water was getting up my nose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水已经没到了我的鼻子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Karen lay on her back, staring up at the ceiling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡伦仰卧着﹐盯着天花板。

Sense.DEF: in a higher place or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: John’s up in his bedroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰在楼上他的卧室里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a plane flying 30,000 feet up
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在三万英尺高空飞行的飞机
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her office is just up those stairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的办公室就在那段楼梯上面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor’s assistant was up a ladder in the stockroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生的助手正在储藏室的梯子上。

Sense.DEF: into an upright or raised position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone stood up for the national anthem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全体起立﹐奏国歌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mick turned his collar up against the biting winds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米克竖起衣领抵挡刺骨的寒风。

Sense.DEF: in or to a place that is further along something such as a road or path
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lives just up the street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就住在这条街的前面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We walked up the road towards the church.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们沿着那条路向教堂走去。

Sense.DEF: in or towards the north
Sense.EXAMPLE: They live up north.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在北部。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re driving up to Chicago for the conference.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正驾车北上芝加哥参加会议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stormy voyage up the east coast from Miami to Boston
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿东海岸从迈阿密到波士顿的一段颠簸的航程

Sense.DEF: very close to someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A man came up and offered to buy him a drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名男子走上前来说要请他喝一杯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She drove right up to the front door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把车一直开到前门口。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bed was up against the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 床紧靠着墙。

Sense.DEF: used to show that the place someone goes to is more important than the place they start from
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you been up to London recently?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最近去过伦敦吗？

Sense.DEF: towards the place where a river starts
Sense.EXAMPLE: sailing up the Thames
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 溯泰晤士河而上
Sense.EXAMPLE: The river steamers only went up as far as Mandalay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内河汽船最远只开到上游的曼德勒。

Sense.DEF: at or towards a higher level or a greater amount
Sense.TRAN: 在﹐向〔更高水平或更多数量〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn up the radio.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把收音机音量调高。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Violent crime went up by 9% last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年暴力犯罪率增加了9%。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inflation is up by 2%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀率上升了 2%。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Profits are up on last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润比去年增加了。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often prefer to use rise rather than be/go up, because it sounds more formal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐人们通常说 rise﹐因其听起来更正式﹐而不说 be/go up
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Violent crime rose by 9% last year.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年暴力犯罪率上升了9%。

Sense.DEF: beating your opponent by a certain number of points

GramExa.PROPFORM: two goals up/three points up etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: United were a goal up at half time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 半场时联队领先一球。

Sense.DEF: not in bed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are the kids still up?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们还没睡吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: They stayed up all night to watch the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们整晚没睡看比赛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s time to get upget out of bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该起床了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s good to see you up and about again out of bed after an illness and moving around normally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到你又能起床活动真是太好了。

Sense.DEF: used after certain verbs to show that something is completely finished, used, or removed
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于某些动词后表示彻底完结﹑用完或除去〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve used up all our savings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把积蓄都花光了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children had to eat up all their food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们得把饭菜全部吃完。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After a month, the wound had almost healed up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个月后﹐伤口差不多愈合了。

Sense.DEF: used after certain verbs to show that something is cut, broken etc into pieces or divided into parts
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于某些动词之后表示成为碎片或分成几部分〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why did you tear up that letter?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么把那封信撕掉？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We still haven’t decided how to divide up the money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还是没有决定怎么分这笔钱。

Sense.DEF: used after certain verbs to show that things are collected together
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于某些动词之后表示合在一起〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s just add up these figures quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们快把这些数字加起来吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you collect up the papers?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把试卷收一下好吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say which surface or part of an object should be on top
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put the playing cards right side up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把纸牌正面朝上放。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Isn’t that painting the wrong way up?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幅画是不是放颠倒了？

Sense.DEF: above and including a certain level, age, or amount
Sense.TRAN: 在…及以上〔指水平﹑年龄或数量〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the women were naked from the waist up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的女人都赤裸着上身。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children aged 12 and up must pay the full fare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 12岁及以上儿童需购买全票。

Subsense.DEF: backwards and forwards
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Ralph paced up and down the room, looking worried.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉尔夫在屋里踱来踱去﹐显得焦虑不安。

Subsense.DEF: if someone is up and down, they sometimes feel well or happy and sometimes do not
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Jason’s been very up and down since his girlfriend left him.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从女朋友离他而去后﹐贾森的情绪一直波动很大。

Subsense.DEF: to a higher position and then a lower position, several times
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They were all jumping up and down and screaming excitedly.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们都又蹦又跳﹐兴奋地尖叫着。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Shivers ran up and down my body.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我浑身哆嗦。

GramExa.GLOSS: look at someone in order to judge their appearance or character
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maisie looked her rival up and down with a critical eye.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅茜用挑剔的目光打量对手。

Subsense.DEF: as much or as many as a certain amount or number but not more
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The Olympic Stadium will hold up to 80,000 spectators.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥林匹克体育场将可容纳多达八万名观众。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a process that can take anything up to ten days
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能需要长达十天的一个过程

Subsense.DEF: for the whole of a period until a certain time or date
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She continued to care for her father up to the time of his death.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直照顾父亲直到他去世。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’ve kept our meetings secret up to now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直到现在我们的会议都是保密的。

Subsense.DEF: clever, good, or well enough to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 胜任﹔有资格做﹔适于〔做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid Tim just isn’t up to the job he does not have the necessary ability.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆怕是干不了这份工作。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You don’t need to go back to school if you don’t feel up to it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你觉得身体还不是很好的话﹐就不一定要回去上学。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s not really up to seeing any visitors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的身体状况不太适合见客。

Subsense.DEF: if something is up to a particular standard, it is good enough to reach that standard
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t think last night’s performance was up to her usual standard.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得她昨晚的演出没有达到她的正常水平。

Subsense.DEF: doing something secret or something that you should not be doing
Subsense.TRAN: 正在做〔秘密或不该做的事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The children are very quiet. I wonder what they’re up to.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们很安静﹐我不知道他们在搞什么鬼。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He knew Bailey was up to something. But what?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道贝利在偷偷地干着什么﹐可又是什么呢？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I always suspected that he was up to no gooddoing something bad.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直怀疑他在干什么不好的勾当。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone can decide about something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You can pay weekly or monthly – it’s up to you.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以每周或者每月付一次款﹐你自己决定。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone is responsible for a particular duty
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s up to the travel companies to warn customers of any possible dangers.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游公司有义务预先告知顾客任何可能的危险。

Sense.DEF: if a period of time is up, it is finished
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, we’ll have to stop there. Our time is up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抱歉﹐我们必须停下了﹐时间到了。

Sense.DEF: if a road is up, its surface is being repaired
if a computer system is up, it is working
Sense.EXAMPLE: There could well be a few problems before your new computer is up and running properly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新电脑正常运行之前出现一些问题是完全有可能的。

Sense.DEF: having to deal with a difficult situation or opponent
Sense.EXAMPLE: He came up against a lot of problems with his boss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和老板之间有很多问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Murphy will be really up against it when he faces the champion this afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墨菲今天下午和冠军交锋﹐可有一场硬仗要打了。

Subsense.DEF: available for a particular process
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The house is up for sale.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此房出售。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: This week 14 of Campbell’s paintings were put up for auction.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本周有14 幅坎贝尔的画被拍卖。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Even the most taboo subjects were up for discussion.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 连最忌讳的话题也拿出来讨论了。

Subsense.DEF: being considered for election or for a job
Subsense.TRAN: 被考虑﹐被提名〔当候选人﹐做某一工作等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Senator Frank Church was coming up for re-election that year.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一年参议员弗兰克·丘奇被提名竞选连任。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She is one of five candidates up for the chief executive’s job.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是总经理职位的五位候选人之一。

Subsense.DEF: appearing in a court of law because you have been accused of a crime
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Ron’s up for drinking and driving next week.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗恩因酒后驾车将于下周出庭受审。

Subsense.DEF: willing to do something or interested in doing something
Subsense.TRAN: 愿意做某事﹔对某事感兴趣
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to the pub later – are you up for it?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们等一会儿要去酒吧﹐你愿意来吗？

Sense.DEF: if something is up, someone is feeling unhappy because they have problems, or there is something wrong in a situation
Sense.TRAN: 发生了某事﹐出了什么事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could tell by the look on his face that something was up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看他的脸色我就知道出事了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is something up with Julie? She looks really miserable.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉怎么了？她看上去愁眉苦脸的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s up? Why are you crying?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么了？你怎么在哭？

Sense.DEF: to know a lot about something
Sense.TRAN: 非常熟悉某事﹔精通某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not all that well up in musical matters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐方面我不太懂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Conrad’s really up on his geography, isn’t he?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 康拉德地理学得非常好﹐是吗？

Sense.DEF: to appear in a court of law because you have been accused of a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was up before the magistrates’ court charged with dangerous driving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以危险驾驶罪被起诉﹐在地方治安法庭受审。

Variant.LEXVAR: have had it up to here

Sense.DEF: to be very upset and angry because of a particular situation or person

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m up to here with this job; I’m resigning!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份工作我受够了﹐我要辞职！

Sense.LEXUNIT: up the workers!/up the reds! etc
Sense.DEF: used to express support and encouragement for a particular group of people or for a sports team
Sense.TRAN: 工人们加油！/红队加油！等

Sense.DEF: used as a very rude and offensive reply to someone who has said something that annoys you
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You’re not allowed to park here.’ ‘Up yours, mate!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你不能在这里停车。” “去你的﹐伙计！”

Sense.DEF: if you say that someone is up himself or up herself, you mean that they pay too much attention to themselves and what they do or what they look like – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 某人只有他自己/她自己等﹔某人很自我〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: the mixture of good and bad experiences that happen in any situation or relationship
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have our ups and downs like all couples.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的关系也有起落﹐跟所有的夫妻一样。

Sense.DEF: to be improving or increasing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Business confidence is on the up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商业信心正在提高。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be on the up and up

Subsense.DEF: to be becoming more successful
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a brilliant young player who is on the up and up
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事业蒸蒸日上的一名杰出的年轻球员

Subsense.DEF: if a person or business is on the up and up, they are honest and do things legally

Sense.DEF: to increase the amount or level of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve upped their offer by 5%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把出价提高了 5%。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly do something differ­ent or surprising
Sense.EXAMPLE: Without saying another word, he upped and left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他二话不说﹐突然就走了。

Sense.DEF: making something higher
Sense.EXAMPLE: to upgrade a job make it higher in importance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提高一个工作的重要性

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 尤用于构成副词和形容词
Sense.DEF: at or towards the top or beginning of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: uphill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上坡的﹔往上坡
Sense.EXAMPLE: upriver nearer to where the river starts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在上游﹔向上游

Sense.DEF: taking something from its place or turning it upside down
Sense.TRAN: 使起来〔离开原位〕﹔使颠倒
Sense.EXAMPLE: an uprooted tree
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被连根拔起的树
Sense.EXAMPLE: She upended the bucket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把水桶倒过来。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 尤用于构成形容词和副词
Sense.DEF: at or towards the higher or better part of something
Sense.TRAN: 在[向]更高之处(的)﹔在[向]更好之处(的)
Sense.EXAMPLE: upmarket attracting richer people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高端市场的

Sense.DEF: likely to become successful or popular
Sense.EXAMPLE: up-and-coming young artists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有前途的年轻艺术家

Sense.DEF: positive and making you feel that good things will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: an upbeat message
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐观的信息

Sense.DEF: to tell someone angrily that they have done something wrong
the way that your parents care for you and teach you to behave when you are growing up
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mike had had a strict upbringing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克从小家教很严。

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= Universal Product Code 通用产品代码﹐通用商品条码

Sense.DEF: to bring food or drink up from your stomach and out through your mouth because you are ill or drunk
happening soon
Sense.TRAN: 即将来临的﹐即将发生的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the upcoming elections
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即将举行的选举

Sense.DEF: from a place without many people or towns, especially in the middle of a country
Sense.TRAN: 来自内地的〔尤指地处国家中部﹑人口或城镇不多的地区〕

Sense.DEF: to add the most recent information to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The files need updating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些档案需要更新。

Sense.DEF: to make something more modern in the way it looks or operates
Sense.EXAMPLE: plans to update manufacturing procedures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 更新生产流程的计划

Sense.DEF: to tell someone the most recent information about a situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you update me on what’s happened?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能不能告诉我最新情况？

Sense.DEF: the most recent news or information about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a news update
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最新新闻报道

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report provides a brief update on the progress of the project.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告对项目的最新进展作了简要汇报。

Sense.DEF: a change or addition to a computer file so that it has the most recent information
to turn something over so that it is upside down
behaving or talking in an honest way so that people know what you really think
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mo’s very upfront with him about their relationship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫在他们的关系上对他很坦诚。

Sense.DEF: paid before any work has been done or before goods are supplied
Sense.EXAMPLE: an upfront fee of $500
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 500美元的预付款

Sense.DEF: if you pay money upfront, you pay it before any work has been done or before any goods are supplied
Sense.EXAMPLE: He requires you to pay him upfront.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要求你预先付款给他。

Sense.DEF: in football, if you play upfront, you play in a forward position
to make a computer, machine, or piece of software better and able to do more things
Sense.TRAN: 使〔计算机﹑机器﹑软件〕升级

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’ll need to upgrade your hard drive to 120Mb before running this software.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 运行这个软件之前你需要把硬盘升级到 120 兆。

Sense.DEF: to improve something and make it more modern, especially in order to provide a better service
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel has recently been refurbished and upgraded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店最近重新装修过﹐设施更加完善了。

Sense.DEF: to give someone a better seat on a plane or a better room in a hotel than the one they paid for
Sense.TRAN: 给〔飞机乘客或宾馆客人〕升级

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can upgrade you to business class.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以为您升级到商务舱。

Sense.DEF: to give someone a more important job
to change the official description of something to make it seem better or more important
Sense.TRAN: 使升格﹐提高〔某事物的〕地位

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Four of the regions were upgraded to the status of republic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中四个地区升格为共和国。

Sense.DEF: to learn new and more modern ways of doing a particular job
a very big change that often causes problems
Sense.TRAN: 〔往往会带来问题的〕激变﹐剧变﹔动乱
Sense.EXAMPLE: political upheaval
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治剧变
Sense.EXAMPLE: Moving house is a major upheaval.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 搬家很折腾。

Sense.DEF: towards the top of a hill
Sense.EXAMPLE: an uphill climb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 向山上爬

Sense.DEF: something that is very difficult to do and needs a lot of effort and determination
Sense.TRAN: 艰难的斗争/战斗/任务等

Sense.DEF: towards the top of a hill
Sense.EXAMPLE: The road twists uphill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条路弯弯曲曲通向山上。

Sense.DEF: to defend or support a law, system, or principle so that it continues to exist
Sense.TRAN: 支持﹐维护〔法规﹑制度或原则〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a committee that aims to uphold educational standards
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在保持教育水准的委员会

Sense.DEF: if a court upholds a decision made by another court, it states that the decision was correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: The conviction was upheld by the Court of Appeal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上诉法庭维持原判。

Sense.DEF: to cover a chair with material
someone whose job is to cover chairs with material
Sense.TRAN: 〔给座椅装垫或加套的〕家具装饰商

Sense.DEF: material used to cover chairs
the process of covering chairs with material
the process of keeping something in good condition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most of the money is spent on the upkeep of the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱大部分用于大楼的维护。

Sense.DEF: the cost or process of looking after a child or animal and giving them the things they need
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poorer people find it hard to pay for their pet’s upkeep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济不宽裕的人难以负担养宠物的开销。

Sense.DEF: the parts of a country that are away from the sea and are higher than other areas
an increase in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an uplift in sales
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 销量的增长

Sense.DEF: a feeling of happiness and hope
to make someone feel happier
to make something higher
feeling happier and more hopeful
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt uplifted by her presence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的出现让他觉得精神振奋。

Sense.DEF: raised upwards
making you feel happier and more hopeful
Sense.EXAMPLE: an uplifting experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人振奋的经历

Sense.DEF: an electric light that shines upwards
if information, a computer program etc uploads, or if you upload it, you move it from a small computer to a computer network so that other people can see it or use it
Sense.TRAN: (使)〔信息﹑计算机程序等〕上载﹐上传
Sense.EXAMPLE: It might take a while for this to upload.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上载这个可能要花些时间。

Sense.DEF: information, com­puter programs etc that have been uploaded, or the process of uploading them
Sense.TRAN: 上载[上传]的信息[计算机程序等]﹔上载﹐上传
Sense.EXAMPLE: tips on handling file uploads
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于如何上传文件的提示

Sense.DEF: designed for or used by people who have a lot of money
Sense.TRAN: 高端市场的﹐适合高消费阶层的﹐高档的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an upmarket restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高档餐厅

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a brand that’s moved upmarket it is trying to attract richer people
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 转向高端市场的品牌

Sense.DEF: used to mean ‘on’ or ‘onto’
Sense.TRAN: 在…上面〔与 on 或 onto 的意思相同〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an honour bestowed upon the association
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 授予该协会的荣誉
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are completely dependent upon your help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们完全依赖你的帮助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brandon threw him upon the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布兰登把他摔倒在地。

Sense.DEF: if a time or event is upon you, it is about to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Winter is almost upon us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬天即将来临。

Sense.LEXUNIT: layer upon layer/mile upon mile etc
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that there are a lot of layers, miles etc
Sense.TRAN: 一层又一层/一英里又一英里等〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: mile upon mile of golden sand
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绵延数英里的金色沙滩

Crossrefto.REFLEX: take it upon yourself to do sth

Sense.DEF: in a higher position than something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: the upper lip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上唇

Sense.DEF: near or at the top of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the upper floors of a building
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼的高层
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is an upper age limit for becoming a pilot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当飞行员有年龄上限。

Sense.DEF: to have more power than someone else, so that you are able to control a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police have gained the upper hand over the drug dealers in the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方在与该地区的毒品贩子的较量中占据了上风。

Sense.DEF: more important than other parts or ranks in an organization, system etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某一机构﹑体系等中〕较高级的﹐较重要的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the upper echelonsthe most important members of corporate management
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司管理人员中的高层

Sense.DEF: further from the sea or further north than other parts of an area
Sense.EXAMPLE: the upper reaches of the Nile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼罗河的上游

Sense.DEF: the top part of a shoe that covers your foot
Sense.EXAMPLE: leather uppers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮鞋帮

Sense.DEF: illegal drugs that make you feel happy and give you a lot of energy
to have very little money
letters written in capitals (A, B, C) rather than in small form (a, b, c)
the group of people who belong to the highest social class
Sense.TRAN: 上流社会﹐上层社会﹐上等阶层

Sense.DEF: a student in the last two years of a school or university
a female student in the last two years of school or university
the group of people who belong to the highest social class
a way of hitting someone in which you swing your hand up into their chin
a group of representatives in a country’s parliament, that is smaller and less powerful than the country’s lower house, for example the British House of Lords
if something is uppermost in your mind, you think about it a lot because it is very important to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: A feeling of pity for David was uppermost in her mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对戴维的同情在她心中占主要位置。

Sense.DEF: more important than anything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The one word which seems to be uppermost in every discussion is money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每次讨论都好像只有一个字最重要﹐那就是“钱”。

Sense.DEF: higher than anything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: the uppermost windows of the house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子最上面的窗户

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She turned her hand over, palm uppermost.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把手翻过来﹐手掌朝上。

Sense.DEF: the classes of a school in Britain that are for older students, usually aged 14 to 18
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国学校中为 14 至 18 岁学生开设的〕高中班

Sense.DEF: behaving as if you are more important than you really are, or not showing someone enough respect
Sense.TRAN: 傲慢的﹐自大的﹐盛气凌人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: uppity kids
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目中无人的小孩

Sense.DEF: raised or lifted up – used especially about someone’s hand or arm
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指手或手臂〕举起的﹐扬起的

Sense.DEF: standing or sitting straight up
Sense.TRAN: 〔站或坐得〕笔直的[地]﹐挺直的[地]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The chimpanzee stood upright and grasped the bars of its cage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑猩猩直立着﹐抓住笼子的铁栅。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Katie was still awake, sitting bolt uprightsitting with her back very straight staring at the television.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯蒂还醒着﹐坐得笔直﹐眼睛盯着电视。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He pulled himself upright and faced me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他直起身面对我。

Sense.DEF: placed in a vertical position pointing in a line that is at an angle of 90˚ to a flat surface
Sense.TRAN: 竖直的[地]﹐垂直的 [地]﹐直立的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your seat should be in the upright position when the plane is landing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机降落时应调直座椅靠背。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep the bottle upright.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让瓶子立着。

Sense.DEF: always behaving in an honest way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a good honest upright man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是位诚实﹑正直的好人。

Sense.DEF: a long piece of wood or metal that stands straight up and supports something
a piano with strings that are in a vertical position
an attempt by a group of people to change the government, laws etc in an area or country
Sense.EXAMPLE: a popular uprisingby the ordinary people in a country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平民暴动
Sense.EXAMPLE: an armed uprising
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 武装起义

Sense.DEF: away from the sea towards the place where a river begins
a lot of noise or angry protest about something
