GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house was in an uproar, with babies crying and people shouting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子里有婴儿在哭﹐还有人在大叫﹐一片嘈杂。

Sense.DEF: very noisy, because a lot of people are laughing or shouting
Sense.EXAMPLE: an uproarious party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喧闹的聚会

Sense.DEF: to pull a plant and its roots out of the ground
to make someone leave their home for a new place, especially when this is difficult or upsetting
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕迁移到他处居住〔尤在此举会造成困难或令人苦恼时使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He rejected the idea of uprooting himself and moving to America.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他放弃了迁居美国的想法。

Sense.DEF: relating to people from a high social class who have a lot of money
Sense.TRAN: 适合高消费阶层的﹐高档的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an affluent upscale audience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富裕的高消费观众

Sense.DEF: unhappy and worried because something unpleasant or disappointing has happened
Sense.TRAN: 不快的﹐心烦意乱的﹐烦恼的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was deeply upset about the way her father treated her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲那样对她﹐她非常难过。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Debbie was upset that he didn’t spend more time with her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有花更多的时间陪自己﹐黛比觉得不快。

Sense.DEF: if you are upset with someone, you are angry and annoyed with them
Sense.TRAN: 生某人的气﹐对某人感到不快
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re not still upset with me, are you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不是还在生我的气吧？

Sense.DEF: an illness that affects the stomach and makes you feel sick
to make someone feel unhappy or worried
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t do anything that would upset him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别做惹他生气的事情。

Sense.DEF: to change a plan or situation in a way that causes problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chemicals upset the balance of the environment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些化学品破坏了环境的平衡。

Sense.DEF: to push something over without intending to
Sense.EXAMPLE: He upset a bowl of soup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打翻了一碗汤。

Sense.DEF: to defeat an opponent who is considered to bemuch better than you
Sense.TRAN: 〔出人意料地〕打败〔实力远超自己的对手〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jones upset the 40th-ranked American, Cunningham.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼斯出人意料地打败了排名第 40 位的美国选手坎宁安。

Sense.DEF: to completely spoil someone’s plans
to affect your stomach and make you feel sick
Sense.EXAMPLE: The soup was revolting and upset my stomach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那汤令人作呕﹐让我的肠胃很不舒服。

Sense.DEF: worry and unhappiness caused by an unexpected problem
Sense.TRAN: 〔由意外之事引起的〕忧虑﹔烦闷﹔苦恼
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you are the victim of a burglary, the emotional upset can affect you for a long time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果家里被盗﹐烦恼不安的心情会影响你很长时间。

Sense.DEF: when a person or team defeats an opponent who is considered to be much better than them
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育比赛等中〕意外的结果﹐爆冷门
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a major upset when the young skater took the gold medal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位年轻的滑冰运动员夺得了金牌﹐爆了个大冷门。

Sense.DEF: an illness that affects the stomach and makes you feel sick
the final result of a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The upshot was that after much argument they all agreed to help her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后的结果是﹐经过长时间争论﹐他们全都同意帮助她。

Sense.DEF: the positive part of a situation that is generally bad
Sense.TRAN: 〔不利局面中〕好的一面﹐积极面
Sense.EXAMPLE: The upside of the whole thing is that we got a free trip to Jamaica.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个事情的好处是我们得到一次免费去牙买加的机会。

Sense.DEF: on the side of someone’s head etc
with the top at the bottom and the bottom at the top
Sense.EXAMPLE: To get the plant out of the pot, turn it upside down and give it a gentle knock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果要把植物从盆里取出来﹐就把花盆翻过来﹐轻轻敲一下。

Subsense.DEF: to make a place very untidy when you are looking for something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The burglars have turned our house upside down.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小偷把我们家翻了个底朝天。

Subsense.DEF: to cause a lot of change and confusion in a situation or in someone’s life
Subsense.TRAN: 给〔局面或某人的生活〕造成大变化[混乱]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the story of a young girl whose life was turned upside down
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讲一个年轻女孩生活遭遇重大变故的故事

Sense.DEF: in a position with the top at the bottom and the bottom at the top
Sense.EXAMPLE: an upside down U shape
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 倒置的 U 形

Sense.DEF: to become larger in size, amount etc, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you want me to upsize your fries?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要我帮你换成大份的薯条吗？

Sense.DEF: improving the skills of workers, usually through training, so that they will be better at their jobs
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常指通过培训实现的〕技能的提高

Sense.DEF: to do something that takes people’s attention away from someone else who is more important
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the big-name stars were upstaged by 12-year-old Katy Rochford.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的大明星都被12岁的凯蒂·罗奇福德抢去了风头。

Sense.DEF: towards the back of the stage in a theatre
towards or on an upper floor in a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: I went upstairs and had a shower.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上楼冲了个澡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s upstairs in bed feeling ill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身体不舒服﹐在楼上躺着。

Sense.DEF: one or all of the upper floors in a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like to see the upstairs?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要不要看看楼上？

Sense.DEF: honest and responsible
Sense.EXAMPLE: upstanding young men and women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正直的青年男女

Sense.DEF: standing upright or pointing upwards
used in a formal situation such as a law court to tell people to stand up as a sign of respect for an important person
Sense.TRAN: 起立〔用于法庭等正式场合﹐要求人们站起来以示对某重要人物的尊重〕

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves as if they were more important than they really are and who shows a lack of respect towards people who are more experienced or older
Sense.TRAN: 目中无人的新人[年轻人]﹔自命不凡的家伙
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cheeky young upstart
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个无礼的后生小子

Sense.DEF: in the northern part of a particular state
Sense.EXAMPLE: upstate New York
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约州的北部地区

Sense.DEF: along a river, in the opposite direction from the way the water is flowing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fish instinctively fight their way upstream against the current.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鱼本能地奋力逆流而上。

Sense.DEF: a sudden increase

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was an upsurge in violence during June and July.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 六七月间暴力事件急剧增多。

Sense.DEF: a sudden strong feeling

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a genuine upsurge of religious feeling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然生发出一种非常强烈的宗教情绪。

Sense.DEF: an improvement or increase in the level of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an upswing in economic growth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济增速加快

Sense.DEF: to be slow or fast at understanding something
the number of people who use a service or accept something that is offered
Sense.TRAN: 接受〔某种服务或某事物〕的人数
Sense.EXAMPLE: The uptake of some vaccinations fell as the media stirred up fears of possible side effects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体激起了人们对疫苗可能产生副作用的恐惧之后﹐有些疫苗的注射人数下降了。

Sense.DEF: the rate at which a sub­stance is taken into the body, a system etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the uptake of sugars by the blood
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 血液对糖分的吸收率

Sense.DEF: moving or happening at a fast rate
Sense.EXAMPLE: music with an up-tempo beat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快节奏的音乐

Sense.DEF: behaving in an angry way because you are feeling nervous and worried

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You have to learn to laugh instead of getting uptight about things.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 遇事不要恼怒﹐你要学会笑着面对。

Sense.DEF: having strict traditional attitudes and seeming unable to relax
the period of time when a computer is working normally and is able to be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some customers need 99% or better uptime from their mainframe computers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些客户需要主机有99%或以上的时间能正常运行。

Sense.DEF: including all the latest information

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They have access to up-to-date information through a computer database.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们可以通过计算机数据库获得最新信息。

GramExa.GLOSS: to give someone all the newest information about something
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 给某人提供全部最新信息
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our magazine will keep you up-to-date with fashion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的杂志可以让你即时掌握最新的时尚资讯。

Sense.DEF: modern or fashionable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: up-to-date kitchen equipment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新式的厨房设施

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The old system should be brought up-to-date.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧系统必须更新。

Sense.DEF: including all the latest information
Sense.EXAMPLE: The general lacked up-to-the-minute information at the crucial moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将军在紧要关头缺少即时情报。

Sense.DEF: very modern or fashionable
Sense.EXAMPLE: beach resorts packed with up-to-the-minute facilities and entertainment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有先进设施和新式娱乐活动的海滨度假胜地

Sense.DEF: in or towards an area of a city that is away from the centre, especially one where the streets have larger numbers in their names and where people have more money
Sense.EXAMPLE: He now lives in an apartment a little farther uptown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在住在一套离市中心较远的公寓里。

Sense.DEF: an increase in the level of something, especially in business activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指商业活动的〕增加﹔好转﹔上升﹐提高

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an upturn in the housing market
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房市向好

Sense.EXAMPLE: an economic upturn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济好转

Sense.DEF: pointing or turning upwards
Sense.EXAMPLE: He smiled down into her upturned face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他微笑着俯视她仰起的面孔。

Sense.DEF: turned upside down
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sat on an upturned box.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我坐在一个倒置的盒子上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an upturned boat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 底朝天的小船

Sense.DEF: a type of plastic, used especially to make window frames
Sense.EXAMPLE: UPVC double-glazed windows
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未增塑聚氯乙烯双层玻璃窗

Sense.DEF: increasing to a higher level

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an upward trend in sales
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 销量的上升趋势
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sharp upward movement in property prices
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房价的飙升

Sense.EXAMPLE: upward pressure on bank interest rates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对银行利率的越来越大的压力

Sense.DEF: moving or pointing towards a higher position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stroke the cream onto your skin in an upward direction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把护肤霜在皮肤上轻轻由下向上涂抹。

Sense.DEF: moving up through the social classes and becoming richer
Sense.TRAN: 向较高社会阶层流动的﹐上向流动的﹐向上爬的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the upwardly mobile middle classes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 步步高升的中产阶级

Sense.DEF: moving or pointing towards a higher position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pointing upwards, he indicated a large nest high in the tree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他朝上指指﹐示意树上高处有个大鸟窝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The path began to climb steeply upwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小路开始陡然向上。

Sense.DEF: increasing to a higher level
Sense.EXAMPLE: The expected rate of inflation was revised upwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预期通货膨胀率修正后上调了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prices are moving upwards again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格又要上涨了。

Sense.DEF: more than a particular amount, time etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: children of 14 and upwards
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 14岁及 14 岁以上的儿童
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting was attended by upwards ofover 500 people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有五百余人参加了会议。

Sense.DEF: in the opposite direction to the way the wind is blowing
a heavy white metal that is radioactive and is used to produce nuclear power and nuclear weapons. It is a chemical element: symbol U
Sense.TRAN: 铀〔一种放射性化学元素﹐符号为 U〕

Sense.DEF: the planet that is seventh in order from the Sun
Sense.TRAN: 天王星〔太阳系的第七大行星〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: William Herschel discovered Uranus in 1781.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉·赫舍尔于 1781 年发现了天王星。

Sense.DEF: relating to towns and cities
Sense.EXAMPLE: unemployment in urban areas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市地区的失业状况
Sense.EXAMPLE: the deprived sections of the urban population
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市人口中的贫困群体

Sense.DEF: relating to music such as rap, r & b , reggae etc that is mainly played by black singers and musicians
behaving in a relaxed and confident way in social situations
Sense.TRAN: 温文尔雅的﹐从容不迫的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neil was urbane, witty, direct, and honest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼尔文雅机智﹐坦率诚实。

Sense.DEF: an urbanized country or area has a lot of houses, factories, shops, offices etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家或地区〕城市化的﹐都市化的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the most heavily urbanized regions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市化程度最高的地区

Sense.DEF: in an urbanized society, there are a lot of people who live and work in towns and cities
Sense.EXAMPLE: During the 19th century, Britain became the world’s first modern urbanized society.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在 19 世纪﹐英国成为世界上第一个现代的城市化社会。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the transformation of the social structure by urbanization
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 由城市化引起的社会结构转变

Sense.DEF: a story about an unusual event which happened recently that a lot of people believe, although it is probably not true
Sense.TRAN: 都市神话﹐都市传奇〔指可能不实但人们仍相信的不寻常的事〕

Sense.DEF: the process of improving poor city areas by building new houses, shops etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: an urban renewal program
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市改造计划

Sense.DEF: the spread of city buildings and houses into an area that used to be countryside, or the area in which this has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: planning policies designed to limit the growth of urban sprawl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旨在限制城市扩展的规划政策

Sense.DEF: a poor dirty untidy child
the official lan­guage of Pakistan, also used in India
Sense.TRAN: 乌尔都语〔巴基斯坦的官方语言﹐也用于印度〕

Sense.DEF: used to make nouns that show actions or results
Sense.EXAMPLE: the closure closing of the factory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂的关闭
Sense.EXAMPLE: exposure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴露﹔曝光
Sense.EXAMPLE: failure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失败

Sense.DEF: the tube through which waste liquid flows out of the body from the bladder and also through which the semen of males flows
to strongly suggest that someone does something
Sense.TRAN: 竭力主张﹔强烈要求﹔敦促

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I got a note from Moira urging me to get in touch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我收到莫伊拉的一封短信﹐一定要我保持联系。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He urged that a referendum should be held by December.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他力主 12 月之前举行一次全民投票。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have urged upon him the need for extreme secrecy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我坚决要他绝对保密。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The charity urged quick action.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慈善机构敦促迅速采取行动。

Sense.DEF: formal to make someone or something move by shouting, pushing them etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He urged her forward, his hand under her elbow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他托着她的胳膊肘﹐推她往前走。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She began urging him towards the front door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始把他往前门推。

Sense.DEF: to encourage a person or animal to work harder, go faster etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Urged on by the crowd, the Italian team scored two more goals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受到观众的激励﹐意大利队又进了两球。

Sense.DEF: a strong wish or need
Sense.TRAN: 强烈的欲望﹔迫切的要求﹔冲动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He could no longer resist the urge to go and see Amanda.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他再也抑制不住去看阿曼达的冲动。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Suddenly she had an overwhelming urge to be with her son.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然﹐她有一种无法抗拒的冲动﹐要和儿子在一起。

Sense.DEF: very important and needing to be dealt with immediately
Sense.TRAN: 紧急的﹐急迫的﹐需迅速处理的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was in urgent need of medical attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他急需治疗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report called for urgent action to reduce lead in petrol.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告呼吁迅速采取行动﹐减少汽油中的铅含量。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an urgent message
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一封急报

Sense.DEF: done or said in a way that shows that you want something to be dealt with immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: an urgent whisper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 急切的私语

Sense.DEF: said when you have seen, heard or tasted something that you think is extremely unpleasant
relating to urine
a type of toilet for men to urinate into, usually attached to a wall
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常指固定在墙上的〕男用小便器

Sense.DEF: relating to urine or the parts of your body through which urine passes
Sense.EXAMPLE: the urinary tract
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尿道

Sense.DEF: to get rid of urine from your body
the yellow liquid waste that comes out of the body from the bladder
a website address
Sense.TRAN: 统一资源定位地址﹐URL 地址

Sense.DEF: a decorated container, especially one that is used for holding the ashes of a dead body
a metal container that holds a large amount of tea or coffee
a doctor who treats conditions relating to the urinary system and men’s sexual organs
used by the person speaking or writing to refer to himself or herself and one or more other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please help us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请帮助我们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He arranged for us all to have a drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他安排我们大家一起喝一杯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s invited us both.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们俩她都请了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother is coming to stay with us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妈要来和我们同住。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Send us a donation now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在就给我们捐款吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Life is hard for us women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活对于我们女性来说是艰难的。

Sense.DEF: people in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: Global warming will affect all of us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全球变暖将影响我们所有人。

Sense.DEF: used instead of ‘me’. Many people think this use is incorrect.
Sense.TRAN: 我〔用于代替 me﹐很多人认为这种用法不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give us a kiss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吻我一下。

Sense.DEF: the United States of America
the United States of America
something that is usable can be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: The computer language involved was readily usable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所涉及的计算机语言便于使用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: usable information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可用的资料

Sense.DEF: the way that words are used in a language
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book on modern English usage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于现代英语用法的书

Sense.DEF: the way in which something is used, or the amount of it that is used
Sense.EXAMPLE: Water usage is increasing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用水量在增加。

Sense.DEF: a system used to connect equipment such as a mouse or printer to a computer using wires so that all the equipment can work together
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many USB devices come with their own built-in cable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多 USB 设备都有内置电线。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a USB port
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: USB 端口

Sense.DEF: a small piece of electronic equipment that uses flash memory to store information and can be fitted into a computer
if you use a particular tool, method, service, ability etc, you do something with that tool, by means of that method etc, for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I use your phone?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以用一下你的电话吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll show you which room you can use.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来跟你说一下你可以用哪个房间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always use the same shampoo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直用同一种洗发水。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use your imagination when planning meals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安排三餐时要动点脑筋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She booked the flight using a false name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用化名预订了航班。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Drop-down menus make the program very easy to use.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下拉式菜单使得这个程序使用起来非常简便。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were using animals for scientific experiments.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用动物做科学实验。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bob uses the van for picking up groceries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃用小型货车运送食品杂货。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My parents use the house as a holiday home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母把这房子用作度假屋。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most people now use their cars to go shopping.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在大多数人开车去购物。

Sense.DEF: to take an amount of something from a supply of food, gas, money etc
Sense.TRAN: 使用﹐耗费﹐消耗〔食物﹑煤气﹑金钱等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We use about £40 worth of electricity a month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每月的电费大约40英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Standard washing machines use about 40 gallons of water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一般的洗衣机大约用40加仑的水。

Sense.DEF: to make someone do something for you in order to get something you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can’t you see that Howard is just using you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看不出霍华德只是在利用你吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gerald had been using her for his own ends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰拉尔德一直在利用她来达到自己的目的。

Sense.DEF: to take advantage of a situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She used her position as manager to get jobs for her friends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她利用自己的经理职位为朋友谋职。

Sense.DEF: spoken if you say you could use something, you mean you would really like to have it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could use a drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真想喝一杯。

Sense.DEF: to say or write a particular word or phrase
Sense.EXAMPLE: We use the word ‘hardware’ to describe the actual machine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们使用“硬件”这个词来指机器本身。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t use bad language.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别说脏话粗话。

Sense.DEF: to regularly take illegal drugs

Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you mind if I use your phone?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我用一下你的电话﹐你不介意吧？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They rebuilt the church using local stone.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用当地石料重建了那座教堂。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We use a range of different methods.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要用一系列不同方法。

Exponent.DEF: to use something that is available to you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Staff can make use of a wide range of facilities.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工可使用各种各样的设施。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She made full use of her contacts within the organization.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她充分利用了她在机构中的人脉。

Exponent.DEF: to use a particular method or skill in order to achieve something
Exponent.TRAN: 运用〔某种方法或技能以达到某目的〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The surgeons employed a new technique.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 外科医生们使用了一种新技术。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They employed every means at their disposal every available method.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用尽了一切能用的方法。

Exponent.DEF: to use something that is available to you, for a practical purpose
Exponent.TRAN: 利用〔可获得的某物达到某一目的〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company has developed a new way to utilize solar energy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司开发了一种利用太阳能的新方法。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a better way of utilizing the space
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 更好利用空间的方法

Exponent.DEF: to use something as fully and effectively as possible, or to use something that will give you an advantage over your opponent
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The country’s natural resources have not yet been fully exploited.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的自然资源未被充分利用。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was quick to exploit any weakness in his opponent’s argument.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他能很快地利用对手论点中的弱点。

Exponent.DEF: to use something such as a method, idea, or system in a particular situation
Exponent.TRAN: 应用〔方法﹑观点或系统等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: New technology is being applied to almost every industrial process.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎每一道工序都应用了新技术。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I wanted to apply the things that I had learned on the course.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想运用之前在课程中学到的东西。

Exponent.DEF: to use information, knowledge or experience that you have learned in the past
Exponent.TRAN: 运用〔以前获得的信息﹑知识或经验〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was able to draw on his own experience as a diplomat when he was writing the book.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他写这本书的时候用上了自己当外交官的经历。

Exponent.DEF: to use violence, force, threats etc as a way of achieving something
Exponent.TRAN: 采取﹐诉诸〔暴力﹑武力﹑威胁等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We are prepared to resort to force if necessary.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已做好准备﹐必要时动用武力。

Sense.DEF: to use all of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s used up all the hot water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把热水都用完了。

Sense.DEF: the action or fact of using something
Sense.EXAMPLE: an exit for use in emergencies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧急出口

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the increasing use of computers in education
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑在教育领域中越来越多的使用

Sense.DEF: a purpose for which something can be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: Robots have many different uses in modern industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机器人在现代工业中有多种不同用途。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cupboard is full of things I can never find a use for.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 柜子里放满了我可能永远也用不上的东西。

Sense.DEF: to use something that is available in order to achieve something or get an advantage for yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will make use of her vast experience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将利用她丰富的经验。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is an answering machine for you to make use of.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一个电话答录机你可以用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to make good use of your time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量充分利用时间。

Sense.DEF: to use something such as knowledge or skills for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: a job where her management skills can be put to good use
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以充分施展她管理才能的工作

Sense.DEF: the ability or right to use something
Sense.TRAN: 运用某事物的能力﹔某物的使用权
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe’s given me the use of his office till he gets back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔让我使用他的办公室直到他回来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lost the use of both legs as a result of the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为这场事故﹐他的双腿失去了行动能力。

Sense.DEF: to be completely useless
Sense.EXAMPLE: You needed blankets to keep warm because the heating was no use.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暖气坏了﹐所以你需要盖上毯子保暖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take this – it’s of no use to me any more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拿着这个﹐我再也用不着它了。

Sense.DEF: spoken used to tell someone not to do something because it will have no effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s no use complaining.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抱怨没有用。

Sense.DEF: spoken used to say that you are going to stop doing something because you do not think it will be successful
Sense.TRAN: 白搭！不行！〔用于表示因认为不会成功而要停止做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, it’s no use! I can’t fix it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐不行！我修不好它。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something seems to be a waste of time
Sense.TRAN: (做某事)有什么意义﹐(做某事)有什么用〔用于表示做某事似乎是浪费时间〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the use of decorating the house if we are going to sell it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们既然要卖房子了﹐装修又有什么意义？

Sense.DEF: a machine, place etc that is in use is being used
Sense.EXAMPLE: Electric vehicles built in 1920 were still in use in the 1950s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1920年制造的电车在 50 年代仍在使用。

Sense.DEF: provided for a particular person or group of people to use
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bar for the use of the guests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 供客人使用的酒吧

Sense.DEF: to be useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was charged with having information likely to be of use to terrorists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被控掌握着对恐怖分子可能有用的信息。

Sense.DEF: to start being used, or to start using something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Computers first came into use in the early 1950s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机最早于 20 世纪 50 年代初开始使用。

Sense.DEF: a machine, place etc that goes out of use or is out of use is not being used
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器﹑场所等〕废弃不用﹐不再使用
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some 4,000 railway stations have gone out of use since the 1960s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自 20 世纪 60 年代以来大约有 4,000 座火车站已经废弃不用。

Sense.DEF: to have no respect for someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 厌恶某人/某事物﹐不喜欢某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has no use for people who are always complaining.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她讨厌老是抱怨的人。

Sense.DEF: used, often humorously, to say that something or someone can sometimes be useful, even though it may not seem that way
Sense.TRAN: 某事物/某人自有其用处〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Being stubborn can have its uses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 固执也有固执的好处。

Sense.DEF: one of the meanings of a word, or the way that a particular word is used
to have experienced something so that it no longer seems surprising, difficult, strange etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I do the dishes every day, so I’m used to it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我每天洗盘子﹐所以习惯了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t get used to the idea that you’re grown up now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在你已长大成人﹐但我不习惯这么想。

Sense.DEF: cars, clothes etc that have already had an owner
Sense.EXAMPLE: a used car salesman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 二手车销售员

Sense.DEF: dirty or not in good condition any longer, as a result of being used
Sense.EXAMPLE: a used tissue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用过的纸巾

Sense.DEF: if something used to happen, it happened regularly or all the time in the past, but does not happen now
Sense.TRAN: 过去经常[一直]〔发生〕﹐曾经
Sense.EXAMPLE: He used to go to our school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他曾在我们学校就读。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re eating out more often than we used to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在出去吃饭的次数比以前多了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: did not use to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You didn’t use to eat chips when you were younger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你年轻的时候不吃炸薯条的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You used not to fuss like this.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你以前不是这么大惊小怪的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It never used to bother me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这我以前从不担心。

GramExa.PROPFORM: did sb use to do sth?
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you use to go to church regularly?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你以前经常去教堂吗？

Sense.DEF: if a particular situation used to exist, it existed for a period of time in the past, but does not exist now
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jimmy used to be a friend of mine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉米曾是我的朋友。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There used to be a large car park on this site.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这地方曾经是个大停车场。

GramExa.PROPFORM: did not use to be/do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why are you so bad-tempered? You didn’t use to be like this.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么脾气这么不好？以前你不是这样的。

GramExa.PROPFORM: did sb/sth use to be/do sth?
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did this building use to be a hotel?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座大楼以前是家酒店吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Where did you use to live before you came to Manchester?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你来曼彻斯特之前住在哪里？

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: If you used to do something, you did it regularly or for a period of time in the past. Use the infinitive without ‘to’ after used to , not the past tense.
F2NBox.TRAN: used to do something 表示过去经常做某事﹐或过去某段时间里做过某事。used to 后用不带 to 的不定式﹐而不用过去式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: My dad used to grow vegetables (NOT 不说 used to grew vegetables).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爸爸过去种蔬菜。
F2NBox.EXPL: For talking about a present habit, use usually.
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示现在的习惯要用 usually
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We usually eat (NOT 不说 use to eat) around six.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们通常 6 点前后吃饭。
F2NBox.EXPL: ⁑ Do not confuse ‘I used to do something’ and ‘I’m used to doing something’.
F2NBox.TRAN: 不要混淆 I used to do something 和 I’m used to doing something。

Sense.DEF: helping you to do or get what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: useful information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有用的信息
Sense.EXAMPLE: A little Japanese can be really useful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 懂一点日语非常有用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The space under the desk is useful for storing CDs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 书桌下面的空间可以用来存放激光唱片。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: techniques that could be useful to teachers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对教师可能有用的技巧

Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you come and make yourself usefulhelp people to do something?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能不能过来帮点忙？

Exponent.DEF: something that is useful makes it easier for you to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He gave me some useful advice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给了我一些有用的建议。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a useful thing to know
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 知道了会很有用的事

Exponent.DEF: useful - used especially about something that is convenient and easy to use
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指使用简便的事物〕有用的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a handy little booklet
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本有用的小册子
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The book is full of handy hints.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书里都是有用的建议。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I always keep old jars - you never know when they might come in handybe useful.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总是留着旧罐子——说不定哪天就能用上。

Exponent.DEF: useful because it helps you to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This drug can be helpful in treating depression.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药对治疗抑郁症有帮助。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: helpful advice
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有用的忠告
Exponent.EXAMPLE: helpful suggestions
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有用的建议

Exponent.DEF: if someone or something is of use, they are useful for you when you are doing something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I hope you’ll find the book of use.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你觉得这本书有用。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He wants to be of use.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他希望自己是个有用的人。

Exponent.DEF: if doing something is worthwhile, it is useful for you and you benefit from doing it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The training was certainly worthwhile.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 培训当然有用。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a worthwhile experience
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有益的经历

Exponent.DEF: very useful in helping you do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His information was very valuable to the police.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他提供的信息对警方很有价值。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The course was a valuable experience for me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加这门课程对我来说是一段很宝贵的经历。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a valuable contribution
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝贵的贡献

Exponent.DEF: extremely useful in helping you do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His help was invaluable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的帮助极有价值。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The drug could be invaluable for treating cancer patients.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药对于治疗癌症病人可能极有价值。

Exponent.DEF: someone or something that is indispensable is so useful and important that you cannot do something without them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: For walkers, a good compass is indispensable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对徒步者来说﹐好的指南针是必备的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He became an indispensable part of the team.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已成为队中不可或缺的一员。

Exponent.DEF: to be very useful for doing something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bag is great for taking on holiday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这包度假时很有用。

Sense.DEF: the state of being useful or the degree to which something is useful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are doubts as to the usefulness of this approach it may not be useful.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人怀疑这种方法是否有用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: As a commuter service, the ferry has outlived its usefulnessis no longer useful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一种通勤服务﹐渡船已经没有用武之地了。

Sense.DEF: not useful or effective in any way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor concluded that further treatment would be useless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生下了结论﹐进一步治疗是无益的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a website full of useless information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充斥着无用信息的网站

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Water had got into the radio, and now it was completely useless.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 收音机进了水﹐现在完全不能用了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The land is useless for growing crops.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这片土地种不了庄稼。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is useless to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was useless to complain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 抱怨没有用。

GramExa.GLOSS: not useful and in fact causing harm or problems
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The map was so out-of-date it was worse than useless.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这地图太老了﹐用了比没用还糟糕。

Sense.DEF: unable or unwilling to do anything properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t ask Tim to fix it. He’s completely useless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别叫蒂姆来修理﹐他根本不行。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that uses a product, service etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: road users
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 道路使用者
Sense.EXAMPLE: a computer user
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑用户
Sense.EXAMPLE: library users
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 图书馆的读者

Sense.DEF: someone who takes illegal drugs
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drug users were warned about the dangers of sharing needles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瘾君子们受到警告﹐共用针头非常危险。

Sense.DEF: a tax on a service provided for the public
easy to use, understand, or operate
Sense.EXAMPLE: a user-friendly guide to computing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 易懂的计算机应用指南

Sense.DEF: a group of people who have the same interests and use a particular product or service
a group of people who exchange information on the Internet about computers
Sense.TRAN: 〔因特网上交流计算机信息的〕用户群

Sense.DEF: how a computer program looks on screen and how the user enters commands and information into the program
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机的〕使用者界面﹐用户界面

Sense.DEF: a name or special word that proves who you are and allows you to enter a computer system or use the Internet
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please enter your user name and password and click ‘OK’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请输入用户名和密码﹐然后点击OK键。

Sense.DEF: someone who shows people to their seats at a theatre, cinema, wedding etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔剧院﹑电影院﹑婚礼等的〕引座员﹐迎宾员

Sense.DEF: someone who works in a law court whose job is to guide people in and out of the courtrooms
to help someone to get from one place to another, especially by showing them the way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He ushered her into the room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把她领进屋。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She stood back and ushered him in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她往后退了退﹐领他进去。

Sense.DEF: to cause something new to start, or to be at the start of something new
Sense.EXAMPLE: The discovery of oil ushered in an era of employment and prosperity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油的发现开创了一个就业和繁荣的新时代。

Sense.DEF: a woman who works in a cinema, showing people to their seats
an important US golf competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔高尔夫〕美国大师(锦标)赛﹐美国名人赛

Sense.DEF: a feature of a product that makes it different from other similar products, and therefore more attractive to people who might buy it
happening, done, or existing most of the time or in most situations
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make a cheese sauce in the usual way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按通常的做法做奶酪酱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll meet you at the usual time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在老时间和你碰头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is taking longer than usual for orders to reach our customers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 订购的货品送达顾客手中所需的时间比平时长了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She ate twice as much as usual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她吃了平时食量两倍的东西。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is usual (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s usual to keep records of all expenses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通常都记下所有的开销。

Sense.DEF: in the way that happens or exists most of the time
Sense.EXAMPLE: As usual, they’d left the children at home with Susan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像往常一样﹐他们把孩子留在家里﹐让苏珊带。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They didn’t invite any women, as usual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们照例没有邀请任何女性。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something bad that often happens has just happened again
Sense.EXAMPLE: He just laughed at me, as per usual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他又像平时一样嘲笑我。

Subsense.DEF: used for talking about something that usually happens, is usually done etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘What was he going on about this time?’ ‘Oh, the usual.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这回他又在唠叨什么？” “哦﹐还是那些事情。”

Subsense.DEF: the drink that you usually have, especially in a particular bar
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指在某一酒吧内〕常喝的饮料
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A pint of the usual please, Paul.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按老规矩给我来一品脱﹐保罗。

Sense.DEF: behaving differently from the way you usually behave, especially by seeming worried or upset about something
Sense.TRAN: (某人)和平时不一样〔尤指显得担心或烦恼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keith doesn’t seem his usual self these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些天基思似乎有些反常。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about what happens on most occasions or in most situations
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women usually live longer than men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女人通常比男人长寿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Usually I wear black, grey, or brown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通常我都穿黑色﹑灰色或者棕色的衣服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drive usually takes 15 or 20 minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这段车程通常需要 15 或 20 分钟。

Sense.DEF: someone who lends money to people and makes them pay interest14
a usurious price or rate of interest14 is unfairly high
to take someone else’s power, position, job etc when you do not have the right to
Sense.TRAN: 篡夺﹐夺取〔权力﹑地位﹑工作等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were a couple of attempts to usurp the young king.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屡次有人企图篡夺那位年轻国王的王位。

Sense.DEF: the practice of lending money to people and making them pay interest14
Sense.EXAMPLE: In medieval times, it was illegal for Chris­tians to practise usury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在中世纪﹐基督徒放高利贷是犯法的。

Sense.DEF: a thing such as a knife, spoon etc that you use when you are cooking
Sense.EXAMPLE: kitchen utensils
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房用具

Sense.DEF: the organ in a woman or female mammal where babies develop
intended to be useful and practical rather than attractive or comfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: ugly utilitarian buildings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丑陋但实用的建筑物

Sense.DEF: based on a belief in utilitarianism
the political belief that an action is good if it helps the largest number of people
a service such as gas or electricity provided for people to use
Sense.TRAN: 公用事业〔如煤气﹑电力等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does your rent include utilities?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的房租包括公用事业费吗？

Sense.DEF: a piece of computer software that has a particular use
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a simple shareware utility that allows you to print signs and banners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是个简单的共享应用软件﹐你可以用它来打印标牌和横幅。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being useful, or the degree to which something is useful
a tall wooden pole for supporting telephone and electric wires
a room in a house where washing machines, freezers etc are kept
Sense.TRAN: 〔放置洗衣机﹑冰箱等的〕杂物室﹐家用器具存放室

Sense.DEF: to use something for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must consider how best to utilize what resources we have.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须考虑怎样充分利用现有的资源。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say use rather than utilize.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 use﹐而不说 utilize
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The money will be used to build a new sports hall.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱将用来建造一座新的体育馆。

Sense.DEF: the greatest possible importance etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a matter of the utmost importance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极重要的事情
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have the utmost respect for her accomplishments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对她的成就充满敬意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Baldwin treated the matter with the utmost seriousness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍德温极其认真地对待这件事。

Sense.DEF: the most that can be done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both runners had pushed themselves to the utmost.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个赛跑运动员都尽了最大努力。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The medical staff did their utmosttried as hard as they could to save the patient’s life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医护人员竭尽全力挽救那位病人的生命。

Sense.DEF: an imaginary perfect world where everyone is happy
Sense.TRAN: 乌托邦〔想象中的完美世界〕

Sense.DEF: complete – used especially to emphasize that something is very bad, or that a feeling is very strong
Sense.TRAN: 完全的﹐十足的﹐彻底的〔用于强调事物糟糕或感情强烈〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s utter nonsense!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真是一派胡言！
Sense.EXAMPLE: This company treats its employees with utter contempt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司对其员工不屑一顾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I watched in complete and utter horror as he pulled out a gun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我惊恐万分地看着他拔出枪来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: fifteen years of utter confusion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 15年的大混乱

Sense.DEF: to say something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You fool!’ she uttered in disgust.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你这个傻瓜！”她厌恶地说道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cantor nodded without uttering a word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坎托默不作声地点点头。

Sense.DEF: to make a sound with your voice, especially with difficulty
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wounded prisoner uttered a groan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受伤的囚犯发出一声呻吟。

Sense.DEF: something you say
Sense.EXAMPLE: Politicians are judged by their public utterances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们根据政治家公开的言论来评判他们。

Sense.DEF: the action of saying something
completely – used especially to emphasize that something is very bad, or that a feeling is very strong
Sense.TRAN: 完全地﹐十足地〔用于强调事物糟糕或感情强烈〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You look utterly miserable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看起来很痛苦。

Sense.DEF: a turn that you make in a car, on a bicycle etc, so that you go back in the direction you came from
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车﹑自行车等的〕U 形转弯﹐180 度转弯﹐掉头

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He made a quick U-turn and sped away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他迅速掉了个头﹐飞快地开走了。

Sense.DEF: a complete change of ideas, plans etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔观念﹑计划等的〕彻底改变﹐180 度大转变

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Critics accused the government of doing a U-turn on its promise to increase education spending.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 批评者指责政府彻底违背增加教育开支的承诺。

Sense.DEF: UV light cannot be seen by people, but is responsible for making your skin darker when you are in the sun

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the sun’s harmful UV rays
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光中有害的紫外线

Sense.DEF: a small soft piece of flesh which hangs down from the top of your mouth at the back
